campaign.story:
Social Stretch Goal
Backers unlocked a Mint Factory building card for the Deluxe Edition!
                      Penny Lane is a worker placement game for 2-4 players in which players compete to build the most prosperous city avenue. You can build housing, stores like a Confectioners, workshops like a Cobblers, and attractions like a Penny Arcade! You'll also want to move your citizens from their residences to find work in the businesses along your lane, to earn points and generate income. Penny Lane also has a tableau-building component, where players can get bonus points or currency by aligning their buildings with different "links." 
Every player builds their own lane. Every lane, and every game is unique!
Each round consists of an action phase followed by an upkeep phase. In the action phase, a player can either select a Main Street action or pass. The action phase repeats until each player has passed. To take a Main Street action, a player must choose from the communal Main Street cards, and place the required number of pennies on the open action space. The player then carries out the effect of that card. Possible actions include purchasing a building (Masons' Guild), moving a citizen into a job vacancy (The Gazette), rearranging buildings (Tower), or claiming the Mayor meeple to become the new 1st player (Town Hall).
Eight "Main Street" cards have action spaces to place pennies or citizens. The Mason's Guild lets you gain new building cards for your lane.
Each player places their purchases buildings on their lane. If they're able to connect a penny link, they get an extra penny at the end of each upkeep phase. If they're able to connect a victory point link, they get an extra victory point at the end of the game. In the upkeep phase, all players gain 1 penny. 
Each player's lane begins with a central board that grants them a penny and a citizen during every upkeep phase.
Players then resolve all effects in their lane as indicated by the upkeep symbol and their penny links. The final round is triggered when a player achieves 10 victory points (stars) on their lane, and after that round the player with the most victory points wins!

For more information read the rulebook, or watch the preview videos on this page. Thanks!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Sparkworks was launched as an imprint of Game Salute LLC in 2018. At Sparkworks, we create games for friends and family to enjoy together, with titles ranging from casual to party to games inspired by the wonder of our world, such as the award-winning "Planetarium." We also release licensed titles, such as our series of games based on the timeless classic "The Princess Bride."

Our team has delivered hundreds of successful Kickstarter products since 2012, including our own published titles and those we've helped independent publishers run and fulfill. While printing, shipping, and processing delays are always a possibility, we have set a reasonable delivery date based on our experience.

Refunds – Kickstarter 
If you'd like a refund before your item ships, you have until one week before the scheduled ship date to request one. We can offer you a 90% refund since Kickstarter retains about 10% of your pledge for various fees. If there is something wrong with your item, we appreciate the opportunity to replace or exchange it. If a refund is preferred and there is no defect with the product, you'll be responsible for shipping it back to us. Upon receipt of the returned item, we'll issue you a 90% refund. Refund requests must be made within 30 days of the date the item was delivered to you.

Replacements 
We are always happy to replace defective or damaged dice, cards, or other components. Just use our replacements form at sparkworks.fun/replacements and provide photos of the damage, and we will ship a replacement at no additional cost to you. If your item needs to be returned, we will cover the cost of the return shipping. We provide replacement pieces while titles are active in our catalog, which is typically at least a year after their initial printing. Replacement requests must be made within 30 days of the date the item was delivered to you.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello all,
As of July 11, 2019 we have successfully picked, packed, and shipped all reward packages for Penny Lane!
We send a shipping notification email for each package when it goes through our local processing facility. If it’s been a few days since this update was posted and you have not seen your notification email, please check your spam folder. If you have further questions about your shipment, please contact help@shipnaked.com.

Hello all,
Our awesome inventory team was able to get our shipment processed super quickly, so as of July 2, 2019, we are have begun to pick, pack, and ship reward packages out to you.
You should receive a shipping notification to the email you included in your pledge manager when your package label is printed or scanned through the local facility.

Hello everyone,
I wanted to let you know that our cargo has been received at our warehouse, and our awesome team on the ground is in the process of unpacking, inspecting, and entering everything into inventory. They've let me know that fulfillment should be able to start before the end of this week. I'll be back with another update to let you know as soon as we've started! Thanks!

Hello all,
We're pleased to report that production has wrapped, and our shipment has left the factory and is making its way across the ocean to us. It usually takes between 4-6 weeks for the ship to reach port, clear customs, and for the cargo to make its way to our warehouse. We will let you know when fulfillment is starting in the coming weeks as our shipment gets closer. Thanks everyone!

Hello all,
We're happy to report that production on Penny Lane has been going smoothly and should wrap up in a couple weeks. We're anticipating our shipment leaving the factory the first week of May, which would put fulfillment in June. I'll be back with another update next month, hopefully announcing that our shipment is on the water! Thanks everyone!
— Brenna

Hello all,
We're happy to report that after approving our pre-production samples, mass production has begun! Our factory has advised that production should take until the end of April. As it takes several weeks for a shipment to reach us across the ocean and to get through customs, that puts fulfillment in late May/early June. 
I'm hoping that my next update will be to tell you all that production has wrapped and our shipment has left the factory :) Thanks everyone!

Greetings backers,
We just returned from a great trip to China where we able to visit our printer and check in on the status of Penny Lane. There were two components we had only gotten to see in photos/videos before, so we were eager to see them! Those were of course the deluxe mayor meeple and the gilded tokens.

Hello all,
This is just a friendly reminder that the BackerKit will be closing soon! Orders will be locked tomorrow, Thursday Feb. 14. It will not be possible to make changes to your order after this date, so please make sure your order is complete and your address is correct. Cards will be charged on Friday Feb. 15. You can log in to BackerKit here.
Our factory is currently on break for Chinese New Year so there is not much news to report, but we are looking forward to getting our first off the line copy soon and wrapping mass production shortly thereafter. Thanks everyone!

Greetings Backers,
As we are going through mass production, it is now time to think about closing down the BackerKit! BackerKit orders must be completed by Thursday, February 14 2018. If you late pledged in BackerKit, upgraded your order, or added any items to your order, cards will be charged on Friday, February 15 2018. If you pledged through Kickstarter and did not make changes to your order, you were already charged in Kickstarter, so there would not be any additional charges. Even still, you should check to make sure that your order is confirmed and your address has been updated.

Hello all,
The Great Insert Saga of 2018 is drawing to a close :) The insert will be staying in the box. If you are inclined to throw it away, please recycle it if you are able. Due to the insert staying in the box, there will not be a custom interior box wrap.
Thanks,

campaign.story:
Neverland is in peril as Captain Hook has kidnapped many of its inhabitants! It is up to Peter Pan (with the help of Tink and the Darling children of course!) to find and rescue their friends. Who will win in this battle for control of the land where you never grow up?
Whether we just fund or we end up crushing through in the final week, we plan to produce a high quality game. Regardless of the level of funding we have a lot of great plans for the components involved in the game. 
Here are some of the upgrades we would like to include!
 We will also be upgrading cardstock and punchboard to high quality!
 The Neverland Rescue is an asymmetrical game in which one player takes on the role of our hero Peter Pan and the other takes on the role of the treacherous Captain Hook. Hook receives clues and uses their dastardly henchmen to determine the final 5 hideouts of Peter Pan and their companions. Peter Pan will be attempting to rescue their captured friends and save the land they love while keeping their remaining companions safe. All the while, players will feel the pull of their belief in Fairies, which can also lead to a victory in Neverland. To join the rescue, just head to the second star to the right, and straight on 'til morning!
 Hook's Deduction
Curious how Hook decides which of Pan's Hideouts to raid?  The clues they receive will give tips on which Hideouts Pan has. here is a sample of in-game clues:

updates.update_userinfo: Fulfillment will begin in the next week!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone, I hope you have been well! We have good news for you today, all of the games should be arriving at our US fulfillment center TODAY!  The games need to be unpacked and prepared before fulfillment begins but we expect this to start by next week! So US backers should be receiving their games within 1-3 weeks. 
The games heading for international should be arriving at their fulfillment center next week, so we expect fulfillment of those games to be another 1-2 weeks after the US fulfillment, meaning games will be shipping within 2 weeks and received 2-3 more weeks after that!

updates.update_userinfo: The games are on the boat and heading our way!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone, I hope the new year is treating you well!
  I come bearing excellent news, the games boarded a boat on January 4th and are expected to arrive here in the states on January 27th! Everything is moving as scheduled and we are looking at a mid February fulfillment as long as nothing major arises in the meantime! I will be locking down addresses in 48 hours, so be sure to check that you both filled out your survey and that your address is correct. Other than that, there is no major news to report!

updates.update_userinfo: Games are printed and being readied for a boat!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone, we have some super exciting news to report!

Last we spoke, I had received the proof copy of Neverland Rescue and it looked awesome! After approving that, printing commenced. All of the games are now printed and I just received the final production copy in the mail yesterday. It. Looks. Spectacular! One item we had not seen prior to this print was the card sleeves, and we are so happy with them along with all of the other great items! Everything came out exactly as we had hoped for this game...so the big question now is WHEN ARE YOU ALL GOING TO GET YOUR GAMES?!?!?!?!?

updates.update_userinfo: Games are printing and we are getting closer and closer!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!  
I Just wanted to reach out and update you this month on where everything is in production for this game. Since we have received the proof copy (our last update) we have approved the printing and production has started. We expect printing to be completed by Dec 10th with an absolute worst case scenario date of Dec 24th. We have already connected our freight forwarder with the printer so that we can get the games on a boat as soon as they are completed. We are right on track with our original estimates for delivery with it looking like we will most likely be fulfilling pretty early!

updates.update_userinfo: Proof copy is in our hands!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!  
I have some very good news to share with you! We received out proof copy of the game this week and they look SPECTACULAR! The game definitely is going to be one of our best quality produced games and we could not be happier with how it has turned out (For pictures scroll to the end of this update).  
Any changes we need to make at this point are super minor, which means mass printing will be starting ASAP and we will continue right on schedule! For those who have not updated your address, please be sure to do so ASAP so we can start preparing all of our post production fulfillment. Expect to hear from me again in early to mid-November with updates on how production is going. Please reach out if you have any questions or if you need anything from us and we are so happy to be one step closer to getting this awesome game in your hands!

Hello Neverlanders!
I just wanted to touch base for a monthly update. As of right now anyone who backed for extra games (our older releases) should have received them. They all shipped about 3-4 weeks ago and should have all been delivered, so keep an eye out for them and make sure you received everything that you ordered.

As far as updates about production, everything is just in process right now. All of the files were submitted to the printer, we have paid for the print run and we are just waiting right now for the proof copy. We are hoping to receive it soon but I did not want to wait any longer on updating you as I have no set date as to when I will receive the proof copy.

As soon as I receive the proof copy and ensure everything is good, I will post an update with the status and all sorts of pretty pictures! We have also worked to establish a tentative timeline with the printer and hope that (as long as everything goes smoothly ::knocks on wood::) we expect to deliver a few months early, which is super great news!

Hi everyone, 
I hope your summer has been going well. It has been about 1 month since I last updated and wanted to keep you up to date on everything.
During this part of the process there usually is not a whole lot to update on so I will keep this short and sweet! 

1) Surveys are out!

WE DID IT! I cannot thank you all enough for your amazing support during this campaign. This campaign had its ups and downs but you were there with us through it and this awesome game is going to be made now!

campaign.story:
How do you feel about your neighbours? Do you like them? Do you even know them? What are they doing right now? Wouldn't it be nice not to have any? Or, are they there when you need to borrow something?
Well, you might like them, or you might not. But one thing is certain. You probably would not appreciate it if they stepped into your garden when you're away on holiday and try to mess with it, right?
This, and managing his bee population is what Mr. Cabbagehead has to deal with in between holidays, when he is planting his garden in anticipation of the Garden Committee's visit.
Join us in creating this beautiful game full of victorian-era illustrations, some of which are not pleasantly disturbing. Join us in Mr. Cabbahead's Garden!
Mr. Cabbagehead's garden is a simple, yet sometimes frustratingly challenging game. It is designed by Todd Sanders, who was inspired by a day spent in the library looking at books of victorian seed catalogs that featured some very quirky anthropomorphic vegetables
Combining his love of gardening and his passion for unconventional game design, he created a game to match the style of these lovable curmudgeons that beckoned Victorians to garden.
Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden was first released as a solo-play-only Print & Play that quickly intrigued gamers on BoardGameGeek, and has been played and enjoyed as such since 2016.
Since then Todd has continuously refined the game, and after a period of development within LudiCreations, we are pleased to be able to present it for a high-quality print run, as befits a game as iconic as this.
Improvements include rules for 2 players, a rebalancing of point values, a clarification of the flow of the game and an update of the graphic design. Combined with endowing it with high quality materials such as linen-finished cards and cardboard, the boxed commercial release of Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden is something we are very proud to bring to you.  
In doing so, we would like to complete Todd's vision and offer game new content. This includes The New Neighbours, 6 new tiresome busybodies who can't wait to mess with Mr. C's beautiful garden. It also includes the Grasshopper expansion, and the Romancing Eudora expansion.
All cardboard is 2 mm thick, and all cards are 320 gsm. All surfaces are linen-finished.
 We have partnered with Dogmight, your friendly local viking berserker woodworkers to bring you something they are clearly crazy enough and talented enough to even dare to make:
The ultra-deluxe custom-made wooden Prestige Box
 For more details, please check out this backer update!
In Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden you will be planting your garden in a 3 x 6 grid of Vegetable cards. In each of the game's 3 rounds there is a Planting phase and a Neighbour phase.
In the Planting phase, you draw 3 cards from the deck of Vegetables. You plant one in the garden grid, and then draw Neighbour tokens according to the values of the other two cards.
In the Neighbour phase, the Neighbour with the most matching tokens is the one who visits and interferes with the garden, removing or moving Vegetable cards.
At the end of the game, the garden is ready for evaluation. The more vegetables of the same kind you have, the better! And if you really want the coveted Blue Ribbon, you better arrange them in aestheticallly pleasing patterns!
For more detail, here's Bebo with a rules overview:
Each of the included expansions also adds something, ranging from a huge jump in variability with the 6 New Neighbours, to an increase in difficulty with the Grasshoppers and a modular bonus possibilities with Romancing Eudora. All that and more are explained in the rules linked below.
As usual, we offer you the chance to try the game before you back the campaign. The game has been implemented on Tabletopia, and you can play for free here:
You can download the rules of the game here (5 MB, right click and Save as…). Please download this file, as PDFs viewed in-browser may not be displayed properly. This file is the low-resolution version of the rules document. If you find any mistakes, please use this form to submit them: https://goo.gl/forms/jTFX4bDRvO7cuejD2
Please note that the following videos depict prototype components, some of which may be fairly old. The game has been developed over a period of years, both in its graphic design and in the values of various cards and scoring bonuses.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HnApjD6C8zw
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qhYYm7vxogc
Runthrough: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K24hexXxlaY
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ICW4QfIRUy0
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RKOWvolaC60
Todd Sanders lives in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, where he works as a graphic designer, publisher and furniture maker. Todd is well known as a designer of solo board games. Many of his games have already been published, including IUNU and They Who Were 8, the first two in the Sanders Select Series of games by Ludicreations.
Even though Todd has been designing games for several years, he has never been at Spiel. This, even after 2 of his games have debuted there. Travel & accommodation there are not cheap, as we have certainly experienced in the past few years.
Given that this year Todd expects to see at least 2 more games being published and shown there, we wanted to do what we can so he can get to Essen, and with your help we hope to cover some of his expenses.
If you would like to contribute and get some really special rewards prepared by Todd, simply pledge at the $34 level. Todd and we would be very, very grateful for your support!
The special rewards include:
A postcard from by Todd, signed & sent to you!
A special promo Neighbour for Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden. This will be designed in full view of backers of that level. We do not like exclusives, but if we sell it later, we will give profits to Todd.
5 Daily vlogs from Essen, right from the exhibitor floor, and possibly some other places too! Probably not live, since the connection there is terrible.
Playing a game with Todd! Quite a few of Todd's games are on Tabletopia, and they are free to play. At some point or another, Todd will play a game with you, either one-on-one or as part of a group. This would have to be up to Todd's availability and time zone issues. LudiCreations games on Tabletopia are free to play!
Please note that there is always the possibility that due to any unforeseen circumstances, Todd does not make it to Essen. If that happens, we will still be able to fulfill the above in the best way we can. Postcards can still be sent, promos made, vlogging from Todd might be from his design space, and Tabletopia is still happening as it normally would.
We expect to fulfill the rewards bound for the USA from within the USA, and the rewards bound for EU and other countries from Germany. EU backers do not have to worry about customs or VAT.
Shipments to backers outside of the EU and the USA will have 16 EUR declared as the value of the package. That's roughly equivalent to 19 USD / 25 CAD / 25 AUD / 19 CHF / 2101 JPY. Note that we can not be responsible for any customs fees.
We will be using Backerkit as our post-campaign fulfillment suite and pre-order management platform, through which additional copies may be obtained.
Unfortunately, we are not able to make bulk shipments.
We are not able to ship to some countries during the campaign. If your country does not appear on the list after you click the reward in which you are interested, please send us a message via KS.
The Prestige Box will be shipped separately from the game material, from the USA. Note that we can not be responsible for any customs fees related to it.
The shipping cost for the game is 5 USD worldwide.
The shipping costs for the Prestige Box are:
USA: 12 USD
Canada: 25 USD
Other countries: 35 USD
IMPORTANT: Do not add these costs to your pledge! We will collect the shipping cost after the campaign, via Backerkit.
Regrettably, we can not offer pickup at Spiel in Essen or any other convention.
What You See Is What You Get - this is our doctrine, and we like to run simple, straightforward campaigns. We are aware that stretch goals would increase the funding total. However, we have already thrown everything into this game - a lot of time, effort, and money. We already go to print with the highest quality materials.
We also want to offer the game at the cheapest cost possible - and that is incompatible with stretch goals. We'd have to add "hidden" profit in the pledge levels that we can then "spend" to give you stretch goals - nothing is for "free". Therefore, raising money beyond our goal does not give us extra money on hand to create stretch goals.
Furthermore, because the games are made in Europe in a small print run, we do not benefit from economies of scale by producing a few more copies of the game.
Retail availability: We have no idea. This is a weird game. Past experience shows that this type of game rarely finds its way to stores, but we can not make any guarantees either way.
SPIEL availability: We intend to sell the game at the SPIEL trade fair in Essen. We do not yet know the price, but we are confident we will have very few copies there.
Finally, we do not pay anyone to give an opinion on our games.
 Game design, graphic design, visual identity: Todd Sanders
Tabletopia implementation: Viktor Csete
Audiovisual support: Sonja Hatanpää, Toni Heinonen
Special Thanks: Dimitris "JamesH" Chatzidimitriou, Brittanie "Bebo" Boe, Paul "GamingRules" Grogan, those Victorian illustrators, and many, many more.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All 2017 campaigns have been fulfilled. The CRISIS: The New Economy campaign is in the production phase. We are working with a manufacturer we have worked with before, and we are confident in our ability to deliver the game and any additional materials. That said, unforeseen events may affect how quickly fulfillment is conducted, and the final colors, graphics and components that you see presented here are subject to (however improbable) change. We will be exhibiting at Essen, and it is very likely that some backers or other people may have the game in hand before you do. Note that our goal is to ship the game on time, by the dates listed on the pledge levels. Shipping a package is different than delivering a package. We do not deliver your game, the shipping company does. Therefore, delivery times will vary according to your local postal services – once we ship, the shipment is the responsibility of the shipping company. If tracking is important to you, please let us know. Informal currency conversions made on this campaign may not be accurate by the time you read this, and therefore result in seemingly cheaper prices further in the future. Warning: Please practice safe gardening. Avoid sticking sharp tools into any squishy things, even if they deserved it those bastards who keep stealing m- your vegetables. The story, all names, characters, and incidents portrayed in this game are fictitious, maybe. There is no such thing as vegetable people, living in your garden, planting vegetables and trying to win gardening competitions. If you are a Victorian illustrator who made these awesomely bizarre illustrations, HOWAREYOUREADINGTHISDIDYOUTRAVELTHROUGHTIME??!?!? By backing this project, you indicate that you have read, understood and agreed with the above. If you have any questions, please contact us directly via the KS messaging system.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Please note that everything shown here is a prototype and not the finalized production copy.
Smoke rises on the horizon. A fire rages somewhere in the heart of the forest. From the height of a fire tower, you command the efforts to defend your tower and take down your opponents. With each turn, the inferno grows. Harness the power of the wind to push the blaze towards the other towers, clear tracts of land to fortify your tower, hinder the plans of your opponents with torrents of water, and unleash an arsenal of fire cards upon your foes. Each card has a unique pattern with its own tactical advantage. You must effectively direct the resources in your hand and use sound spatial planning to deploy them. 
Fire Tower incorporates an intuitive play structure that takes minutes to learn and seconds to set up. Although the core mechanics are easy to grasp, an ever-shifting environment forces players to switch up their tactics and experiment with varied strategies, making Fire Tower a difficult game to master and each play-through a fresh experience.
                                          EASY TO LEARN
We made sure Fire Tower's rules were simple and easy to learn, so that you can start playing within minutes of opening the box. Below is a brief overview of how to play the game. For a more detailed explanation watch our 5 1/2 minute How To Play video above (stop motion animation!) or follow the link to our rules. 
THE BASICS 
Your turn has two steps:
1. The wind spreads the blaze. Choose one empty space orthagonally adjacent (not touching diagonally) to another fire gem or the eternal flame (the fire marked at the center of the board) and place a gem on it.
If the wind is heading east, you must place a fire gem to the east of another fire gem or the eternal flame.
2. Take action from your tower. Either play one of the five action cards in your hand or discard as many cards as you want and redraw up to your hand size. Find out more about the different types of cards below. 
HARNESS THE POWER OF THE WIND 
You may play Wind Cards to do one of three actions: change the direction of the wind to the direction shown on the card, roll the wind die in hopes of a better wind direction, or place one fire gem in the direction indicated on the card.
Wind cards allow you to choose one of three actions.
SPREAD THE BLAZE  
We told you this game is competitive! Play Fire Cards to spread the blaze towards your opponents. Place the fire gems on the board in the pattern indicated at the bottom of each card. The fire can be placed anywhere, as long as at least one gem is touching the eternal flame or previously existing fire gems on the board.
One example of a fire card is the burning snag, a falling burning tree that creates a square of four gems.
EXTINGUISH THE FLAMES  
Feel the heat? Use Water Cards to remove some of the fire gems from the board in the pattern shown at the bottom of the card.
The smokejumper, one type of water card, allows you to choose a fire gem and remove fire gems from the eight spaces around it. The center gem must remain on the board.
BUILD FIREBREAKS  
Need more permanent defenses? Firebreak Cards allow you to build firebreaks (purple tokens), areas devoid of vegetation that the fire cannot go on or pass through. They can only be removed using the De/Reforestation card. Quick note: Firebreaks cannot be built orthogonally adjacent to any previously existing firebreaks on the board.
One type of firebreak card, the dozer line, blocks the fire from passing through.
BEWARE THE FIRESTORM  
Burn, baby, burn! The Firestorm Card comes up once per deck cycle. It must be played as soon as it is drawn, regardless of turn order. Once it is played, roll the wind die and place a fire gem orthogonally adjacent to every fire gem on the board in the direction the die indicates. At this point, every player has a chance to discard and redraw as many cards as they want from the deck.
If the wind die rolls west, you must place a fire gem west of all fire gems on the board, and the eternal flame.
PROTECT YOUR TOWER 
Your fire tower is made up of the nine colored spaces in your corner of the board. You may not use water cards or build firebreaks in this area. Once the fire has breached your tower, your only recourse is your Bucket Card (every player gets one bucket for the game). You can toss it out the window in an attempt to save yourself from the flames. But if the fire comes back, watch out! This time you don't have a bucket to save you. 
The only way to remove fire from your tower is by using your bucket card.
TAKE DOWN YOUR OPPONENTS   
Once the fire reaches the back corner of your tower (outlined in orange), you are eliminated from the game. Hand your cards to the player who finished you off. Everyone now plays with an additional card, and a firestorm immediately takes place. But don't worry! The way this fire is raging, it'll just be a matter of minutes—maybe even seconds—before the other towers burn down and you can start your next game.
Eliminate opponents by reaching the back corner square, outlined in orange.
Last tower standing wins the game!  
TEAM VARIANT
In the team variant, players sit diagonally across from their partners. The first team to burn both of their opponents' towers wins. All players remain in the game until the end, regardless of whether or not their tower burns down. This is an alternative to player elimination in the Free For All version.
Watch our two player play through video >
Unlocked!!! We will be adding a new optional event card called to every copy of Fire Tower!
Fan us on Board Game Geek
Like us on Facebook
Subscribe to our Mailing List
Follow us on Instagram
Follow us on Twitter
Read the full review from A Pawn's Perspective.  
                                                              Read the full review from Engaged Family Gaming.
 Read the full review from Board Everyday. 
This isn't just a one-off project for us, this is the beginning of a dream we've both had for many years. Both of us grew up playing board games and designing games for fun. We have spent the past three years working tirelessly on Fire Tower, not only because we want to give you a high quality, beautiful, and fun game, but because we want to lay the groundwork for a real business. We know exactly how we will manufacture our game and every detail about fulfillment and shipping. We've gone to 15 conventions and countless game nights, playing our game over and over to ensure that it is exactly the product you want. We've listened to your advice, and we've been fine tuning our product since day one. 
Why now? 
We are offering Fire Tower at a discounted rate for the duration of this Kickstarter. After the campaign is over, the price will go up. Plus, your support now goes towards funding this project and reaching stretch goals to make it even better!
What makes it unique? 
Okay, we are the ONLY competitive forest fire game (that we know of). But that's not all. Fire Tower has such unique mechanics that in the hundreds and hundreds of games we've played, no one ever says to us, "Your game is just like ______." Considering all the games on the market right now, we are very happy about that.
Here's a few other points we think are pretty neat:
The artwork. If you're familiar with Kevin Ruelle's fine art, you already know that we lucked out having him as our artist. If you don't know, check out some of his work here. 
Easy to learn. Fire Tower takes about 5 minutes to learn. Don't believe us? Watch our How to Play video above and get back to us.
Lots of pictures. Each card includes a grid that visually explains the ways it can be used, saving new players from having to constantly refer to the rule book. 
Easy to set up. "Let's play Fire Tower," you say. One minute later, you're playing. No special placement of tokens, separating cards into several piles, nothing. 
The fire gems. They are just really fun to hold. And they look like candy. And you get 135 of them in every single game. We know you are thinking of buying more copies because you want to fill a bathtub with those gems. Don't let us stop you. 
The variations. Gwen likes this game best with two players. Sam likes it best with four. Looking for heavier strategy? Try the team variant or the two player version. Want to trick your friends into thinking you're the nice guy while you plot to burn down their towers? Play the three or four player "Free for All" version. Add chaos with the Firestorm. The games feel different, even though the mechanics are simple to learn. 
Lastly, this game is just plain fun. We've personally played Fire Tower more than 1000 times, and we still enjoy it. That's some serious replayability.
For a copy of the game for $39, back our project at the Fire Fighter tier. Looking for more? Check out our other options below: 
For each additional copy of Fire Tower, add $35 to your pledge. For large quantities of games (group pledges), please contact us at runawayparade@gmail.com with your quantity and location, and we will get back to you right away with costs.  
SOLD OUT - Sam Bryant, co-designer of Fire Tower and talented woodworker, will handcraft and hand finish four wooden buckets to add to your game, one for each player to use in place of their bucket card. Each set of buckets will be individually numbered on the bottom. 
This is in addition to a copy of Fire Tower and everything included in the Fire Fighter tier, and will be shipped separately. US only. Limited to 100 backers. 
You will be immortalized in the lore of Fire Tower. Your name will be included on The Wall of Flame in every printed copy of the rule book. You will also receive a card signed by the designers that shows your status as a Wall of Flame inductee. 
This is all in addition to a copy of the game with handcrafted buckets and all stretch goals. Please Note: Backers outside the US will not receive wooden buckets. Limited to 50 backers.
SOLD OUTJump into the blaze and join the fight! 
Receive one of our limited edition prototypes signed and numbered by the designers within 8 weeks of the end of the campaign.
You will also receive a copy of the finished product with all stretch goals when it is available, and all other rewards included in the Wall of Flame tier. US only. Limited to 12 backers.
Fuel the fire's rapid spread!  
Receive everything in the Smokejumper pledge level, plus a handcrafted wooden game board with wood-burned illustrations of fire towers in each corner.
You will also receive a personalized thank you message on the Wall of Flame. This is in addition to everything in the Smokejumper tier. 
In addition to offering free shipping to all backers in the United States, we are excited to offer friendly shipping in the EU, Canada, and Australia, and affordable shipping world-wide. If you have any questions or concerns about shipping, please feel free to reach out to us. 
For larger quantity group orders that are all being shipped to the same destination, please contact us at runawayparade@gmail.com with your quantity and location, and we will get back to you right away with your shipping costs.  
Retailers, we love you, and we would love to see Fire Tower on your shelves! Please back our campaign for $6 and we will get back to you right aways with details about our retail opportunities. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out via email at runawayparade@gmail.com. 
Any questions? Please contact us at runawayparade@gmail.com!
                                                                                                                                                                                         
                   A special thank you to all the others involved in the making of our Kickstarter video: 
Music by Jeffrey Bryant
Footage by Roque Nonini, Justin Oslyn, and Hannah Marlin
Starring Christina Whittaker and Hana Fruchtenicht
Thank you also to Marshall Pratt, Sam Oslyn, Hillary Giacomelli, Matt Longman, and Justin Engles for helping us with our videos. 
Thank you Mike Belsole and Morgan Ruelle for editing our rules. And thank you to our incredibly supportive friends and family, and the many game designers, publishers, reviewers, etc. who have helped us throughout this process. We couldn't have done this without you!
Kickstarter has been a huge part of the renaissance that board games are currently going through, and we are thrilled to be a part of that. The fact that Kickstarter provides an avenue for designers to print their product is a dream come true. $8,000, our funding goal, is simply the amount of money it costs to manufacture a minimum print run of our game and get it to your mailbox. We are not paying ourselves for the time we've put in, or any costs that we have incurred up to this point. We just want to be able to get Fire Tower onto your table, and we hope you have as much fun with it as we've had.  
Thanks so much for checking out Fire Tower! If this is your first Kickstarter and you haven't backed before, follow these simple steps: 
1. Click on the pledge level you'd like to back. For the base game, choose Fire Fighter. If you would like to donate money without a reward, click the "Back this project" button at the top of the page and choose to pledge without a reward. You can also choose a pledge tier and choose to pay more than the actual tier, either for extra copies or for no additional reward. 
2. You will be prompted to enter your email address, and then click "continue as a guest."
3. Fill out your payment information as requested and click "Pledge." 
That's it! Thanks so much for backing Fire Tower! If you have any questions at all, please contact us at runawayparade@gmail.com.
©Runaway Parade Games 2018. All rights reserved.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our first game and we fully understand the amount of work and number of obstacles in front of a first time project creator. Although we can't ensure that problems won't arise, we guarantee that we've done extensive work with our chosen manufacturer and fulfillment center to ensure that the process will be as smooth as possible. We'll always be available to answer any questions you have about the process.

We want to get Fire Tower to you as quickly as possible. The game is ready to go, fully playtested, art completed, manufacturer chosen, and fulfillment centers picked. All we need is the funds to set the manufacturing process into motion. 

The success of Fire Tower will allow Runaway Parade Games to create other projects that we're excited to bring to the world of tabletop. The future of our company is tied to Fire Tower. 

Thanks for checking out our project, and once again we want to offer our deepest appreciation to everyone who helped make this possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Welcome to Brook City, officers!
Brook City is a cooperative board game for 1-4 players, designed by Adam and Brady Sadler. The game features highly detailed miniatures and the Modular Deck System (MDS) introduced in Street Masters. In the game, players take on the role of heroic cops inspired by classic action movies and are tasked with protecting the city from the recent rise in criminal activity. Each game is dictated by the chosen criminal deck and case deck. These decks are modular and the different combinations of decks create unique experiences each game.
The game is played on a beautifully illustrated board of the city, where the cops must run or drive to various locations and bust up crimes. While cops start the game with a standard issue B.C.P.D. Cruiser, they can also commandeer many other types of vehicles on the streets of Brook City.
Each cop in Brook City plays differently thanks to each having their own unique cop deck. Cop decks include encounter cards, ability cards, and tactic cards to represent each cop’s unique strengths and strategy to take on the criminals underworld.
While the cops try to crack the case, their prime suspect is represented by the criminal deck. Each criminal deck contains at least 1 suspect card, as well as a slew of crime cards that spawn crew members around the city to interfere with your detective work. If cops ignore these criminal masterminds while trying to pin the crime on them, things may just get seriously out of hand…
Case decks represent the cops’ overall goal of the game. While keeping the criminal under control, they must also concentrate on working their way through the case. Each case has special rules governing how cops can interact with clue cards and get their hands on enough evidence to bring the criminal to justice. In addition to clue cards, case decks include a variety of events that are designed to hinder the cops or punish them for not making enough progress solving the case.
You don’t have to take our word on how the game plays. Please click HERE to read a draft of the rulebook.
Brook City features a variety of highly detailed miniatures, which are used to mark the location of the cops, criminals, and crew throughout the city. With our experience producing miniatures in our previous game, Street Masters, we are confident in the level of detail and overall quality of the miniatures that will be in this game. While we were extremely happy with the miniatures in Street Masters, we learned some tricks to improve them even more for Brook City.
         Blacklist Games is committed to publishing only high quality games. Please watch this video of Adam and Brady unboxing a production copy of Street Masters:
As you can see from the video, great care was taken to ensure every component was of the best quality possible. Backers of this campaign can feel confident that the same amount of care and attention to detail will be taken with Brook City as well.
Like many other publishers, we will be charging shipping after the Kickstarter concludes based on the actual costs incurred to ship. We will collect this via our pledge manager after the campaign ends. This is so we can be fair to to you all since final shipping sizes are unpredictable with a growing campaign. Plus this gives more room to pool into stretch goals and as much cool gameplay stuff as we possibly can.
After manufacturing, we'll ship your rewards at our cost to our international hubs. Following, is a rough estimate for shipping a standard game package (approx. 4kg volumetric weight). Keep in mind these are just estimates, and costs may rise based on weight increases from unlocked stretch goals and any add-ons you choose.
USA: $10-$15 to most states. ($30 to Alaska, Hawaii, and Puerto Rico.)
CANADA: $10-$20 to most cities.
LATIN AMERICA: $50-$60 to most countries.
ASIA: $15-20 to China and Hong Kong. $30 to most other countries (we can't predict an estimate cost to Malaysia, Singapore, or Indonesia).
OCEANIA: $15-$25 to Australia. $30 to New Zealand. AFRICA: $80 to most countries.
EUROPE: $15-$30 to most countries. $35 to Norway, Finland, Estland, Lettland, and Latvia. $40 to Bosnia/Herzegovina, Croatia, and Serbia. $55 to Bulgaria, Lithuania, and Romania. $60 to Iceland and Israel. $45 to Greece and Turkey.
Unfortunately, different import laws and customs from some specific countries have made it impossible for our shipping/fulfillment partner to ship to such as Russia, Ukraine, Kazakhstan and Afghanistan. Due to that we will not ship to these areas.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Following our successful campaign for Street Masters: Rise of the Kingdom, we've taken what we've learned from production, shipping and fulfillment to strive for an even smoother experience from start to finish, continuing to focus on overall quality.

There are a lot of moving parts from the Kickstarter, production, manufacture, to fulfillment, then distribution. Timing seems to be one of the biggest obstacles in many campaigns, especially from small, indie publishers such as ourselves. Fortunately, we've got experienced game designers working hard to ensure the gameplay offers the best experience it can be; we have strong relations with the factory/manufacture; we have a shipment/fulfillment company already signed on; we are completely passionate about our games; and most important, we care about our backers.

We also understand there may still be confusion about our first campaign, as it was a card game that we cancelled. It didn't receive the momentum it needed due to us purchasing the rights from a publisher that has not had much luck in the industry. Currently we're developing an app for the game and tightening up some of the original rules and cards in order to release it under our brand at a future date. Doing this will give us the time we need to ensure that the game will make a great edition to our library as well as yours.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Incomplete Pledge Manager Backers: Final Chance for Address Changes
updates.update_content:
Hey officers! Hope you're doing well!
As with our previous updates, this is an update only for those who had missed the original pledge manager deadline in 2019 (i.e. had not completed your pledge manager)! If this isn't you, you can carry on with your patrols!
Balances Due Paid - Thank You!
In the last update we asked each of you to check your inboxes for our emails asking you to pay your balances due. Most of you did so, so thanks for that! 
Stock/Shipment Situation

updates.update_userinfo: Briefing: 05/2020 - Final Call for Balances Dues
updates.update_content:
Afternoon, officers!
Hope you've all been well and staying safe during these trying times. Blacklist Games has been monitoring the COVID-19 situation daily, and since the health and safety of our employees, partners and customers is of the utmost importance to us, we have asked that all our employees work from home for the time being as recommended by various governments and health agencies. This clearly comes with all sorts of challenges, but we've been doing our best considering all that is happening in the world!

Officers, happy new year! Hope your patrols over the holidays went well!
Back with a quick status update, so let's get to it!
Rewards for Incomplete Pledge Managers
For all our backers who originally missed the pledge manager deadline, we've been told the reprint stock is due to land at our international hubs very soon, so we are now officially beginning the process of collecting balances due so you can complete your pledges!

updates.update_userinfo: Status Update: Incomplete Pledge Backers, Replacements, Brazil Backers
updates.update_content:
Officers, time for another briefing! Today's a status update on a few things: 
incomplete pledge managers
replacements for missing/defective items
Brazilian backer rewards
Rewards for Incomplete Pledge Managers

Officers! How fare your investigations? 
We're back with a new update with regards to the status of the Brazil shipments, as well as shipments for those of you who had not completed your pledge managers in time.
For those who tuned in the last time, our inventory in Asia bound for Brazil had unexpectedly made it onto a different container traveling to Brazil unbeknownst to us until it was too late. This was due to an unfortunate misunderstanding where our fulfillment company believed that a backer was our employee and allowed for our products to be consolidated into a general shipping container that was not one agreed upon by our contacts, and therefore not bound for our hub.

Afternoon, officers! Hope your patrols have been going well? 
We're here with a quick briefing to update you on the status of things before letting you get back to your beats.
INCOMPLETE PLEDGES - LAST CALL

updates.update_userinfo: Briefing 39: Brazil Update and GenCon Report
updates.update_content:
Hey coppers! Micky Scott here, back with another Brook City update from inside the big house!
Let's get to it!
VFI SHIPMENTS TO BRAZIL

updates.update_userinfo: Briefing 38: Micky's in the House! The Big House, That Is.
updates.update_content:
Hey there, coppers! Micky Scott here, and I'm hijacking this here newsfeed! 
I'm currently spending some time in lockup thanks to those no-good Murdock twins, so thought I'd pass the time by pestering you goody two-shoes from inside the slammer. How, you ask? Well, my incredibly expensive lawyer got me a sweet deal; not only do I have a private "cell," I've also got a fancy new 28.8k modem and a top-of-the-line 486 PC. The future is now!

updates.update_userinfo: Briefing 37: The Stakeout Before the Bust
updates.update_content:
Welcome Officers! As we finish another couple of weeks of fulfillment, here are some updates as of last Friday. 
VFI Asia said that they are trying to get things going for us but their backlog has had issues that keep pushing us out. They said that ours is still their priority (before any new projects), but they have to knock out what they were working on before they can push forward for us. But at the very least, they gave us a hard date that they will finish shipping sooner than May 10th. I sent them an email to ask them if that meant backers receiving packages in Asia or labels being created and they assured me that it means the packages will have left their facilities before then.

updates.update_userinfo: Briefing 36: Officers, time to bring them in!
updates.update_content:
Welcome Officers! Looks like it's finally time to hit the streets of Brook City. Blackbox confirmed that tracking numbers have been going out and they should have them all out (estimated) worldwide by the end of this week. That's right, training day is over and it's time to show the brass you know how to enforce the law against the Syndicate!
While things are underway, we're also monitoring. Though most of this is out of our hands, we do want to ensure that shipping goes smoothly. So if there are any issues or concerns, please contact us first (info@blacklistgamesllc.com) so we can find out how best to help you.

updates.update_content:
Ok here we go again, we feel very confident this round and are excited to deliver a great game. Remember to add your shipping costs so for US total pledge will be $15 and the UK and Canada is $20 rest of the world is $25.
http://kck.st/2ybvLRh

We didn't make it to the finals. Our game was great and well designed but unfortunately, due to it being on Kickstarter we had to be disqualified. We did, however, get a spot in the publisher's meet and greet. only 8 games were selected and we were one of them. Let's look to the future and get this game published. 
Thank you for all your support

1 Zillion BC has been accepted for the 2018 Luci Award, finalists will be announced May 25th. If we make it to the finals we will offer a huge discount for all of our backers and future backers. Winners will be determined on June 3rd, if we win (Fingers Crossed) we will offer an even bigger discount to come. Follow us on Twitter @rgamedesigns for giveaways during our June launch.
You can now play 1 Zillion BC online at https://tabletopia.com/games/1-zillion-bc try it out you can play solo to look at the game or challenge some friends.

Minor set back, our analytics point us towards not funding. We are going to relook at all of our statistics and comments and we will re-launch in June. 1 Zillion BC is up for an award at the beginning of June so we will relaunch after. To be fair to all backers we will offer the core game for you at cost of $10 plus half shipping at the relaunch. Total cost will be $12 U.S. and $17 International. Further detail as we get closer to relaunch.

So due to my editor being sick and not having a finished project, I put together a rough short gameplay demo with my nephew. I hope you enjoy
Thank you
Benjamin Rodocker

campaign.story:
Hoist your sails, watch for sea monsters, and mind those tricky tides as you travel from island to island, collecting and delivering goods to earn the most gold. Take command of a merchant ship as you manage both your hand of navigation cards and your ship’s cargo hold while charting the best course on the map!
Tricky Tides is a pick-up-and-deliver game that uniquely employs trick taking to determine turn order and the direction players can move their ships. This nautical-themed fusion of game mechanics is sure to bring something new to your game table.
We've met our funding goal, so you can expect a complete game with high quality components. We also have several stretch goals on the horizon that will allow for upgrades to premium components.
(Image of insert is just an example place holder)
Special thanks to Cassie from The Indie Game Report (TIGR) for putting together this excellent video showing how to play! You can download a draft version of the rules here.
In advanced play, the incredible art of Naomi Ferrall comes to life, as players can use the unique powers of each of the sea monsters!
Read the full Geek Dad article here.
Read the full Gameosity preview article here.
 Click here to listen to the designer, Steven Aramini, chat with JT and Jeff about Tricky Tides on The Game Crafter Podcast.
Limited Edition Laser Cut Monster and Anchor Tokens
Follow Gold Seal Games on Twitter
Like Gold Seal Games on Facebook
Follow Gold Seal Games on Instagram
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be our second Kickstarter. Our first was funded and successfully fulfilled.

Tricky Tides has been extensively playtested. The art is complete. We've got multiple manufacturing quotes, and we are prepared to ship out a high quality game at any successful funding level.

We continue to grow in our industry knowledge and have managed to surround ourselves with experienced folks who can help fill in any gaps in that knowledge.

We will be providing regular updates, so you can follow along for the entire journey, all the way up to the moment your copy of Tricky Tides hits your table. Delays can occur, but we will make sure to keep everyone in the loop, and we will quickly and decisively handle any issues that may come up.

We're ready. Let's set sail!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Kohaku has less than 24 hours to go!
updates.update_content:
Ahoy there backers!
Our next game, Kohaku,  is currently on its last day of funding! If you haven't had a chance to check out the page, please do so. We're not quite funded yet, and could use your help!
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/goldsealgames/kohaku

Our next project, Kohaku launched this past Monday!
Kohaku is a peaceful tile-laying game in which you will be trying to build the most beautiful koi pond. Your fish will enjoy the company of curious turtles, hungry frogs, and delicate butterflies as you build a home for your precious koi. Strategically place different koi fish next to various decorative features to maximize the appeal of your pond.

updates.update_userinfo: Origins, AU/NZ shipping and Other Cool Stuff
updates.update_content:
Origins
Wheeewwww!!! I'm just now recovered from an absolutely tiring (but also very exciting!) appearance at Origins Game Fair in Columbus, Ohio.  I had the honor of sharing a booth with Chad from 25th Century Games. We both had games that appeared on SEVERAL "Top 10 Most Anticipated Games for Origins" lists, so we had a steady stream of folks in our booth the whole show. It was busy!

Ahoy backers!
Tricky Tides is officially ready to send out. Quartermaster will start shipping your games out next week.
I had Quartermaster send me a copy ahead of fulfilling your games so that I could make sure they were packing them well and that they would arrive undamaged. They did an awesome job.

Ahoy there backers!
Good news! Tricky Tides made it on the boat before Chinese New Year. Whew! It's always a bit of a dice roll around early February in regards to what ends up shipping out, and what ends up sitting on the factory floor for an extra month. But we made it!
Your games are aboard the Clementine Maersk, a ship capable of holding 110,000 metric tons (242.5M pounds) of cargo. That's a big boat! You can follow along with the Clementine's voyage .

Ahoy there backers!
Sadly, I have to give you the dreaded "your Kickstarter is going to be later than originally anticipated" update. This is one of the most difficult parts of the process to predict properly, which is probably why Kickstarter defaults to saying "Estimated Delivery" when building a project page.
Despite production being in full swing two weeks ago, the factory informs me that they don't expect to complete manufacturing until approximately January 20. There's a lot of work that goes into making these games great!

Ahoy backers!

Not a ton of info for this update, just some cool pictures that I got last night at 4am. Production for Tricky Tides is underway!
In the interest of transparency, I do want to let you all know that the deluxe laser pieces are progressing a bit slower than I'd like. My intention was to make them all myself, but today I went out and recruited some help, so we should be able to get back on track.

Ahoy backers!
I just received pictures of the print sample that the factory will be sending me. It looks great! Once we receive the physical sample, if everything looks good, we'll enter into full production.

Ahoy there backers! It's been a bit since an update, but there's a lot of stuff going on in the background. (There's a tl;dr at the bottom if you want the quick update)
Giochix partnership: Unfortunately the Italian print run campaign didn't work out, so we aren't going to be releasing a version of Tricky Tides with Giochix.

Ahoy!
I spent some time down in Orlando at Dice Tower Con, showing off Tricky Tides and our next game (it is about koi fish!). I had a great time playing some awesome games and hanging out with really cool people.
So let's get you an update about where we are at with the project now that the dust has settled from the actual campaign.

campaign.story:
It’s another beautiful day in the village! Your farmer is hard-working and defenseless, your wall is strong and true, your raider is a plucky underdog, and your merchant is hiring the finest folk that turnips can buy.
Everything is perfect...except for those HORRIBLE OTHER VILLAGES! Ugh, you hate them so much!
But you’ve got a plan to rise above these petty squabbles. You’re going to become a KINGDOM.
In Village Pillage, you're racing your neighbors to acquire 3 relics and prove your right to rule. Each turn, everybody simultaneously plays cards against both their neighbors. It's rock-paper-scissors meets the prisoner's dilemma...with turnips!
At $85k, 5 more Kickstarter-exclusive wooden turnips will be added to everyone's order!
At $90k, we'll be adding cool gold foil to all the relics. So shiny!
If you think your opponents are planning to farm, raid them! If they're planning an attack, man the walls! And if they're putting up defenses: it's farming time.
Buy more powerful cards to improve your hand, and start building up your turnip collection! Once you have enough, you need to send your vulnerable merchant to buy a relic. And your neighbors know that. But you know they know that. But they KNOW you know they know that...
$10k: Funded! This game is going to be MADE! The world will be filled with more wooden turnips than any of us ever would have predicted.
$15k: Chicken token unlocked! Every copy of the game is going to come with a double-sided, flippable chicken token. Perfect for breaking ties, or for people who just love flipping chickens.
$20k: Monastery promo card unlocked! Kickstarter backers will get a special promo card, not available in the retail edition! For more details on the Monastery, see Update #2.
$25k: Upgraded box! The box is going to be thicker and sturdier, with room for both sleeved and unsleeved cards.
$30k: Shepherd promo card unlocked! Another card for all Kickstarter backers! The Shepherd has a unique, out-of-turn effect: see Update #4 for the full scoop!
$35k: Linen-finish cards! All the cards will now come with a fantastic linen finish, making them easier to shuffle and nicer to hold. 
$40k: Smuggler promo card unlocked! Another special promo card, making relics cheaper and stored turnips less safe. Update #6 has all the details!
$45k: Custom-cut turnips! The cardboard turnips in every copy of the game will now be turnip-shaped! (Note: These are separate to the wooden turnip tokens, which have always been turnip-shaped!)
$50k: Turncoat promo card unlocked! Our final promo card; a powerful raider whose only weakness is his loyalty. He'll switch sides at the first sign of trouble! Update #9 has the specifics.
$55k: +5 wooden turnips! That's right - even more free, Kickstarter-exclusive wooden turnips. Get 'em while they're hot!
$60k: 6-player expansion! Each Kickstarter backer will get a free copy of a 6-player expansion for the game. Invite your nan!
$65k: +5 wooden turnips! They're wooden! They're turnips! They're: more wooden turnips!
$70k: Unique promo relics! The 3 relics that come in the 6-player expansion will have unique art, different to all the relics in the base game!
$75k: +5 wooden turnips! If you've ever wanted to invite 13 friends around and give each of them 5 wooden turnip tokens, this is your lucky day.
$80k: Metal chicken coin! Every copy of Village Pillage ordered through the campaign will come with a Kickstarter-exclusive metal chicken coin. This is a real thing that is happening. 
Check it out!
Village Pillage rules!
Cards steal and gain turnips, defend your stockpile, buy new cards, and convert your turnips to relics. The first player to acquire 3 relics wins the game!
With 20 unique market cards you can buy for your village and add to your hand, every game is different!
                                                                                  All shipping is EU-friendly!
All backers of this campaign will get a set of Kickstarter-exclusive wooden turnips.
These turnips will not be available in the retail game!
To add $23 to your pledge, select "edit pledge". After the campaign, using the pledge manager, you'll be able to add a copy of Village Pillage, Ninjitsu!, Scuttle!, or The Lady and the Tiger for each $23 added this way.
All add-ons include free international shipping!
Your support is the only way we can make Village Pillage a reality! By supporting us on Kickstarter, you can help us create this fun family game...and by backing, you’ll get the game before anyone else!
You'll also get exclusive wooden turnip tokens, which won't be available outside of the Kickstarter!
That's right. Wooden turnips. Dreams do come true!
                                              Visit Jellybean-Games.com to learn about our other projects!
Special thanks to:
Dave Scott, our social media manager, 
Daniel and David Stephenson, for development assistance, 
Vaughn Reynolds for Kickstarter assistance,
Jessa R Morgen, our customer service representative.
If you like Village Pillage, please support the project (every dollar helps!) and tell your friends, especially if they have kids, know kids, or love great games!
Or, if they have a severe turnip-deficiency. Village Pillage will clear that up real quick.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our seventh project, and we are getting better every time! We have already completed the majority of our development: we’ve gone through months of blind playtesting, and the rulebook, art, graphic design, and all cards are complete.

Once the campaign wraps up, all we need to do is send it to the printer.

That’s it!

We launched a campaign earlier in the year, and cancelled it so that we could take the time to price out some cool upgrades (like the wooden turnips!) - we have samples of the wooden turnips, and our printer has assured us that these new components won't affect timelines.

We are renowned for keeping our backers in the loop through our comprehensive updates. When you back a Jellybean Games campaign, you know you’re in good hands!

If you have any questions, you can message us through Kickstarter or email us directly on contact@jellybean-games.com for a prompt response.

We are so confident that you're going to love this game, we're offering a money-back guarantee: At any time before we ship, you can get in contact for a full refund. As well as that, if you decide that Village Pillage isn’t for you within a month of receiving it, you can return it and get your money back, no questions asked.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey!
I promised that I'd pop back in here to let you know how the Surf & Turf Kickstarter was going...well, it could hardly be doing better! 1002 backers, $31,328 raised, and we've unlocked all kinds of stretch goals.
That's why I'm here - if you're interested in picking up Surf & Turf, but unable to back the Kickstarter, you can help out right now.
