updates.update_userinfo: December Update - Wrapping up the year!
updates.update_content:
Team Awesome,
This is it - 2018 is coming to an end. Thanks so much for all the support this year.


This was the month of ! If you see something that catches your eye -

updates.update_userinfo: Gaming with Edo Season 5 KS! & November Digest
updates.update_content:
Team Awesome,  
I hope everyone has had a wonderful November. This month I've focused on things that I'm thankful for and I sincerely appreciate the support this group gave me this year. It has allowed me to create some fantastic content.

Team Awesome,
Halloween is upon us and we've wrapped another month of Gaming with Edo! If you see something that catches your eye -

Team Awesome,
Fall is upon us and we've wrapped another month of Gaming with Edo! If you see something that catches your eye -

Team Awesome,
Summer is coming to a close and we've wrapped another month of Gaming with Edo! With my full time job and a couple Kickstarters in motion, content has slowed a little, but I'm still planning on 2-3 videos a week.

Team Awesome,
June wrapped and July was fast to follow. Where has the summer gone? Great meeting up with folks at Gen Con '18. I hope everyone is doing some great gaming!

Team Awesome,
The last 30 days have been crazy. Gaming with Edo content, a fantastic Kickstarter, and I started a new job. I looked up at the calendar, realized it was July 15, and that I hadn't sent out my June Digest!

Team Awesome,
I hope everyone had a fantastic May and kick-off to Summer! Kids are out of school here in CA, so let the water balloons fly. Lots of great content last month AND I launched the .

Team Awesome,
I hope everyone had a fantastic International Tabletop Day!

Team Awesome,
I hope everyone had an amazing March! Sorry this update is a little late, I've been crazy busy with fullfilling two campaigns ( and ) as well as launching a third ().

campaign.story:
Thanks to our awesome community, Monster Slaughter is now a 2-5 player game!
 
Flip the script on 1980s horror films with Monster Slaughter, a board game with miniatures! As the head of a family of monsters (werewolves, vampires, zombies, or golems), it’s your turn to hunt down and slay insufferable college kids holed up in a cabin in the woods. The hardest part? Deciding what order they should die… and then sticking with it!

Monster Slaughter will be available in both French and English!
Monster Slaughter sera disponible en anglais et en français!
 Cliquez ici pour télécharger la version française du livret de règles !
                                        Want to support us? Here's a set of Kickstarter avatars :)
                                                                                                                                                                              Please note text and artwork are still subject to change. 
Want a sneak peak behind the scenes of Monster Slaughter and its Kickstarter? Take a look at our Making-Of video below!
    We have done everything we can to keep the shipping fees as low as possible. Here are estimates of our shipping fees. Please note that we won't charge any more than what you see below, but your final shipping price could be lower than what you see for your region.

US & Canada: 15€

Europe:

France - 8€

Zone 1 - 10€
Belgium, Germany, Spain, Luxembourg, Italy, Portugal, Ireland, UK, Netherlands

Zone 2 - 15€
Rest of the european countries

Switzerland - 15€

Rest of the world: 25€ - 40€
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Why Kickstarter?

We've been working on the design of Monster Slaughter for almost 2 years and are very happy with the execution (pun intended), look, and feel of the game. Game play is tight and fun, and the graphics (if we may say so ourselves) is out of the park amazing. 

Every project comes with complications though, and we're doing everything we can to keep things as smooth as possible. Production, shipping, communication, keeping monsters properly fed, all of these things can be tricky. But if we ever hit a door we can't bash open, or run into a pesky visitor that's mucking with our plans we'll be sure to let you know right away and keep you up to date on everything that's going down. 

This may be our first Kickstarter, but it's not our first rodeo (as it were). Our experiences with Krosmaster: Arena shows that we know how to make some spectacular minis and can create fun, engaging games to play. 

Thank you so much for checking out the Monster Slaughter Kickstarter. Don't be afraid to leave a comment or ask a question!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hello, Monsters! 
You waited for it, and now here it is: the Monster Slaughter: Underground Kickstarter campaign is now live! 😱

updates.update_userinfo: Post-Campaign Update #21: PDF cards download + more about the expansion!
updates.update_content:
Hello Monsters! 

First of all, we have recently updated the Download section of our Monster Slaughter website, which you can find here. On this page, you will be able to download the Rulebooks and Scenario books in five different languages, as well as PDF files for all cards in Spanish, Italian and German. These files have been requested for some time, they’re now available freely on the website! We thank you all for your patience. In the near future, we will update the website even more to better reflect the complete game and its coming expansion.

Hello, Monsters!
  If you’ve been following our social media accounts these last few weeks, you must have caught glimpses of what our team is working on now – something monstrous! Strange cover art, blurry silhouettes and cryptic sentences…

updates.update_userinfo: Post-Campaign Update #20: wrapping up the year
updates.update_content:
Hello, Monsters! 
It’s been a while since our last update! We hope you liked playing Monster Slaughter since the last time we talked. Hunting drunk teens is not a treat reserved for Halloween, it can be enjoyed all year long!
When you’ll be reading these lines, all pledges have been delivered around the world. While we unfortunately couldn’t get all of them on time for Halloween, we’re glad your parcels have finally arrived and that you’re able to enjoy the game as much as you want.

updates.update_userinfo: Post Campaign Update #18: Frequently Asked Questions
updates.update_content:
Hello Monsters!  
We apologize for our absence in the comments in the last few days. As you can imagine, things have been pretty busy for us in the last two weeks! But we read every comment you leave on this page, and your feedback is always appreciated.  
As a reminder, if you have any kind of troubles with your rewards, contact our Ankama Support team (). Every request made on their website will be treated by their team, including missing or damaged pieces, delayed or lost parcels, etc. As they are a dedicated team separate from Ankama Boardgames, make sure you contact them whenever an issue appears with your rewards to make sure it’s answered as fast as possible.

updates.update_userinfo: Post-Campaign Update #18: NA and World shipping update
updates.update_content:
Hello, Monsters!

We have received numerous requests about the status of the Us and Canada rewards. First things first, we’d like to apologize for the lack of update on this specific topic in the last few days: we were trying hard to reach our partner and get as much info as possible. As a result, we unfortunately had to hold our responses. Let's get to the point!

The current situation is the following: the entire shipment of Monster Slaughter has been in Ship Naked's warehouse for over 2 weeks now. Reminder: Ship Naked is our shipping partner for the US and several other countries: Argentina / Bolivia / Brazil / Canada / Chili / Costa Rica / Mexico / Peru / St Pierre et Miquelon / Puerto Rico / Uruguay.

However, the shipping process to these destinations has only started a few days ago, on mixed orders (more than one copy, add-ons, etc.). Which explains why most of you haven't received your rewards, or tracking numbers yet.

The delay is due to the fact that Ship Naked are still waiting for shipping boxes from their suppliers.  
Unfortunately, there is very little (well, nothing) we can do regarding this situation but trust our partner and relentlessly ask them about the situation.
 
At this point, Ship Naked is waiting for these and have told us they should hopefully start shipping the bulk of the campaign .

Regarding the rest of the world, our partners’ fulfillment centers and our own services have shipped Monster Slaughter as intended, and over 2500 backers have received their parcels by now (with the exception of a few bigger orders, such as group pledges). 

We understand that the situation is more than frustrating. The Halloween delivery date we all hoped for hasn't been met, making us late on our promises. Even though the whole team has been working really hard on the game for over a year now, shipping to these destinations is the only thing we can't control and this definitely spoils the fun for us as well. 

We thank you for understanding we can’t make the process go any faster than its current pace, and we sincerely apologize for the situation.

We hope you'll all be able to play Monster slaughter next week, as promised by Ship Naked.  

Once more, our apologies about the situation.

We thank you all for your patience and understanding.

Hello, Monsters!  
As Monster Slaughter is progressively making its way into your hands, we can’t thank you enough for making this game a reality. It has been a crazy ride from the early days of the Kickstarter campaign to the moment we wrote “The games have shipped”, on schedule with our promise made a year before, no less! And all of that was possible thanks to your help and your incredible support all the way.

project_data.project_name: Monster Slaughter by Ankama Board Games

campaign.story:
Dice Hospital is customs friendly by shipping with regional partners
Dice Hospital is a new worker placement and dice manipulation game. Featuring lots of dice, custom doctor meeples, awesome isometric art and plenty more! 
What's in the box!
 Explanation of some of the components:
Dice - these are your patients!
Administrator cards - player objective cards that give points based on dice discharged. YOU will get to decide which famous medics feature on them.
Ambulance cards - used for drafting dice. See how to play section
Event cards - optional use cards for players who like slightly more randomness in their games. More advanced/strategic players should not play with these. 
Blood bag tokens - given to the player who chose the hardest to treat dice - which gives more flexibility when treating patients
Medical report cards - For solo play only - see solo variant section
Scoring and round tracker - to keep tally of points per player with the player markers. Features a neat "dial" piece which you rotate to indicate which round you are on too!
Mini expansion pack add-on for base game:
You can now add £12 to your pledge if you wish to receive the mini expanion pack to your base game pledge instead of the full deluxe contents :) Message us once you've added it on!
 Please note: the deluxe edition also comes with a plastic customised insert to hold all these components easily. Please see below for explanation of each component in the deluxe edition. 
Each ambulance holds and fits 3 dice
 Explanation of contents in the deluxe edition
Dice Tower: this is an "assemble your own" flatpack Hospital illustrated Dice Tower! Unlike the image which suggests it is plain - it is most definitely not plain! It will be illustrated by our illustrator as a hospital. It will also be easy to flatpack and put away back in the deluxe add-ons box. Think the Colt Express train, or Kingdomino castles.
Ambulances: Plastic ambulances that hold the dice when drafting them. You will be able to see the values easily and has a slot for each die.
Stickers: Used to number the ambulances so you know which ambulance should hold which dice and determines initiative for the upgrade section of the round.
Box: the deluxe edition add-on comes in it's own box (which will have a slightly different illustration than the base game).
The reward levels available
  Experimental chemistry expansion pack
What it adds to the base game
This mini expansion pack offers a new style of upgrade tiles and specialists. While retaining the euro-style control of the base game dice manipulation, the expansion offers an alternative way to manipulate tiles. Essentially the tiles and specialists upgrades may change the value of the dice by going down a step (clinical trials), re-rolling dice (experimental drugs), and swapping values (transplants). This gives a much more versatile feel to the game and actually introduces really interesting levels of strategy that even we find to be novel each time we play it when combo'd with tiles/specialists from the base game! Please see below for how to play the base game and overviews. 
Your face (or friend/family) in the game
This can be anyone that gives you permission to use their face in the game. It will be at least for the first print run, but may be forever depending on circumstances. Importantly, their face will be in every single copy of the game! Children can be added, but we will need to draw them as adults since it won't fit well with the game otherwise.
 Since we have hit £30,000 - this is:
Free promo card! (purchasable afterwards)
  We've now hit the £125k stretch goal which means each colour meeple will receive a different print of a doctor/nurse on it!
Watch the preview from the Dice Tower! 
  Worker placement and dice manipulation mechanics
As far as we are aware this is the first game to combine worker placement-like mechanics with dice manipulation. It is also the first to use dice as patients were the pip value represents the die's health levels. Something our playtesters loved! 
Beautiful art with isometric style rooms
We asked famous board game artist Sabrina Miramon to illustrate Dice Hospital by drawing isometric rooms to give that 3d-like effect as well as the characters. The final product is something, we think, of beauty. Not only that, Sabrina did a great job recreating each room type as realistically as possible!
Doctor meeples!
We asked playtesters what they wanted most as a stretch goal and they said doctor meeples. So we said, what the heck, lets just do it anyway! The result is really cool doctor meeples that you use as your workers to activate your rooms.
One of very few hospital games accessible to most gamer types
We feel Dice Hospital appeals to both light gamers, euro gamers and medium-heavy weight gamers. The beauty of the game is the simplicity of choices which allows accessibility to light gamers, but the very much forward planning and "thinky" requirements which will appeal to euro gamers and medium-heavy weight gamers.
Co-designed and developed by an established designer
Mike Nudd, an established designer in his own right, worked with original designer Stanislav Kordonskiy to design the game. Given Mike's breadth of experience having designed the popular dice placement game Waggle Dance and CCG Game Vampire: The Eternal Struggle it ensures the game is mechanically sound, fun and balanced so that it's replayable time and time again!
Prototype copy of Dice Hospital
    Download the basic rulebook. Final version (with graphics design work and editing) coming soon.
  FRENCH AND GERMAN RULEBOOKS NOW AVAILABLE! 
DOWNLOAD FRENCH VERSION HERE
DOWNLOAD GERMAN VERSION HERE 
Other languages are planned as well as using final graphics design for the non-english rulebooks. 
Watch a 3 minute overview thanks to Slicker Drips
        Players start with their own hospital board, 3 randomly dealt dice (pip values 3/4/5) and 3 starting nurses 
Each round sees randomly rolled dice placed on ambulances from low to high - which is placed by the first player, with tied (but different coloured) dice being decided by the last player 
Starting from the first player going clockwise players pick ambulance cards. The lower the number ambulance card the more likely you are to go first for an upgrade (and a bloog bag token and the first player token). The trade-off is that lower value dice are harder to treat.
Starting with the player with the lowest value ambulance, each player then gets to decide which one of the face up upgrades they take for their own hospital.
Simultaneously, players then activate their hospitals by moving their own nurse meeples onto action spots on their hospital and manipulating the dice. The more dice discharged (value of 7) in a single round the more points scored. 
One of the best features of the game is the ability to combo rooms with specialists when you have built up an awesome hospital!  
   A more detailed playthrough is shown thanks to Slicker Drips which can be watched in the solo playthrough section below. Essentially, the game becomes a lot harder, something we purposefully did. Essential differences are:
Medical Report cards 
These are cards supplied with the base game, which players are dealt at the beginning of the game. Players are randomly dealt 6 of these cards of which they are laid out face up in a 2x3 configuration. Only the bottom 3 cards are accessible in the first instance. The medical report cards state which dice you must discharge to gain that bonus written on the card. Once the player has discharged those dice that match a medical report card (or multiple if possible) those cards are discarded, scored on the tracker, and the cards directly above drop down to become available. At the end of the game, any medical report cards that remain unscored score negative points equal to that stated on the cards themselves
Dice drafting is from the bag, not the ambulance draft 
As of now, we feel that this is the best system as it gives the most amount of difficulty since you have no control over the dice you receive. The 3 drawn dice are then rolled, with 1s and 6s re-rolled and placed into your wards. However, we are testing whether easier variants may be played that is not this strict. Right now, we are testing 1 die of your choice being drawn with the other 2 being random. We are also testing to see whether dice discharged are not put back in the bag as in the multiplayer variant so that players my gauge what dice are left in the bag.
Drafting of specialists is limited 
We say this because only 1 of each type of upgrade is revealed each turn. While you can pick whichever upgrade you wish, since the rate at which you go through the deck, is lower than that of the multiplayer version, specialists may only be useful at certain times of the game. We are, however, testing an easier variant where the duplicates of the tiles and specialists are removed making control of the dice much easier to anticipate - especially for more experienced players.
  Download a basic and printer friendly version of the print and play file
 Please note, the print and play file is not the final art of the game, since we wanted to make it printer friendly. Each room and specialist will see unique art too. It is more to give an indication of how the game plays instead!
    Solo playthrough with Slicker Drips
    What reviewers thought of Dice Hospital
  Some of the reviewers who have or will review the game
   Please note in this review 1s are incorrectly described as going to the morgue and 6s are discharged. Dice must go to 0 to be sent to the morgue and 7 to be discharged. Otherwise, Rahdo gives an excellent description of the game! 
          Add on Cauldron Master - our last game to your pledge!
  Please message us once you have added on Cauldron Master
Cauldron Master funded on kickstarter earlier this year and is running low on stocks of an initial 1000 copy print run. It is a light, fast but deep set collection, push your luck and slightly social deduction game that has proved popular with families and gamers who like a nice easy game to start their game night. Please note: if you'd like a copy simply add the amount to your pledge AND message us telling us you've done so.
We want to offer excellent rates to our retailer friends as well as wanting to make life-long partnerships. To that end please back us at the £1 tier, message us and we will send you our excellently priced retailer rates!
Dice Hospital has been rigorously tested
Since Stanislav made the original version of Dice Hospital (known firstly as "Stat!") in 2015 the game has been rigorously tested, blindly playtested and tested some more! Alley Cat Games signed up the game in winter 2016 and got Mike Nudd involved in early 2017 to develop and design the game further. 
We have spent a huge amount of time and effort locally playtesting and lots of hours with blind playtesters rigorously testing the game and rulebook for us - this is testament to the 1000 member Dice Hospital facebook group in which we've had over 50 different groups playing the game and sending us detailed feedback. 
We believe we have got to place now where the game is excellent, balanced, replayable, and most importantly: FUN! 
Some of our various blind and local playtests!
  Transparency guarantee
Just like our previous games which we kickstarted: Lab Wars and Cauldron Master, we kept backers informed of any problems, issues, and of course good news we had along the way to fulfilling the game to backers. 
 Delivered on time
Again, our last two games were delivered on time and before retailers received their copies. In fact, Cauldron Master was delivered 2 months before our expected delivery date!
World class manufacturing
For this project, we are using Longpack which produced a wide array of games including Unfair, Robinson Crusoe, and Queendomino. We have already received an early prototype of an early version of the game from Longpack and the standard of this was very very high. Their communication has been excellent as well as having been recommended by other world renowned creators.
Overview of manufacturing and fulfillment 
We will give ourselves a month or two to prepare the final artwork (custom and legendary medics) as well as the rulebook. Taking us to the end of December at worst. 
At this point (late Dec-early Jan) we will submit the files to Longpack for approval. 
It'll then take a 2-4 weeks to produce a pre-production copy of the game for our approval - reaching late Jan-early Feb. 
It'll then take 8-10 weeks to manufacture the games, taking us to early April. 
They will then be loaded onto ships bound for the USA, UK and Australia. Each will take approximately 4-6 weeks to reach their destinations taking us to May. 
Then fulfillment to you will take 1-4 weeks once they have reached their destinations and passed through customs! Meaning (hopefully if all goes to plan) it'll reach backers in June. This is what we call moderate case scenario - where worst will be August - hence why the date we have put on the expected shipment date as August. 
Since the game is quite large and heavy we will be providing subsidized shipping. We will be using the infamous "Stegmaier" method of shipping to different regional fulfillment warehouses around the world. We will be using ShipNaked/Funagain in the USA, GamesQuest in the UK and AetherWorks in Australia. 
USA, UK and most EU shipping will also have the extra benefit of being tracked (wherever possible.) 
Also as stated above, a small minority of non UK and US countries will need a to pay a little bit extra for orders with the expansion pack. This is because the combined package goes over the "dreaded" 2kg limit making postage much more expensive. We've kept prices as low as possible and taking into consideration VAT for EU countries. For full details click on the tier and select your country.
Since we have had issues in the past with the following countries: we will be using special couriers which are tracked and insured against loss and theft. The price here is the price we pay to send it to you. Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Saudi Arabia, Russia, Argentina, Columbia, Peru, Puerto Rico are in this list.
Please read the FAQ for full details
We wanted to make the game as visually appealing to everyone as possible, while also making sure our colour-blind friends could also enjoy the game without having to ask what colour each component was. Please read the FAQ below for how we accomplished this. 
Who we are - Alley Cat Games
We are an independent company that has 2 kickstarter games under our belt with this being our third. Caezar also works as the official kickstarter campaign manager for Sierra Madre Games, with their first kickstarter launch: Bios:Genesis 2nd edition, raising $309,000. We have recently expanded our freelance network (of note, hiring Sabrina Miramon at our offices as our Art Director and Brett Gilbert as our co-lead developer) and have offices based in Hertfordshire, UK. We plan to release 4 games in 2018 having already signed up/ close to signing up 4-6 games. We are also in talks to take multiple multi million dollar licenses which we hope to conclude by the end of 2017 in preparation for 2018. We're looking forward to having you join us on this exciting new adventure!
The Alley Cat Games team
  Support us on BGG. Please thumb this image to get us into the hotness!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As always with our campaigns, we cannot prevent "god like" failures such as thunderstorm, hurricanes etc. 

We can promise you though that we will do everything in our power to keep everyone updated as well as stick to the original plan as possible.

You can rest assured that since this is our 5th campaign, (if you include the Bios:Genesis campaign we ran for Sierra Madre Games) that we are a capable and knowledgeable company. Customer service has always been our number one priority. 

We are a very open company and welcome feedback, suggestions and comments either publically or privately!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,
Wishing you a very happy new year from ACG!
Shipping update
If you are anywhere but Asia, you should have received your game by now, so please send us a PM if you haven't so that we can look into this for you.
We have now found a solution to sending out games for individual backers in Asia, and we're hoping to receive more stock from GQ this week. Once we have received these, we'll be sending them out straight away.

Hi Everyone,
Here’s a quick fulfillment update:  
USA - 90% of the US orders have now been shipped. These are being received every day now so please be patient and wait a few more weeks before contacting us if you haven’t received your game. Only 10% of the orders haven’t yet been shipped. These are orders that were either placed late on the website or that required manual actions. We are working our way through these as quickly as possible.

Quick fulfillment update. .
US backers: People are already receiving their copies and these should be received no later than 2 weeks time.
CAD backers: We're waiting on information about whether the pallets were received by Snakes and Lattes through their Buffalo warehouse.

Fulfilment update!
So we thought we would update everyone on the status of what's going on with fulfilment.
USA: The games have been at the warehouse for well over 2 weeks, and we are waiting for the green light from the fulfilment centre. I heard they *may* start sending things out next week, but whether they do, or the quantities they send out, I have no idea. I have been asking regularly on updates.

updates.update_userinfo: Update on the ships and positive reviews for Dice Hospital!
updates.update_content:
Update on the ships.
US/CAD: Arrived at port, should be on the way to the warehouse this week or next. Fulfilment likely to start mid-october (not a guarantee though.) US fulfilment sheets have been uploaded and approved by the fulfilment centre. Canadian backers will have their copies land freighted to Snakes and Lattes who will be handling your fulfilment and hopefully start around the same time as QuaterMaster Logistics.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping, Surveys, Essen and unboxing update
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
Just a quick update
Shipping
The ships are drawing near to their ports. The Australian ship arrives next week, the US bound ship arrives around the 20th September while the UK bound ship arrives around the 27th.

Apologies for not writing an update earlier. We had to take a break for summer while waiting for the manufacturing to finish and the dice to be corrected. The new (correct) dice took much longer than expected to arrive at the factory. Regardless...
Dice Hospital is coming!
In the past few weeks, we have gauged how many units of which game versions need to be sent where with our shipping partners. Finally, we have it confirmed that the games will be on the ship(s) on (give or take a few days) the for the US and European bound ships. I For the Australian and NZ fulfilment, this will be very soon, although it only takes 5-7 days to arrive to Australia. I should be getting the tracking numbers/vessels shortly from my partners.

Manufacturing pictures!
Just thought I'd show some of the pictures of what's going on behind the scenes at the factory. I asked for a few photos to see what was going on. The dice are obviously behind, but the miniatures of the ambulances are also finalising too (recently told this). The miniatures should be done before the dice I am told, but the production sample of those (see below) was approved and held the dice very nicely.

updates.update_userinfo: UK Games Expo success and manufacturing and shipping update
updates.update_content:
Did we meet you at the UK games expo?
Wow. What a successful UK Games Expo! There were 21,700 unique attendees, an increase of around 6000 on the previous year. It felt like every single one came to our stand haha. We had many people pre-order Dice Hospital from our stand with each of the 4 tables being full from the minute each day would start, to the minute the expo would end. It was amazing meeting so many of our backers for Dice Hospital in person and personally showing the latest production copy of Dice Hospital! I'm also glad people and backers who couldn't get on our tables last year were able to play this year. Let us know in the comments below if we met you!

updates.update_userinfo: UKGE, Dice Hospital manufacturing update and other news!
updates.update_content:
May update
First of all, we just want to apologise for missing the comments on the main page. There's been a few reasons for that which include: a) Not having notifications active on my (Caezar) phone - don't know how that happened, b) having a miscommunication within the team as to who was responsible for this, this has now been corrected with a clear strategy moving forward and c) We have been rushed off our feet with doing Pocket Pharma, Pocket Sub and Ruthless to print in addition to big preparations for the UK Games Expo (see below!) . Either way - we've corrected these issues and there should be someone regularly checking the comments and setting up updates!

campaign.story:
DinoGenics is a worker placement game where players compete to build the most successful and profitable dinosaur park. Each player takes on the role of a multi-billion dollar corporation, each with access to their private island park. Over the course of seven seasons, players will send workers to the nearby mainland to collect resources such as DNA, fences and other necessities needed to run a successful park.  

Once a player has assembled their resources, they get to choose how to layout their individual parks and decide which dinosaurs they will attempt to house. Parks with the most prestigious dinosaurs will attract the most visitors, but remember, dinosaurs have a mind of their own and if neglected or improperly penned, they will attempt to escape and spread havoc.
    DinoGenics plays out over 7 seasons, each composed of an Open Season and an Upkeep phase. During the Open Season phase, players will attract visitors based on the reputation of their individual parks. Reputation in DinoGenics is decided primarily by the types of dinosaurs a park contains; in general, the more dangerous the dinosaur, the more exciting it will be for visitors and increase your reputation the most.
The T-Rex is one of the most valuable dinosaurs when it comes to reputation, unfortunately it also requires the largest habitat and consumes more meat per season than any other dinosaur.
Reputation is important because the more visitors your park attracts the more money you will receive in a season. Reputation also determines player order, with the highest reputation park owners deciding where they send workers before lesser parks.
Players take turns assigning their workers to action spaces on the mainland board based on their reputation order. Once a worker is placed, a player immediately pays any associated costs and receives the benefit of the chosen Action Space.
DNA cards are just one of the resources that can be collected by workers. Turn in a complete set of DNA at the DinoGenics research facility to produce a matching dinosaur.
Mainland action spaces are limited. Players need to prioritize when and where they send their workers to get the best results. Having a bunch of high value carnivores is great until you don’t have enough meat to feed them. Once all players have assigned all of their workers, play progresses to the Upkeep Phase.
Placing workers during the open season allows players to produce new dinosaurs, arrange fences or buy facilities.
During the Upkeep Phase each park owner must attempt to feed any carnivores in his or her park. Failure to feed carnivores or properly pen dinosaurs will result in the potential destruction of park facilities or the death of visitors.
A focus on lower value herbivores can help you avoid high meat upkeep costs, but keep a close on your competitors. If they build heavy into carnivores, they will easily outpace you in reputation.
Following the feeding step, all visitors are returned to the main stockpile and any building resources or benefits are generated.  
At this point, the game will advance to the next season.
As a game of DinoGenics progresses, limited action spaces such as the Farm and the Uplink become highly contested. It is important to plan your turns in advance to prevent being blocked.
  Mutants on their own are not worth much but if you combo them with the right facilities you can make them pay off as much as more popular dinosaurs.
  Image is updated daily (Last Update: 11/1/17)
 Find us on Facebook, Twitter, Youtube and Boardgamegeek.
  Want to find out more about how DinoGenics plays? You can download a digital copy of the current rulebook by clicking the rulebook graphic below. Please be aware that rulebook artwork and layout are still a work in progress and subject to change.
    After numerous requests, we have decided to offer the most requested item from our first campaign. If you are interested in purchasing an additional set of Dinosaur Meeples, add the listed dollar amount to your Kickstarter pledge total. When the Pledge Manager is sent out, you will have the option to choose where the extra money was spent.
DinoMeeps add-on includes 6x of each normal dinosaur and 10x mutants.
    A render of one of the Double Layered Island Board now included with every copy of the game.
  DinoGenics now includes 20 custom Goat meeples with every copy of the game.
  Prototype of the Upgraded Fence Stretch Goal.
            We’ve been in close communications with our manufacturer and shipping company to reduce game weight and keep the associated shipping costs down. In order to make sure that these costs are as low as possible we are going to be charging shipping after the campaign ends.  Backers will gain access to our Pledge Manager by email roughly two months after this campaigns completion.
The below numbers are our best shipping estimates as of September 26, 2017 and may fluctuate slightly between now and the time we ship, but we are confident these numbers will be accurate within a couple dollars.
• US - $12  
• CA - $14  
• EU - $15

Also, in an effort to help backers in  more expensive regions, we are offering a group pledge level. If you can find a person to split a two pack of the game with you, shipping becomes dramatically lower per person.  The below prices are costs per "2-pack" of DinoGenics.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is a relaunch of DinoGenics, which we first brought to Kickstarter in August. During our first campaign, we learned a lot about how Kickstarter works as well as the limitations of the platform. Now, we are returning with a stronger understanding of the platform and our audience. We have also doubled down on our artwork and will have a number of new pieces to share with you in the coming days.

DinoGenics has been in development for over three years and we have finally brought it to a point where we feel it is ready for the public. Now, as we are nearing the finish line we need the little extra push that only Kickstarter can provide.

As it stands currently, the game has been in controlled playtesting for about two years and started blind-playtesting about eight months ago. Game art assets are about 85% complete and we have two great illustrators waiting on standby to finish production. Once the remaining artwork is commissioned everything will receive a final coat of polish and then it will be sent off to our manufacturer.

On the production side of things, we have chosen to go with Panda Games Manufacturing. Panda has been great to work with since the early days of our collaboration and has already provided us with some phenomenal production samples. With their help, we are confident that we can deliver a high quality product to rival anything put out by a major publisher.

One final hurdle is the matter of fulfillment time-frame and shipping. We have tacked on an extra couple months to our fulfillment timeline to accommodate any production delays. In addition, we have partnered with a shipping distributor that will provide customs friendly shipping to most of the world. Once manufacturing is complete, the game will be delivered to local hubs all around the world.

All of this said we are realistic and believe in complete transparency. If unforeseen delays occur, we are determined to keep our backers informed every step of the way. With your help, we intend to produce a quality product that we hope will satisfy all of our backers.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Final 24 hours to back DinoGenics: Controlled Chaos
updates.update_content:
Greeting Park Managers,
I just want to give everyone a final shout out that the DinoGenics: Controlled Chaos Kickstarter has entered its final 24 hours.  We've unlocked a ton of stretch goals including two additional dinosaurs, a two player co-op mode and a bunch of component upgrades.

updates.update_userinfo: DinoGenics: Controlled Chaos is now live on Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Ten years have passed since dinosaurs were re-introduced to the world. While the early years of park expansion proved fruitful, the market quickly grew oversaturated and public interest waned. 
Enter tech super giant, IntelliGen Designs,  partnering with DinoGenics IOM to bring prehistoric aquatic life forms back from extinction. IntelliGen Designs promises that the species made available from this partnership will be extremely profitable for local industries…

Greetings Park Managers,
We have a fully reworked version of the DinoGenics rulebook to share with you all today.  Our goal with this rework has been to organize the information into a format that is easier to learn and also provide a better quick reference.  While most of the content is the same, almost every page has been enhanced to provide better clarity and examples where appropriate.  You can download the current version of this rework here.

Greetings Park Managers,
We have some exciting news to share today.  This summer we will be returning to Kickstarter with a full expansion for DinoGenics!

Greetings Park Managers,
What a busy month and a half it has been!  We’ve had everyone in the company pitching in to respond to emails, answering questions and fielding replacement requests.  I can now say that over 3,000 copies of DinoGenics have made their way into backer hands.
Wrapping up deliveries in Canada

Greetings Park Managers,
We didn’t forget about you, Canada!   Apologies for the delay, this one has been frustrating for us as well, but I can now say that fulfillment is ready to start in Canada.  We received word this morning that Canada should be a pretty fast turn around and they expect all packages will be in the mail by the end of Wednesday.

Greetings Park Managers,
We have been informed that shipping started in Europe yesterday!  Europe is the second largest delivery zone after the United States so it will take a few days for all packages to go out.  This leaves only Canada as the last shipping region to go out.  To our friends from the north, we apologize for the delay.  The good news is that the shipment was scheduled to arrive at the distribution hub on Tuesday, so we are just waiting for confirmation of it being ready to ship to backers.

Greetings Park Managers,
I’m thrilled to announce that shipping started in the United States yesterday! Quartermaster  will be getting the bulk of the remaining orders out today with a few left to go on Friday.

Happy New Year Park Managers,
DinoGenics shipments are in the last leg of their journey!  Some copies of the game have already started to go out and last night we had our first confirmed recipient in Japan!  We have been on an amazing journey to get here, and we can’t wait to see the videos and pictures of all of you playing your new game.

Greetings Park Managers,

What a couple weeks it has been! We had assumed that once the games left the warehouses that it would be all smooth sailing ahead (literally) but it seems that bringing dinosaurs back into the world is a complex endeavor.   
The good news is that two out of three ships have left port and are on their way.

campaign.story:
Re-Chord is a strategy boardgame for 1-4 players which plays in approximately 30-45 minutes. Each player is a budding guitarist for one of the various genres of music. Using real guitar picks and chords, guitarists have to use cunning and clever strategies to become the most popular guitarist of all time. 
Learn real guitar chords while you play!
Formulate clever strategic plays quickly.
Unique pick powers make each turn a fun decision.
Interaction without a "take-that" feeling.
1-4 Players, Ages 8+, 30-45 minutes.
Video Link for Sharing: http://bit.ly/2yfSkBY
Yanaguana Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/yanaguanagames/
      Guitarists get a secret genre that indicates their color to start the game and want to fill the fretboard with their color, being careful not to reveal their genre too early. In addition to riffing around the fretboard, guitarists can score points by completing Chord Cards. 
Everyone starts the game with three random Chord Cards but can obtain more during the game. Playing a second variation of the same chord proves you are a skilled guitarist and triggers the Re-Chord score.  
Once the first four frets have been filled with guitar picks, the game ends and guitarists tally up their jam sessions. The guitarist and genre with the most total popularity wins and gets to play air guitar to any song of their choosing (*or just says good game and respectfully helps put the game back in its beautiful box.)
Re-Chord has been in Development for over a year, PAX South 2017 players enjoyed even the earliest version.
                    The Re-Chord Soloist mode puts solo players up against three varying levels of difficulty. The Automa's actions are being added to the current Chord cards and are very simple to follow. A full PDF of solo rules and Video of Solo play will be available very soon.
 Three difficulty levels.
Varying strategies based on genre.
Incredibly easy to play, difficult to master.
Not a highscore solo mode, a real Automa opponent.
The soloist mode was developed following Morten Monrad Pedersen's "Automa Approach" which is the amazing solo design theory behind Jamey Stegmaier games like Scythe and Viticulture. We'd like to thank Morten and Jamey for giving us their blessing to create a heavily inspired Automa opponent and solo mode.  
                                   Placing a white pick allows the guitarist to choose and place another pick from the public pile, taking its action if they wish.
Placing a red pick allows the guitarist to remove any other pick from the fretboard and place it back in the bag.
Blue picks allow a guitarist to MOVE or swap any other pick(s). Above you see the Blue pick MOVING another pick to an open location.
Blue picks allow a guitarist to move or SWAP any other pick(s). Above you see the Blue pick SWAPPING two pick's locations.
Grey picks allow a guitarist to turn any pick face down and then they may move it to an open space.
Purple picks allow any guitarist to pluck (turn face up) a face down pick and use its power if they wish.
Wylde picks can be placed anywhere on the fretboard, including replacing an existing pick. Wyldes count as all colors and face down for everyone's Chord Cards, but do not count for any genre scores during fret scoring.
    We have partnered with Backerkit to ensure that after the campaign backers can add on more copies of games, extras, and anything else made available. Backers will be able to adjust and increase order amounts prior to fulfillment.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Projects come with some amount of risk but we've done everything possible to mitigate the known variables. Yanaguana Games has published two titles previously and know the manufacturing process and the challenges that can arise. We've made the majority of the mistakes on our own dime which allows us to maximize your support by efficiently getting a great game delivered to you, the amazing backer. We've also partnered with Kickstarter Expert Daniel Zayas to help us avoid common pitfalls and mistakes we may not have been aware of. 

There are a few unique risks with Re-Chord that could always produce unknown issues, but the most apparent is the use of custom guitar picks. We've worked with our manufacturing partner to ensure they are prepared to produce these for us. The process of producing picks can however take a bit longer than wooden meeples or laser cut chit board which is reflected in our estimated delivery date. 

We want to deliver the best quality game to you as fast as possible. If we can expedite any part of the process without sacrificing quality it will be a priority. 

We want to thank you for putting your trust in our team. We know you work hard to be able to enjoy your games when the time comes and we are honored that Re-Chord will be joining your collection. If you have ANY questions during the campaign feel free to message Marshall or Andrew directly and we'll be happy to answer.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: What is it? Something exclusive? Something new? Let's get Re-Chord funded and find out. More reveals at 200 backers, more information on this image very soon!

Hey everyone! We are really making great progress this week. This morning Suzanne from the Dice Tower mentioned Re-Chord on the Crowdfunding Round Up! Check the video out. Remember to share the facebook video and share the campaign with friends, lets fund this week and unlock some extras!

updates.update_userinfo: Quick update in the still of the night!
updates.update_content:
Hello Backers! 

We've been up late working on ways to get the campaign momentum rolling again. You've all likely noticed a bit of a stall here at the roughly 40% mark. I'm told this is somewhat normal but that we need to remedy it quickly. We've got a few things in the works on our side including some upcoming social stretch goals.

We will be doing some live plays on facebook for the rest of the week on both Tabletop Simulator and at real shops. The first one kicks off tomorrow night at 9:30 EST on Tabletop Simulator. Rob from Pawn's Perspective will be my co-host! If you'd like to participate in that game, please message me!

Here comes the part where I ask you for help. We need more eyes on the project, this means sharing on facebook, twitter, instagram, and so on. We've added incentive to this a bit with some silly stretch goals and some very serious ones as well. Below is the graphic that was just added to the page detailing our first few social goals!

Hello everyone! We are scaling up that fretboard and have filled it 35% of the way so far! Today is just a quick update about a few of the stretch goals, our fun new guitar duels, and a reminder to share the campaign.

So the most common question lately is "What are the planned stretch goals?"
The first few unlocks right after funding are new sets of chord cards! The first major unlock is a solo variant where a single guitarist faces off against the corporate music machine "Automa" and tries to become the most popular against all odds! We've got a bit to go to get there, but I know we can do it with your help.

campaign.story:
Now UK and EU Friendly! See special UK and Eu Pledge Levels!
It’s time to build another treehouse!  
In the new stand-alone sequel to the Golden Geek Nominated Best Treehouse Ever (Best Card Game, Best Family Game, 2015), Best Treehouse Ever: Forest of Fun, players compete to build their best treehouse, outfitting their treehouse with cool rooms, and creating fun habitats for their favorite furry and feathered friends, while also making sure that their tree doesn't tip over and that their rooms are more impressive than all of their friends' rooms at the end of the game.  
In addition, our treehouse builders have leveled up their experience by visiting new locations in the forest that provide special abilities to help them in their new build. Building takes place over three weeks/rounds, and in each round, players use card drafting and spatial reasoning to add five new rooms to their treehouse. Players must pay attention to the other treehouses being built since they take turns determining which types of rooms score for everyone at the end of each round. At the end of the third week, the winner is the player with the best treehouse ever!  
But the best part? Best Treehouse Ever: Forest of Fun can be combined with Best Treehouse Ever to play up to 8 players!
Best Treehouse Ever: Forest of Fun is a game for 2 to 4 players (or up to 8 when combined with Best Treehouse Ever), ages 10 and up and is designed by Scott Almes.  
Where it all started! Best Treehouse Ever has since been published in 7 different languages around the world!
   ALL New Room Cards featuring illustrations by Claire Donaldson (Go Nuts For Donuts)!
Animal Cards to add to your treehouse for new scoring possibilities!
Forest Cards! Each location provides unique player powers!
Folding Score Board!
New Game Changers and rules for playing with up to 8 players!
Over-sized Box to contain Forest of Fun AND the original Best Treehouse Ever so you can take all the treehouse fun everyone in one easy package!
  Best Treehouse Ever: Forest of Fun will be the first “Big Box” game from Green Couch Games allowing owners of the original Best Treehouse Ever to store it all in one convenient box. The game includes 60 Room Cards, 12 Animal Cards, 10 Forest Cards, 4 Starting Tree Cards, 6 Scoring Cards, 8 Game Changer Cards, 4 Scoring Tokens, 4 Balance Markers, and a Folding Score Board!
                    You may add up to 2 additional copies of Best Treehouse Ever: Forest of Fun to your Basic, Basic PLUS, Deluxe, or Deluxe PLUS pledge level for the following prices:
US: $23 each.
Canada/Everywhere Else: $30 each.
       And here's a better look at that custom playmat that's included with the Deluxe pledge levels. It can be used with Best Treehouse Ever or Best Treehouse Ever: Forest of Fun.
  Best Treehouse Ever: Forest of Fun is available world-wide and all copies will ship from within the US except those going to the UK and EU which will be shipped from the UK. 
UK and EU copies will be shipping from within the UK with VAT paid!
 Shipping fees will be added to your pledge level when you select your home location.  
Added Shipping: US $4-8, Canada, UK, and EU-$13 (See Special UK and EU Pledge Level), Everywhere Else-$20 
Note: International Backers outside of the UK and EU will be responsible for any import fees, brokerage or delivery surcharges, or applicable taxes that may be levied after we have shipped your package. 
We have learned that shipping is a costly endeavor, especially with the recent rate increase in the US Postal Service and the increased box size and weight of this game. We must try to keep our costs as low as possible to keep our games at an appropriate price point for when they hit retail.  
We understand that shipping to our international friends can be cost prohibitive and that others have found creative ways to mitigate some of this cost. As a small company that handles our own fulfillment, we simply pass our shipping cost on to our backers. In addition, it is our goal to continue to develop our network of awesome international partners that we have worked with to localize Best Treehouse Ever for game markets around the world. So far these partnerships have led to Best Treehouse Ever being published in Russian, Ukrainian, Taiwanese, Chinese, German, Dutch, and French.
We are saying THANK YOU to our early adopters on Kickstarter by offering the game below MSRP. We'll also be adding some extra content and component upgrades at no extra charge (when we reach STRETCH GOALS, of course). 
We have plans to add value (STRETCH GOALS!) to Best Treehouse Ever: Forest of Fun that we think you will really appreciate. We plan to add value by upgrading components and increasing replayability with added game content.  
We have several stretch goals in mind and we hope to hit them all! But know that just as with our previous campaigns, we won't likely be adding more just to add more. We believe that more isn't always better, especially if it holds up production and delays delivery.  
That being said, we'll be listening closely to your feedback and ideas and will carefully consider all the ideas that comes our way.  
Here's a look at what's to come with YOUR help:
                           A sample of our even more cuddly new bear icon!
  Get invovled in the discussion to help us choose new Promo Room Ideas HERE!
 Tiles unlocked!
          We think this game is GREAT but don't just take our word for it! Check out these previews! (Please note that all pictures use prototype components and don't always reflect the final product.)  
Note: The reviews were made using a sample of final protoype art and copies of the original game, Best Treehouse Ever. 
  "All in all, if you like Best Treehouse Ever, you are going to like Forest of Fun. It takes a wonderful, family friendly drafting game, and adds a little bit of spice to the mix and freshens it all up a bit." - Brandon Kempf, What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing
   "Best Treehouse Ever: Forest of Fun succeeds in breathing fresh new life into a family favorite -- and make no mistake, Forest of Fun is still very much a family friendly game. It doesn’t overcomplicate the game, or add to the play time in any significant way, and it seamlessly integrates with the original. I’d highly recommend Best Treehouse Ever: Forest of Fun for gamer families and for the inner kid in most everyone." -Eric Buscemi from Cardboard Hoard
  "Building games are always fun to look at—Carcassonne, Kingdomino—when you're incrementally adding to a structure over the course of the game, it's fun to see what everyone has constructed by the end, and Best Treehouse Ever is no exception." -Jonathan Liu from GeekDad
       Check out the very thorough preview from Jake and Danielle of Draft Mechanic at about the 13 minute mark at the link above.
See how much people love the original Best Treehouse Ever by checking out these reviews!
        Scott Almes is the prolific game designer of the successful Tiny Epic series from Gamelyn Games as well as recent games such as Dicey Peaks, Island Hopper, Problem Picnic, Heroes of Land, Air and Sea, StarFall and more! He currently lives in Pittsburgh with his wonderful wife Beth. He's excited to bring Best Treehouse Ever: Forest of Fun back to your table to spur on more imagination and wonder!
Original concept illustration and graphic design: Adam McIver
Adam McIver is a gamer, artist, and game designer living in the Cincinnati area. His art and graphic design can be seen in projects from Gamelyn Games, Foxtrot Games, Renegade Games, Dice Hate Me Games, Eagle-Gryphon Games, Tasty Minstrel Games, as well as Green Couch Games' Best Treehouse Ever, Avalanche at Yeti Mountain, and Rocky Road a la Mode. He is the creative director for Tasty Minstrel Games. He also designed the new hit game, Ex Libris from Renegade Games!
Room Card and Forest Card Illustration: Claire Donaldson
Claire Donaldson is an illustrator and designer working out of Seattle. She’s known for sketching furiously and has a knack for imbuing inanimate objects with an unsettling degree of cuteness. She loved working on this project, and if you would like to see more of her work, you can find her portfolio at clairedoesntlaugh.com. Her credits include work with Daily Magic Games and Gamewright Games.
Cover art and Graphic Design: Andy Jewett
Andy Jewett is an illustrator and graphic designer living in Indiana. His resume includes work in games and comics with companies like Tasty Minstrel Games, Top Shelf Productions, and the Dice Tower. Andy also worked on the previous Green Couch Games title, Ladder 29. You can check out more of his work here.
Green Couch Games was founded by Jason Kotarski to release great little games that make great big connections. Best Treehouse Ever: Forest of Fun will be their 10th release following Fidelitas, Best Treehouse Ever, JurassAttack!, Avalanche at Yeti Mountain, Wok on Fire, Rocky Road a la Mode, OutLawed!, Ladder 29, and Before The Earth Explodes. You can check out our other games right here on our website!
Jason is also a game designer and co-host of 20 Minutes of Filler and runs the 20 Minutes of Filler Facebook Group that seeks to create a larger platform for the best games that come in small packages.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
My experience with our previous campaigns, Fidelitas, Best Treehouse Ever, JurassAttack!, Avalanche at Yeti Mountain, Wok on Fire, Rocky Road a la Mode, OutLawed!, Ladder 29 and Before The Earth Explodes has provided a solid foundation for me to build on. And so far I have been able to avoid delays and common pitfalls by paying special attention to the following areas and building on previous experience:

Art and Design. The art and design for the game is nearly complete so we'll be ready to print shortly after the close of the campaign. I always like to show you I mean business by paying for the art and design upfront!

Playtesting and Reviewing. Best Treehouse Ever: Forest of Fun has been tested by many different playtesters and even a bunch of game designers. I have sent a bunch of prototypes to a variety of reviewers. I want to earn your trust by providing you with a solid product that has been thoroughly tested and reviewed by folks from varying backgrounds and perspectives.

Past Experience. This is the tenth Kickstarter project I've run for Green Couch Games and I have helped with several other successful campaigns. Also, having spent many years working in retail and customer service, I understand the importance of treating backers with respect and following through with projects.

Of course, there are always unexpected circumstances that pop up, but I PROMISE to communicate every step of the way and do my best to use creative problem solving meet the challenges head on.

Thank you so much for giving Green Couch Games a chance. As a small company, I truly can't do this without you. I will do my best to thank you by creating great little games that you love to play.

Sincerely, 
Jason Kotarski, founder of Green Couch Games
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Our newest, BIGGER box game, Darwinauts is LIVE and FUNDED on Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Hello Builders! 
I hope this Summer finds you having a blast creating the treehouses that dreams are made of! 
I wanted to pop by for a visit to tell you about our latest dream and invite you to join us in helping make it bigger and better with your support.
Darwinauts, by Chris Bryan with art by THE Vincent Dutrait, is LIVE and FUNDED on KIckstarter. We've unlocked our first stretch goal and with your help we can do some much more.

Hello Builders.
I wanted to let you know that I finally heard back from our fulfillment partner in the UK to confirm that our shipment had arrived. I have submitted the orders to have them shipped to our last batch of backers so hopefully they are picked, packed, and shipped soon.
In my attempts to communicate with them, I got an away message stating that their staff was down a few bodies due to illness and it also mentioned that they are in the midst of  an extremely high volume of orders being placed so it make take sometime to get to our shipments. Nonetheless, the UK/EU Friendly Shipments are officially in process!

Hi Builders!
I just wanted to check back in with you about the shipping progress of Best Treehouse Ever: Forest of Fun. 
First, I want to apologize for my lack of communication over the last month or so. On top of getting the games shipped, I had to attend to some personal/family issues that took a significant amount of time and attention.

Hello Builders!
Games have begun making their way to backers. I have currently shipped about 60% of the games this week and last week. As I am packing and shipping most of the games myself with a little help from friends and family, it is quite the time consuming task! But I'm still working diligently to get the games out the door and to your table! Everything should be on the way in the next couple weeks. Thanks for your patience through this process.

updates.update_userinfo: Best Treehouse Ever: Forest of Fun has arrived at the warehouse!
updates.update_content:
Alright!
As of the last update a couple weeks ago I passed along the information I received from the logistics company: the games were to arrive by 9/13. This would have allowed me to pick up the games after GrandCon that following Monday and begin fulfillment. Unfortunately, their estimations were off and when asked for an update I was told that the games would be delivered to the warehouse yesterday (9/26) or today (9/27). So I've been anxiously awaiting the call from the warehouse that the game had landed.

Hello Builders,
I just got an update from our Freight Forwarder (the folks who handle the shipment from US Customs to our warehouse once it's crossed the ocean) and they expect the games to arrive on Sept. 9th with an estimated delivery to the warehouse on Sept 13th or 14th.  If the games arrive early enough on the 13th I will be able to retrieve them in time to make some available to backers for pick up at GrandCon next weekend! Fingers crossed. Either way,

Hello Builders,
I’ve been wrestling with computer issues all week (ah, the joys of being a one person company who has to wear all the hats...even for those positions that aren’t my strengths. The IT department being the chief example.). With that in mind this won’t be a fancy update.
I did, however, want to connect with you all briefly before I hit the road to GenCon.

Hello Builders!
It has been quite the process to get to this point but I'm pleased to share that the physical sample of Best Treehouse Ever: Forest of Fun has arrived and it's looking great!
Have a look for yourselves!

Hello Again Builders!
After several weeks of back and forth with our printer, we have sorted out the issue involved the card back art being sized incorrectly. We wanted to make sure that your experience with Best Treehouse Ever and Best Treehouse Ever: Forest of Fun is seemless when the games are combined so we needed to make sure that that colors and sizing of the cards matched as much as possible. Somewhere along the line one of our printers changed the size of the file we use for the card back so we have to adjust and then re-adjust this file for the new version to make sure it came out the same as the original. The final product turned out pretty awesome! The card on the right is from the originally Best Treehouse Ever and the left side is the new card.

Hello Tree People!
I wanted to come back with an update to let you know how things are going with the production process for Best Treehouse Ever: Forest of Fun!
We received digital proofs which are designed to give a look at all of the cards laid out on the sheets in the ways that they will be printed. So we have to go through the files and make sure all the cards are accounted for, the bleeds (the art that goes beyond the edge of where the cards will be cut) are right, and that the fronts match the back.

campaign.story:
Root is a game of woodland might and right. Stalk the woods as one of the Vagabonds, seize the initiative with the Eyrie birds of prey, rule over your subjects as the Marquise de Cat, or command the Woodland Alliance to create a new order. With creatures and cunning, you'll rule a fantastic forest kingdom in the ultimate asymmetric game of adventure and war.
The nefarious Marquise de Cat has seized the great woodland, intent on harvesting its riches. Under her iron rule, the many creatures of the forest have banded together. This Woodland Alliance will seek to strengthen their presence by building hideouts and launching missions to subvert the rule of the cats.
In this effort, the Alliance may enlist the help of the Vagabonds, who are able to move through the more dangerous woodland paths. Though some may sympathize with the Alliance’s hopes and dreams, these wanderers are old enough to remember the great birds of prey who once controlled the woods.
Meanwhile, at the edge of the region, the proud, squabbling Eyrie have found a new commander whom they hope will lead their faction to reclaim their ancient birthright. The stage is set for a contest that will decide the fate of the great woodland. It is up to the players to decide which group will ultimately take root.
(Note: prototype board and pieces)
Root is the next step in our development of asymmetric design. Like in Vast: the Crystal Caverns, each player in Root has unique capabilities and a different victory condition. Now, with the aid of gorgeous, multi-use cards, a truly asymmetric design has never been more accessible. 
In Root, the players drive the narrative, and the differences among the roles create unparalleled interaction and replayability. Leder Games invites you and your family to explore the fantastic world of Root!
Root is designed by Cole Wehrle (Pax Pamir, An Infamous Traffic, and John Company) and brought to life by master illustrator Kyle Ferrin (Vast: The Crystal Caverns, Vast: The Fearsome Foes, Stitches).
The Marquise directs her cats to build up her frontier economy while attempting to police the vast wilderness. By collecting and guarding her wood supplies, the Marquise must build workshops, lumber mills, and recruiters while crafting valuable infrastructure improvements.
The Eyrie muster their hawks to take back the woods. They must build roosts and capture as much territory as possible before they collapse back into squabbling and turmoil, choosing a new commander to guide them.
The Alliance hide in the shadows, recruiting forces and hatching conspiracies. They begin slowly and build toward a dramatic late-game presence—but only if they can manage to keep the other players in check.
The Vagabond plays all sides of the conflict for his own gain. He aids or fights other factions to earn their trust or ire, while picking through forest ruins in search of new equipment, all in service of his hidden, mysterious quest.
Rewards shipping to addresses within Australia, Canada, the EU, and the US will be shipped from within those countries.
International shipments will be subject to customs charges depending on the country to which you are shipping. Legally, we cannot label the game as a gift.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Since our last Kickstarter, our company has grown considerably from one person to five people. We now have a steady process to deliver games and a plan for project management.

We are currently waiting for Vast: The Fearsome Foes and the Vast: The Crystal Caverns miniatures box set to return from the printer in December. This will not impact our day-to-day operations, as the operations team will handle fulfillment while the creative team will manage Root and eventually Vast: The Mysterious Manor going into publication.

There are risks to the continuity of the business if something should happen to Patrick Leder. However, in this circumstance, we have contingency plans with Patrick Leder’s spouse and Jacob Tonding, the Operations Director of Leder Games.

We have many established business partners in every part of the process, from printing to customer service to fulfillment. We do not foresee any challenges and can change partners as needed.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Final Hours of Root: The Underworld Expansion
updates.update_content:
Dear backers,
We have now entered the final hours of Root's new Kickstarter. We are very grateful that so many of you have come together to make this campaign a success. On the off-chance you missed the announcement of the campaign, it's not too late. As usual we've got plenty of freebies for our backers, and we've greatly expanded the shipping options since the campaign's launch.

Dear Root Backers, 
Today we are launching the Root: the Underworld Expansion on Kickstarter.
When we first introduced Root in the fall of 2017, we could scarcely imagine the success the game would come to enjoy or how deeply its world would resonate with players around the world. You have amazed us all.

updates.update_userinfo: Two SXSW Nominations and an Expansion on the Horizon!
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
It's been awhile since we last updated this project, but we've got some news to share about the future of Root.   
First, I'm delighted to announce that Root has been nominated for two SXSW Gaming awards: Most Fulfilling Community-Funded Game and Tabletop Game of the Year. It's a huge honor to have our game nominated for these awards. Winners are determined by a panel of judges as well as by a public vote and will be awarded in March at the show. (Note: each category is voted for independently, so you can easily skip around to the games you want to support.)

Just wanted to give everyone a new shipping update on where we were on everything: 
US
Backers should already have received their games by now. Only the shirts and art prints are being sent separately and should be in your hands in a few weeks. Sorry on the miscommunication on how soon we could get these sent.

Hey guys!

Just a shipping update for everyone:
US
Atlas Games handled a majority of US pledges before we left for Gencon and tracking numbers were uploaded Monday of last week.

Howdy Folks!
Freshly exhausted from last week's shipping, it's time for all of us here at Leder Games to pile into vans (or planes) and get to Gen Con 2018!
We will be on the road Tuesday and will be busy with the convention for the following week. As you might expect, we won't be as active in the comments section here on Kickstarter or answering direct messages at that time. I apologize in advance for any delay in getting back to you all.

updates.update_userinfo: Quick Shipping note on the Art Prints and T-Shirts
updates.update_content:
Hey folks,
I just have a quick update today. Shipping continues. The majority of copies (for US backers) have been sent out and the remaining will be out by Monday. Some people may even be getting their games as early as this Saturday. Over the past week, we've relied a lot on local backers and friends and family who have jumped into the fray to help us with packing. Without them, shipping at this speed would not have been possible. Our fulfillment partner, Atlas Games, has been wonderful as well.

updates.update_userinfo: A plea to use official support channels (and a little shipping news)
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
Over the past few days we've been inundated with a flood of questions coming by every means imaginable, from facebook messages to our personal accounts to tweets, certified mail, telegrams, and carrier pigeons. Perhaps now would be a good time to remind everyone that, if you have a specific concern about your order, there's really only one good way to contact us: email us at support@ledergames.com.

If you miss it, the video will be available afterwards. Patrick, myself, and several other staff members will be lurking in the chat window, so feel free to stop by and say hi!
