campaign.story:
The Little Flower Shop provides a relaxing and enjoyable gaming experience in which you create a beautiful display of flowers in your shop window. The game is quick to play and easy to learn, yet requires interesting decisions without causing analysis paralysis. Designed by Steve Finn of Dr. Finn’s Games, The Little Flower Shop continues his tradition of making filler games that have a lot more going on than you first realize.
Mechanically, the game uses a familiar card drafting mechanic in which players receive a hand of cards, choose a card to keep, then pass the remaining cards to the next player. The familiar card drafting system makes it very easy to learn, especially for those who’ve played similar games. At the same time, the friendly theme, beautiful artwork and interesting scoring system transforms the familiar into a unique gaming experience that can be enjoyed by casual and more experienced gamers alike.
  Note: The rulebook file above contains a reference card on the last two pages, but this will be a separate reference card in the game.
       During the campaign, many backers requested a 5th player expansion pack. Due to popular demand, I've added an option to include in your copy of the game an expansion pack for 5 players.  If you would like to have this pack added to your game, please add $7 to your total pledge (shipping included).
To use the cards, they are simply added to the game and then removed when playing with fewer than 5.  The flower cards will have no "filler," so they can be easily distinguished from the cards in the base game.  Also, I will slightly change the color of the purple vases to make it easier to pull them out.  The other cards will be easy to remove as needed.  Note also that the lack of filler adds a new element to the game if you're using the filler scoring, as these flower cards will not give bonus points.
Here's a brief explanation of the rules from Dr. Finn. Reviews of the game are found further below.
Rahdo explains the standard game in the following 2-player game:
 Rahdo explains the 2-player variant in the continuation of his game:
  Rules for solo play are also included. This game variant utilizes a push-your-luck mechanic, making it a whole lot of fun as a solo gaming experience. 
  Kickstarter backers receive the Flower-Filler Promo Pack that adds variety to the base game. The pack will only be available during Kickstarter campaigns, though retailer backers of this project also receive a few packs for their own stores. The pack has 8 cards: 4 flower bonus cards, 3 filler bonus cards, plus 1 instruction card.  At the game's start, a bonus card of each type is flipped showing the popular flower and filler for the game. Players score bonus flower power for displaying the popular flowers and fillers in their windows.
• Get a fun game by a highly regarded game designer.  All of Dr. Finn's games receive glowing reviews from members of the board gaming community.  
• Own a great game to play with gamers and non-gamers.  Dr. Finn is well known for designing easy to learn games that appeal to all levels of game players. This game is especially good as a "gateway" game.  
• Help bring this game to existence. If this campaign does not fund, the game very likely will not be made. 
• No post-Kickstarter bargain prices. You will not find Dr. Finn's games on sale at online retailers a week (or even months) after a Kickstarter campaign because I do not sell my games to them. I do have my own sales, but I usually wait until the game has been published for a while to do so. 
• Receive a Kickstarter exclusive. Get the Flowers-Filler promo pack that will not be available other than through Kickstarter campaigns. 
• Access to promotional items.  This campaign provides an opportunity to pick up other Dr. Finn's promotional items, such as the Institute for Magical Arts promo pack. 
• Great bundle prices. This campaign provides an opportunity to get multiple Dr. Finn's games at a great bundle price. Check out the various levels to see the great deals. You can also add games at great prices.
• Support an independent game designer.  Dr. Finn's Games is not a big company and will only continue with continued successful crowdfunding campaigns.   
Thanks to all the reviewers for taking the time to play and review the game. None of the reviewers received financial compensation for their reviews.
            Disclaimer for Ed's preview video: Ed and I worked together on Herbaceous (and are working together on upcoming projects).
              The flower illustrations were done by hand by botanical artist Sarah Wry. Sarah spent nearly 20 years working for environmental and animal welfare organizations in the UK (where she is from) and the USA.  After having children, Sarah devoted her free time to art and took the New York Botanical Garden Certificate in Botanical Illustration. Sarah sells both bird and botanical prints and originals and has exhibited in the NY area. Her paintings are rendered in startling accuracy and keenly observed detail.  She works out of her studio in Chappaqua, NY.  More of her work can be seen on her website. 
The illustration of the woman on the box cover and the order cards was done by Rocio Ogñenovich, who also did the promotional video. All the graphic design comes from the hand of her husband, Sebas. If you want to know more about them, please visit their website for OK Art Studio.
Support this project and the arts at the same time! Original artwork from the game is available during this Kickstarter campaign at the $200 and $250 levels. These are not prints, but original works of art. The artist would normally sell these types of artworks for $400 or more.
 ARTWORK DETAILS
Each piece is a signed watercolor on 300lb acid free, bright white, hot press paper. All pieces are each 8"x10" in a 14"x16" matt.
Tulip (NOT AVAILABLE -- CHOSEN BY A BACKER)
  Iris (NOT AVAILABLE)
  Rose (available)
  Flower Shop (available)
  You can customize your reward level by adding on games to any pledge level above $20. To add promotional packs, see separate section below. Please read carefully and contact Dr. Finn directly if you have any questions.
HOW TO ADD GAMES
Choose the add-on games from the list below 
Total the costs for the add-on games 
Add extra shipping costs (if outside the U.S.-- see below) 
Add games' cost + additional shipping costs to the amount of your pledge level 
Inform Dr. Finn of your add-on choices AFTER the campaign via a survey 
SHIPPING COSTS FOR ADD-ON GAMES
Your pledge level includes shipping costs for the rewards of your level. For add-on games, you must add shipping costs to cover the add-on games. For U.S. backers, shipping costs are already included in the prices. If you are in the U.K., please add $7 for the first add-on game, then $3 for each additional add-on game. All others must add $10 for the first add-on game, then $5 for each additional add-on game.
EARN A FREE GAME
After adding on games, if the total number of games (not promotional packs) is 4 or more, you earn an additional game of your choice from the add-on list (excluding C.O.G.).  Free shipping for the bonus game regardless of your location.  You will let Dr. Finn know of your choice after the campaign has ended.
LOW QUANTITY ALERT
Some Dr. Finn's games and promotional packs are getting low in stock and it is not feasible to track add-on items during the campaign. It is possible (but unlikely) that there is not enough of a particular game to fulfill all rewards. If this happens, you will be refunded all expenses related to adding that item on.
HOW TO ADD PROMO PACKS
Promo packs may be added to any level or you can back just for promo packs at the Promo Pack Level.
 Choose the add-on packs from the list below.  
 Total the costs for the packs 
 Add extra shipping costs (if outside the U.S.-- see below) 
 Add packs' cost + additional shipping costs to the amount of your  pledge level 
 Inform Dr. Finn of your add-on choices AFTER the campaign via a  survey
SHIPPING COSTS FOR PROMOTIONAL PACKS
The promotional packs include free shipping in the U.S. Outside the U.S., add $3 for the first pack (automatically added). You must manually add $2 for each additional pack.
Engraved Wood Butterfly Garden Collector's Box
  Shipping to the United States: All games going to U.S. backers will be shipped from within the U.S. either directly from Dr. Finn's via USPS or through Amazon fulfillment services.  
Shipping to European Union: All games going to non-U.S. destinations will ship from the U.K., which means E.U. backers will not be subject to additional taxes or duties. You will receive a notice when games ship from Games Quest. No tracking information is provided. Promo packs may or may not ship from the U.S. and so may be subject to duties. 
Shipping to all other destinations (including Canada): Games will ship from the U.K. All items may be subject to duties and taxes imposed by your country's customs office. You will receive a notice when games ship from Games Quest. No tracking information is provided. Promo packs, however, might be shipped separately from the U.S. and may also be subject to duties. 
Costs: The listed shipping costs for those outside the U.S. are lower than the actual shipping costs because Dr. Finn's Games has reduced your shipping costs by incorporating some of those costs into the prices of the games. 
Kickstarter backers have a wide variety of opinions about the purpose of crowdfunding. My own view is that Kickstarter's greatest strength is to help the "little guy or gal" bring something fun, creative, and good into existence, something that would otherwise be left aside. Dr. Finn's Games is a small company that relies heavily on Kickstarter campaigns to stay in business. My goal is to make sure that backers are pleased with the campaign from start to finish. So I maintain a good level of contact, with an appropriate amount of updates throughout the process, and I invite backers to contact me directly. I do my best to listen and respond quickly.  I've had 11 successful campaigns, almost all of which were completed right on time. The only late project was late by a month. I also try to ensure that my backers are getting the best deal on the game (at least for the first 6 months from release). Since my games are not distributed, you will not find them for sale at online retailers at 40% off a week after they hit the market (or even months after).  Of course, as a game gets older, I often have to sell the remaining copies I have at a discount, but that's usually down the road.  
Let me mention my stretch goal philosophy.  I try to design my games to be whole without needing additional components. My primary use of stretch goals is to improve the quality of the components, because I believe backers should be rewarded for helping the project reach higher funding goals.  
My promotional pack philosophy is also a part of this. I want to reward Kickstarter backers with access to something special, so I do offer promotional packs that usually just add a little variant to the game, rather than a full expansion.  I frequently get requests outside of Kickstarter campaigns for access to the packs, but I do not sell them.    
If you are considering picking up more than just The Little Flower Shop, Boardgamegeek.com is the best place to do research on Dr. Finn's Games. Just go to the site and enter the game name to find out more about my games. Or, watch some of the videos below.
The Game Boy Geek Reviews Biblios
Rahdo's Final Thoughts on Biblios Dice
The Ant Lab Explores Butterflies
Ryan Metzler Reviews Capo dei Capi
Rahdo's Final Thoughts on Cosmic Run: Rapid Fire
Ant Lab plays and reviews C.O.G.
Bower Reviews Foragers
The Boardgame Corner reviews Herbaceous
The Charters Family reviews Let Them Eat Shrimp
Rahdo's Final Thoughts of Slush Fund 2
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Please read carefully before backing this project. 

PRIOR KICKSTARTER PROJECTS 
All prior Kickstarter campaigns for Dr. Finn's Games have been completed, with the exception of Cosmic Run: Rapid Fire which is on time for a September delivery.

PRODUCTION RISKS 
Game manufacturing and publishing contains a number of risks. For this project, the greatest risks follow from the fact that the games will be manufactured in China and shipped to the U.S. The most serious threat in this regard concerns quality control over the manufacturing. A more likely threat, though less serious, is the possible delays involved. Dr. Finn's can mitigate both of these concerns. First, I will be using a manufacturer who has produced good results on game projects in the past. Second, I have successfully completed almost all of my Kickstarter campaigns right on time or even early (only 1 project was a few weeks late). If any delays do unexpectedly occur, backers will be notified promptly.

MISSING/DAMAGED ITEMS 
If you receive any games that are missing items, please contact me at doctorfinns@gmail.com and replacements will be promptly shipped. If the game arrives damaged, you'll receive replacements for whatever is damaged. Please send along a picture, as I may be able to get reimbursed from the shipper. For the past few projects (after switching manufacturers and shipping companies), we've had a very low defect rate (less than 1%). 

REFUNDS 
Refunds are not usually given, unless there is a failure to deliver the games you've requested. However, if you are completely unsatisfied with any game, please contact me and we can discuss it. 

LOW QUANTITY ALERT
Some Dr. Finn's games are getting low in stock and it is not feasible to track add-on items during the campaign. It is possible (but unlikely) that there is not enough of a particular game to fulfill all rewards. If this happens, you will be refunded all expenses related to adding that item on.

DELIVERY DATE 
Unlike many Kickstarter campaigns, Dr. Finn's Games has a great track record of being on time. Of course, unexpected things happen and there is chance that the game will not be shipped on time. I will keep you updated if the unexpected happens. Unless otherwise noted, all items will ship with The Little Flower Shop at the same time. 

UNDELIVERED ITEMS 
If you provide an incorrect address or fail to update your address and a game is returned, it would be nice of you to pay for the re-shipment. However, I have paid for it in the past, though I think it really should be your responsibility. 

SHIPPING 
Please read the shipping section above. 

UPDATES 
Through this campaign you may receive updates on Dr. Finn's Games' other projects. However, such updates will be infrequent. 

By backing this project, you acknowledge and accept the risks and challenges just stated. 

Thanks! Dr. Finn's Games
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Masters of Elements is a new expansion of the critically acclaimed Vikings Gone Wild, a game mixing with great harmony Resource Management and Deck Building.
      In this expansion, players are getting back to building their villages and fighting to impress the gods. But this time, Masters of Elements have joined their ranks!
 In Masters of Elements, each player gets to pick a Master of Elements. This Master will produce an Element Token every round that will be allocated to a Building.  
  Each player gets to draft 3 permanent Artefacts at the beginning of the game. They sit on an extra player board provided with this expansion.
Each of these Artefacts will provide powerful and asymmetric abilities to all players around the table.
  In this expansion, we wanted to move the type of decision you make from "attack vs defense" strategy to a more elaborate combo-oriented thinking.
Most Units now carry an extra function that can be activated using the Elements on your buildings!
  At the beginning of the game, everyone is given a God randomly. If we manage to unlock more than the 4 base Gods, each player is actually given 2 Gods to choose from. The special effect of this God is immediately available as soon as you reach level 3!
                                                                       Congratulation for unlocking Borr, father of Odin!
Lucky Duck Games Facebook Fan Page is here. 
Lucky Duck Games Twitter Profile is here.
Vikings Gone Wild Official Facebook Forum is here.
                             This pledge contains:
   - Masters of Elements Expansion
   - All Masters of Elements Stretch Goals Unlocked
   - Money-back Guarantee
This pledge is ideal for someone who already bought the base game on Kickstarter or in retail and is looking for a deeper and more strategic experience of the game.
  This pledge contains:   
  - Vikings Gone Wild (Base Game - Retail Version)
  - Masters of Elements Expansion
  - All Masters of Elements Stretch Goals Unlocked
  - Money-back Guarantee
This pledge is ideal for someone who has not bought the base game yet and wants to experience the most strategic experience this game has to offer.
The Base Game included in this pledge is the Retail Version, without any Kickstarter content from the first campaign.
  This pledge contains:
  - Vikings Gone Wild (Base Game - Retail Version)
  - Masters of Elements Expansion
  - It's a Kind of Magic Expansion
  - Guild Wars Expansion
  - Ragnarok Expansion (Solo/Coop experience)
  - All Masters of Elements Stretch Goals Unlocked
  - Money-back Guarantee
Get yourself the full range of experiences this game system has to offer. From the spell oriented strategy of It's a Kind of Magic to the 2 vs 2 mode of the Guild Wars expansion, or as a cooperative/solo experience to survive the flow of the Undead Army in Ragnarok, you will get it all in its beautiful Viking Glory!
The Base Game included in this pledge is the Retail Version, without any Kickstarter content from the first campaign.
     We are very excited to announce the release of 3 unique Booster Packs. Each pack is unique (no random cards) and always composed this way:  
1x Divine Favor 
1x Artefact 
10x Unit Cards 
We have built one pack per Element. We are leaving you the surprise to open them. Want to bet what is inside? :)
PS: $12 gives you 3 Packs. That is all you need.
PS2: These cards are unique and totally different from any cards we will offer you in Stretch Goal or in the expansion.
   We heard it during the entire campaign: "Give us the big box" :D  
We wanted to make sure we would provide a box big enough to cover this expansion and any future ones (yes there could be more!). So we are producing a custom-sized box almost 2 times higher than the original box in order to contain everything:  
All cards.
All boards. 
All tokens. 
All rulebooks. 
All neoprene boards (yes, you read right!).
We provide dividers by expansions and by type of cards, depending on the way you prefer to sort your cards!  
  In Vikings Gone Wild, players take the role of heads of clans fighting against each other to prove to the gods who is the best.    
During each turn, you play the cards in your hand to buy Units or Defense cards, erect Buildings and attack other players. You will have to find the right balance between investing in your economy (buildings, specials cards) and growing your army! 
     It's a Kind of Magic expansion introduces original core concepts through new Buildings, Units and a new type of card: Spells!    
  It focuses on deck manipulation and will transform your experience of Vikings Gone Wild in a very interesting, magical, way!
     Guild Wars expansion introduces new core concepts through new Buildings, Units and Defenses!    
  A brand new 2 vs 2 mode is at the heart of this expansion, but most cards can be used in a regular game.
    The Ragnarok expansion is a solo or cooperative expansion for Vikings Gone Wild.        
  In order to win, you have to defeat the Undead Army before your time runs out! Will you be able to save us all? 
   This 1st Season Pack contains the 110 Kickstarter Exclusive cards of the previous Kickstarter! We saved you the price of the box (who needs boxes anyway) to put this pack at a very affordable price! 
     We have selected the perfect fit sleeves for you - BCW 58x89 Sleeves.

Adding sleeves to a Kickstarter adds a fair layer of logistic complexity, but many struggled to find the right fit for this game before so we decided to do this for you. 
 This add-ons won't add any shipping cost, no matter the quantity you pick or the pledge you select. 
 $5 per pack of 100 Sleeves (2x50). 
 $20 per pack of 500 Sleeves (10x50).
Cards quantities per game:
Base Game: 220 cards
It's a Kind of Magic: 110 cards
Guild Wars: 110 cards
Ragnarok: 55 cards
KS 1st Season: 110 cards
5th Viking: 55 cards
3x Boosters: 36 cards
Masters of Elements: 219 as of Stretch Goal #27, can we get the last one?
  Many of you have asked for ways to upgrade their gears, and more specifically their player board! We love neoprene mats ourselves, so it did not take too much convincing to put us at work on the idea.  
Bringing these playmats to life, we wanted to bring something different enough that the upgrade would feel truly special. Mateusz spent some time redesigning our standard player pad and came up with 4 unique ones!
This add-on contains:
x1 Thor Neoprene Playmat
x1 Grendel Neoprene Playmat
x1 Ragnar Neoprene Playmat
x1 Valkyrie Neoprene Playmat
  We first wanted to have both mats joined into one large play-mat. But looking at every single play-tests we ran, tables were never big enough to put the Artefact board on top or at the bottom of the base game player mat. So we decided to separate them to give the freedom of arranging your table the way you want!
This add-on contain:
4x Masters of Elements Artefacts Neoprene Playmats
  Many of you have asked for that 5th player expansion! It took us a while to find a proper way to include only a cardboard mat. Since we will include for free a 5th Artefact cardboard pad in the Master of Elements, you only need the base game player mat.
This add-ons contain:
1x Base Game cardboard player mat.
55 cards (including 1 Starting Deck, more Missions, Units, Defenses, Odin's Path, etc).
  If you simply want to upgrade your 5th player to the full neoprene experience, this add-on is for you!
1x Hel's Neoprene Playmat.
1x Masters of Elements Artefact Neoprene Playmat.
  How to add an Add-On to my pledge?
It depends if you already pledged or not.
If you didn't already pledged, then when you do, simply change the pledge amount. You just need to add to that amount the total cost of all the add-ons you want. For instance, if you want to pledge for the Masters of Elements Expansion alone at $35, but you also want to add one pack of 500 sleeves at $20, then you'll select the $35 pledge, and change the automatically filled up "$35" by 35 + 20 = "$55".
 If you want to add something to your pledge, then go to this page which lets you manage your pledge, and change the amount. You can do so by adding the total cost of all the add-ons you want. If you chose the $35 pledge for the Masters of Elements Expansion alone and decide to add one pack of 500 sleeves at $20, then change "$35" by 35 + 20 = "$55".
                                               Grâce à notre distributeur Atalia, qui s'occupe de la livraison de tous les jeux Vikings Gone Wild en France et en Belgique, nous pouvons offrir les frais de port pour la France et la Belgique dans certaines conditions. Si vous décidez de retirer votre jeu depuis l'une des boutiques partenaires d'Atalia, et seulement dans ce cas, alors vous n'aurez pas à payer de frais de port. L'argent ainsi économisé sera versé par Atalia à la boutique que vous aurez sélectionnée.
Vous pouvez retrouver sur cette page la liste des boutiques éligibles pour cette offre. Pour le moment vous n'avez rien de plus à faire, tout ceci sera mis en place lors du Pledge Manager, après la campagne.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Cards being the main component of Vikings Gone Wild - Masters of Elements means that this project has a lower level of risk than others, particularly those with lots of miniatures. 

That being said, outside of making sure that the game is properly prepared and choosing our partners wisely (printers, logistics, etc.), it is not impossible that we face delays from uncontrollable sources. This may cause some delay in the delivery date but rest assured that, if this were to happen, we will keep you informed about the situation.

Refund Policy

All pledges can be refunded up to the completion of the Pledge Manager, no questions asked. 
If the refund is asked more than 60 days after the end of the Kickstarter campaign, 10% will be deducted from the amount (corresponding to the charges incurred by Kickstarter and Stripe, since we will not be refunded of them at that point), and the refund will have to be done via PayPal instead of the Credit Card you used on Stripe.

Terms and Conditions

Any costs shown in EUR are based on the exchange rate in effect during the first day of the campaign, and may change during the campaign. The price reference to consider is the price in USD. 
By pledging to this Kickstarter, you acknowledge that the final appearance, materials and content of the rewards (and the Kickstarter) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project is active.

You agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret we are unable to ship to PO Boxes.

Thank you!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
BE A VIKING! PLAY DRAKKAR!
In Drakkar - the card game, you are the leader of a mighty Viking clan. Your goal is to prove to the gods that you are the strongest Viking on the island over the course of three months of pillaging.
During each round (month) you will play cards (including some that you have stolen from your rivals!) to build your ship (the Drakkar), hire new warriors, store beer, and get ready for sailing and pillaging!
After three complete rounds, the player who collects the most victory points is the winner. You will have to find the right balance of offensive and defensive strategy to become the greatest of all Viking leaders!
Drakkar - the card game is a fast and fun game for 3 to 6 players, that plays in 20 minutes.  
          Everyone who gets the game through Kickstarter will also receive a special promo card: Sif 
She is the most beautiful of goddesses, the other players cannot resist her charm and... sword 
            Drakkar - the card game is a fast and fun Viking game. Easy to learn and quick to play! The game is simple enough that even young gamers will enjoy it, but has enough strategy to engage grown-ups as well.
There is lots of exciting player interaction as you steal resources and cards, sabotage ships and mercilessly pick on your foes. You need to think about which card (and which side of that card) to play. Double-sided cards give you plenty of options!
The game comes with the "Village Cards" that will allow you to be in charge of a Viking village giving you a very special ability. 
It comes with 7 cards with unique art.
In Drakkar - the card game, icons are used to make the game language neutral.
                Everything is easy to read and understand. The game itself is simple and family friendly. This is a game that even the kids can enjoy. - GAMING BITS 
We loved that it plays quickly; thirty minutes included the learning time. In order to be successful, you need to find the right balance of offensive and defensive strategy. - PALADIN ELLIOT
Die Grafiken der Karten sind sehr hübsch (und lustig) gestaltet und treffen das spassige Wikinger-Thema absolut. - HEIMSPIELE
Sehr schnelles familäres Wikingerkartenspiel mit einem gewissen Ärgerfaktor. Geeignet als Lückenfüller und Energielieferant eines Spielabends. - BRETTSPIELBOX
Il regolamento è molto semplice, coinvolgente e risulta accessibile anche ai novizi, così come le carte ben illustrate e di intuitiva comprensione. - NERDANDO.COM
Drakkar piace e diverte un po' tutti; per gli appassionati di filler games questo è un titolo assolutamente da seguire! - IDEE LUDICHE
Drakkar est un jeu qui amusera vos enfants et qui vous permettra de passer du bon temps avec eux! - L' ECOLE DU JEU
Drakkar will impress you with its simplistic goals and card management difficulty. - FATHER GEEK
You don't have to be a Viking to enjoy Drakkar... It just adds to the fun! - BOARD DADS PODCAST
        Pick up your Starter Set copy at ESSEN SPIEL 2018 or in Piacenza (Italy). Check the corresponding pledge!
  Pick up your Deluxe Set copy at ESSEN SPIEL 2018 or in Piacenza (Italy). Check the corresponding pledge!
      - Learn more about Brides & Bribes
               We use quality fulfillment companies in the United States and Europe to keep shipping costs as low as possible.
No extra customs charges for EU and USA. 

Please check the shipping costs for the other rewards in the country list of each pledge.
Drakkar - the card game is our second project and we're so excited to share it with you. As you can see the art is finished and the game is quite complete. But we need your support to make it happen!
WHY BACK THIS PROJECT? 
A VERY SPECIAL PRICE: 24% discount off the game retail price (MRSP 25 € ).
SUBSIDIZED SHIPPING: We assume part of the shipping cost to keep it as low as possible for every backer.
KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE CONTENT: Exclusive material!
DELUXE EDITION: This edition will include 60 unique wooden tokens and one big cloth bag printed with the game logo.
We want to thank the board gaming community for their support. So many of you helped us in getting this game to where it is today. Thanks to you we increased the number of players up to 6 and we created a nice expansion to vary the game even more. Thank you so much!
Thanks to: Elio Finocchiaro, Illustrator of some cards of Characters, Objects and Missions. He illustrated cards like the Vikings Team Up.
Keep in touch and stay up to date on all of our projects!

Share the Kickstarter!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We successfully delivered our first KS project Brides & Bribes from which we have learned a lot of valuable lessons about production, logistics and shipping. Now, we are much more confident to create a second great game with your help!
The game has been going through playtesting for months now, and the vast majority of the art is complete.
Once the campaign ends, all we need to do is put the finishing touches on everything, and send it to the printer!

If an issue does occur, we promise we'll inform you and be transparent regarding how we are going to resolve it.

Prepare to engage on a new journey!

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging on this Kickstarter project, you acknowledge that the final appearance, materials and content of the rewards are subject to change and may differ from what is presented during the Kickstarter campaign.

You agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your reward as entered in the kickstarter pledges, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret we are unable to ship to PO Boxes.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Designed by Justin Blaske (Area 1851, Mint Works), Mint Delivery is a refreshingly light pick up and deliver game for 2 to 5 players with easy-to-learn rules and exciting strategic gameplay, all in about fifteen minutes.  
Its compact size makes it easy to put in your pocket and take it anywhere. Coupling that with its approachable ruleset, Mint Delivery is a great tool for introducing new players to the genre of pick up and deliver.
Check out the Mint Delivery rules to see more detail about what makes Mint Delivery tick.
All Cards contained within a copy of Mint Delivery are printed upon Premium 305GSM blue core card stock. Mint and Truck Tokens are made of Wood and all other tokens are made from 2mm thick chipboard. All printed components will have a linen finish.   
James Hudson - Druid City Games  
Married with Board Games 
Lindsay - Shiny Happy Meeples
What's Eric Playing
What's Eric Playing - #125 - Mint Delivery [Preview]
 Board Game Geek Comments 
"...Even if pick up and deliver games are not your cup of tea try this one out and you might find a renewed interest in the genre." - MHGreenleaf
"Played a prototype yesterday and really enjoyed it. Similar to Mint Works, even though it's small there's a lot going on." - MichaelDyrud
You can download the rules here
In Mint Delivery, players take the role of a mint delivery truck driver, driving around the area taking orders for mints, then delivering them. Each player has two actions on their turn, such as moving, loading their truck, and upgrading the mints they are carrying. Once enough orders have been taken, the game ends.
Whoever has fulfilled the highest value of orders will be deemed the employee of the month and win. 
Five24 Labs on Social Media:
Facebook
Twitter
Newsletter
Discord
Mint Delivery was created after the success of Mint Works, with the idea to introduce another mechanism to non-gamers while still being interesting enough for gamers to want to bring it to the table.
I wanted to come up with another quick easy to teach game for a mechanism that I felt didn't have a lot of options that didn't take a long time to play, while also straying away from games with direct conflict between players.
Pick up and deliver seemed like a really good place to start. Since the vast majority of these types of games tend to be quite long, and have a lot of gotcha kinds of rules.
That gave me this set of constraints that I utilized for making Mint Delivery:
Has to fit in a mint tin 
Has to be taught as easy or easier than Mint Works 
Has to play quickly 
With those constraints in mind, I started the task. 
Since it was to fit in a mint tin, I decided to continue the same visual style that we used with Mint Works, and also to continue the overarching narrative of Mort from the first game. It seemed logical to me that Mort has had a lot of success with his mint making company and has started to branch out and provide mints to more than just the local neighborhoods.
That gave a great foundation for the supply/demand chain that would be the foundation of the pick up and deliver mechanism. I didn't want the mint requests to be too flat, so i added some "improved" type mints to the mix at that point. Which essentially gives us 3 forms of currency instead of just one.
From that point, it was all about creating orders for mints, a few locations to pick mints up from, and a map to lay it all out. And that's where we are now.
If you are excited enough for Mint Delivery that you just can't wait for the fully produced copies to get here from the factory, I have provided a limited pledge level.
This level will entitle you to a copy of the fully factory produced version of Mint Delivery as all other backers, but it will also include a hand made advance copy delivered shortly after the campaign ends.
The advance copies will be entirely hand made by me in my workshop and numbered. (e.g. 03/50.)
The advance copies will be of similar quality to the prototypes that you see in the review videos. See below for examples.
Photo Credit Eric from whatsericplaying.com
Because Mint Delivery is a small game in terms of physical size and weight, shipping costs are very reasonable. The manufacturing costs are low enough that VAT shouldn't be a concern.
I wish that I could provide free shipping to the majority of places, however the low price point of the game means I have very little wiggle room for costs.
That said, I will be providing free shipping within the US, and applying a discount to shipping elsewhere equal to the cost of shipping within the US. Here is a brief chart explaining the shipping costs:
* The vast majority of countries falls in this region, including: Argentina (AR), Australia (AU), Austria (AT), Bahrain (BH), Belarus (BY), Belgium (BE), Belize (BZ), Bulgaria (BG), Brunei Darussalam (BN), Canada (CA), Cayman Islands (KY), Chile (CL), China (CN), Colombia (CO), Costa Rica (CR), Croatia (HR), Cyprus (CY), Czech Republic (CZ), Denmark (DK), Estonia (EE), Finland (FI), France (FR), Germany (DE), Greece (GR), Hong Kong (HK), Hungary (HU), Iceland (IS), India (IN), Indonesia (ID), Ireland (IE), Israel (IL), Italy (IT), Japan (JP), Korea, Republic of (KR), Latvia (LV), Lithuania (LT), Luxembourg (LU), Malaysia (MY), Malta (MT), Montenegro (ME), Netherlands (NL), New Zealand (NZ), Norway (NO), Peru (PE), Philippines (PH), Poland (PL), Portugal (PT), Qatar (QA), Romania (RO), Saudi Arabia (SA), Serbia (RS), Singapore (SG), Slovakia (SK), Slovenia (SI), South Africa (ZA), Spain (ES), Sweden (SE), Switzerland (CH), Taiwan (TW), Thailand (TH), Turkey (TR), Ukraine (UA), United Arab Emirates (AE), United Kingdom (GB)
** Brazil, Mexico, Russia and any countries not previously listed fall into this category.
We have partnered up with Mr. B Games to assist in the fulfillment process to ensure that everyone gets their rewards quickly, correctly and in great condition.
I would like to support retailers who are interested in getting Mint Delivery before the game makes its way into distribution. If you're a retailer, please send me a message here on Kickstarter, or email md.retail@five24labs.com during the campaign for pricing information.
We will also be funding a re-print of Mint Works with this campaign, you can add extra copies of Mint Works at $10 each during the campaign, or later on during the pledge manager.

Note: Any add-ons that you select will be delivered at the same time as the rest of your rewards from this campaign.
Since the map doesn't change from game to game, we came up with the idea of using a mat for the game to play on during demos, it worked out so well that we have decided to add custom mint delivery mats on as add-ons to any pledge level as well.
Currently we are a small but potent team that consists of two Mad Scientists myself and Mel (you might recognize him as Mort) and our awesome testing group. 
I'd like to use this space to acknowledge and thank them. I have an amazing, excellent and dedicated group of players that tolerate my crazy ideas and endless iterations.
They are up to the task of attempting to break things, and giving real feedback as we develop projects. I can't possibly thank them enough for all the work they do for the wages of snacks and fun and mild torture (in the form of terrible game ideas.)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Coming off of the success of Mint Works, I feel like I have learned a lot about the process from start to finish. I know what (and what not) to do a lot better than I had this time last year.

I feel like that experience will help to keep this campaign running smoothly from start to finish.

That said, this is still a production and things can fall behind or get off track, which could lead to the ever-present delivery delays. While I don't anticipate any problems that would through us off track, it's always possible.

As you can see from my past campaigns, I'm committed to full transparency and involving you with the project, so regardless of how everything turns out along the way, i'll be here to keep things on track and explain the situation.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Centuries before the first universities, the internet and the modern era of scientific discovery there was the Great Library of Alexandria.
Created to store the world's knowledge, its scribes would copy every book found on every ship that entered Alexandria, and would go on to accumulate untold volumes of history, mathematics, geography, politics and more.
Unfortunately, it was not to last. It was destroyed during the many conquests of Alexandria, and all that knowledge was lost forever.
We may never really know how it happened, but the compelling story of its destruction has inspired us to publish this unconventional game. Join us in retelling the story of the burning of the Great Library!
The game as presented here is exactly what we imagined a great eurogame to be. It contains 138 unique illustrations by Vincent Dutrait and Asterman Studio, which aim to evoke a feeling of exploration and adventure.
Alexandria is complete and includes the highest quality card & cardboard material, as with all our games - 2mm thick cardboard, linen finish, 320gr-weight cardstock, the works.
However, we also have a "dream" version of the game, with custom-shaped wooden tokens that enhance the playing experience. For that we will order a limited amount of custom-shaped wooden token sets:
These tokens are meant to replace the cardboard tiles and give a more tactile playing experience. Just like our previous "big" game, CRISIS, availability of this edition may be limited.
  Designed by Babis Giannios (KUNE v LAKIA, Shadows over the Empire), Alexandria is a eurogame that takes 45-60 minutes to play, albeit a more unconventional one. With asymmetrical gameplay and a shrinking gameplay area, parts of the library are slowly consumed by fire as Heroes seek the treasures within it.
Each of the four Heroes in the game has a different reason for being in the library at the time, and each one has different skills and motivations.
As they move through the randomly-generated layout of the library, the Heroes interact with what they find in the rooms, as well as with each other.
They position themselves to take advantage of the situation as it unfolds, and must manage their time wisely.
In so doing they may rescue books, items or persons and be rewarded with fame. Throughout the game they are confronted by their shared destiny, and this will lead to the dramatic end that defines the ultimate fate of the library.
For more details on the components and rules of Alexandria, download the rule book here (5 MB, right click and Save as…).
Please download this file, as PDFs viewed in-browser may not display properly. This file is the low-resolution version of the rules document.
If you find any mistakes, please use this form to submit them: https://goo.gl/forms/jTFX4bDRvO7cuejD2
As usual, we offer you the chance to try the game before you back the campaign. The game has been implemented on Tabletopia, and you can play for free here:
  Keep in mind that prototype components and some placeholder art is shown below. For example, the Hero boards will be cut to a custom shape around the illustration. Please refer to the contents graphic for up to date images.
          We expect to fulfill all rewards from within the EU, and as a result EU backers do not have to worry about customs or VAT.
We are not able to offer multiple-game pledge levels through the campaign because we need to have a clear picture of how many copies to make - which will be just a few more than we need for the campaign. Since we already subsidize the shipping costs, a bulk pledge would not even save any money.
However, we do expect to have a post-campaign pledge manager via Backerkit, which allows us to manage stock levels.
Shipments to backers outside of the EU will have 35 EUR declared as the value of the package. That's roughly equivalent to 41 USD / 52 CAD / 52 AUD / 40 CHF / 4548 JPY / 46740 KRW. Note that we can not be responsible for any customs fees.
Tracking is not offered through this campaign. If tracking is important to you, please contact us via the KS messaging system before the campaign is over. Please note that we can not take any responsibility for any lost or damaged copies to Brazil, Hungary, Russia, or South Africa.
Even though we will be exhibiting at Spiel, and we hope to have Alexandria there, we are not able to offer pickup in Essen. There are many reasons for that, including the risk that it will not be produced in time, the limited space and time needed to hold and hand out copies to backers whose identity we need to confirm, backers not picking up their game, and more. If you would like to get your game there, it is better to not back the campaign (or back for $1 to follow it), and buy it on site. However, we can not guarantee we will have enough copies for everyone. We expect that the price will be 40-50+ EUR, depending on the edition, and on whether we have any Deluxe copies for sale.
  What You See Is What You Get - this is our doctrine, and we like to run simple, straightforward campaigns. We are aware that add-ons and/or stretch goals would increase the funding total. However, we have already thrown everything into this game - a lot of time, effort, and money.
We also want to offer the game at the cheapest cost possible - and that is incompatible with stretch goals. We'd have to add "hidden" profit in the pledge levels that we can then "spend" to give you stretch goals - nothing is for "free". Therefore, raising money beyond our goal does not give us extra money on hand to create stretch goals.
Furthermore, because the games are made in Europe in a small print run, we do not benefit from economies of scale by producing a few more copies of the game.
We do not offer add-ons (not even our other games) during the campaign, because we want to keep our operations simple and deliver efficiently. We may however be able to offer a post-campaign chance to obtain other games, if stock levels and our operations allow. We are in this for the long run, so it does not help us to squeeze a few more dollars from a few backers, if we would disappoint *all* backers. We have a reputation for shipping on time or early, and this is how we minimize the risk of missing our deadlines.
Finally, we do not pay anyone to give an opinion on our games.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our previously launched campaigns in 2017 are still in progress and on schedule. Long Live The Queen and IUNU are in production. Diesel Demolition Derby is now in the campaign phase, but print prep has already started, and is expected to be on schedule. This project is independent of any other. We are working with a manufacturer we have worked with before, and we are confident in our ability to deliver the game and any additional materials. That said, unforeseen events may affect how quickly fulfillment is conducted, and the graphics and components seen here are subject to change (however improbable). We will be exhibiting at Essen, and it is possible that some backers or other people may have the game in hand before you do, although we plan to ship your games first. Note that our goal is to ship the game on time, by the dates listed on the pledge levels. Shipping a package is different than delivering a package. We do not deliver your game; the shipping company does. Therefore, delivery times will vary according to your local postal service. Once we ship, the shipment is the responsibility of the shipping company. If tracking is important to you, please let us know before pledging. If your reward does not arrive, it is returned to us, so we need you to patiently wait until that happens. Many times we have re-sent a reward only for the backer to receive both the original and the replacement. Informal currency conversions made on this campaign may not be accurate by the time you read this and may therefore result in seemingly cheaper prices in the future. Please do not play with fire, especially near any invaluable ancient papyri (or was it papyruses?) you may be responsible for. Always check the structural integrity of a room before you enter it. Read books. Eat Nutella. Play more games. By backing this project, you indicate that you have read, understood, and agreed with the above. If you have any questions, please contact us directly via the KS messaging system.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Airways Airlines needs your help. New passengers are flooding in. It's up to you to get them to their destinations before they get too angry and complain. If we get too many complaints, we'll be shut down.
Now Boarding is a cooperative boardgame for 2-5 Players which plays in 30-60 minutes.  Each player has their own airplane they will be using to pickup and deliver passengers. Every round, more passengers show up. Players will need to plan together to make sure everyone gets picked up and taken to their destination on time.
Things get crazy when the timer starts. Players have 30 seconds to take their turns – AT THE SAME TIME. Not only that, but new passengers show up right as the timer starts, throwing a wrench in your plans.
Each player has their own unique route only they can take. You'll need to use these routes frequently to save precious travel time. But doing so requires tricky passenger handoffs and coordination between players.
As players deliver passengers, they earn money that is used to upgrade their planes - allowing you to fly faster and carry more passengers.
A intense, cooperative, pick-up-and-deliver game
Make complex, logistical decisions - in a matter of seconds
Experience the mayhem of running your own airline
Mounting tension as more and more passengers arrive
All new art from acclaimed illustrator, Ryan Goldsberry
2-5 player, ages 10+, 30-60 minutes
        Read the rules here  
Grab the Print and Play files here
   Click the images to read reviews
                                "Now Boarding is the kind of cooperative game that hits that great balance where every player contributes and everyone has to carry their own weight. It’s really unique, unlike any other game, cooperative, or real-time, or anything I’ve played before, and I do recommend you check it out." - Meeple Overboard
"Interesting decisions, lively table talk, and a really good time ... there was mounting tension, there was laughter, there was success - the hallmarks of any great co-op ... I will be backing this on Kickstarter the minute it goes live." - @gamegeekninja
 "It's hectic and crazy, and just about makes you feel some sympathy for the airlines when they leave you stranded without a seat. Almost. An intense blend of logistics and real-time action." - Jonathan H. Liu, GeekDad Full review here
"Now Boarding walks a tightrope between smart strategy and manic energy. You'll work together to form your plan, only to watch as it all goes awry and your group scrambles to make it all work. Table talk is everything, making Now Boarding a great social experience, and the game's a good time too!" - Gameosity
"Now Boarding takes real time cooperative games to a new level. The puzzle every player is attempting to solve together keeps you engaged and thinking the whole game. There is a ton of strategic bang without overly complex rules or a long play time. This is a must have for any gamer that likes cooperative play or real time." - Sam Aho, Sam Says
"Now Boarding is a solid game with a good hook that gets players involved quickly. The game play is very straightforward, but never the path to victory. Players must work together and talk things out constantly or the game will crumble. Unlike other cooperative games, players cannot be taking their moves in a vacuum and must depend on others to do things in certain sequences if they are to be successful."
Father Geek
          Announcing a new add-on!
We have partnered with the developers at Dino Polo Club to bring you Mini Metro!  Mini Metro is a minimalist subway simulation game about designing efficient subway networks. The player must constantly redesign their line layout to meet the needs of a rapidly-growing city. It really feels like a lot like Now Boarding, with the crunchy routing puzzles to solve, and passengers losing patience :-)  Only $5 for a copy via Steam for PC.(normally $9.99) Grab the new pledge tier, or grab it later in the pledge manager.
  Wok Star was my first boardgame and I'm bringing it back for the fans. This will be a new 3rd edition of the game. Like Now Boarding, Wok Star is a realtime cooperative game for 1-4 players. Players are members of the Wang family, trying to keep their Chinese restaurant in business. Each player has a unique responsibility - ingredients to prepare, and recipes to serve.  And you only have 20 seconds to serve each customer.
I'm mixing the best elements from the first two editions, and adding some new, modern mechanics. I want to keep it's identity as a game, but tweak a few things to keep it dynamic. There will be more paths to victory via new investments, each with their own risks and rewards. There are more ways to use your dice and deal with bad rolls. And of course it’ll keep the great art and fun sense of humor.  
Coordinate "Grocery Runs" that allow all players to reroll use their dice again.  
Go fancy and add new ingredients to your dishes allowing you to make more money.
Earn "Hustle" which allows you to manipulate dice in a pinch. 
It will come in the same size box as Now Boarding, 6”x9”x1.5” It'll have sandtimers and a timer app. Check out the new tiers that include copies of Wok Star.
  Tim here  - Now Boarding started 10 years ago as a videogame (nowboarding.us).  My friend Tom Mason and I wanted to be indie game developers. We came up with a quirky time management game that captured the craziness of running an airline.  It's been a crazy journey since then  - working at game studios and recently going full time making boardgames.  So now it's back, converted into a boardgame that still has the interesting routing problems, angry passengers, time pressure - but now you have your friends to help!
Help guide the development of this game. We listen to our backers and strive to implement their clever ideas. 
Once funded, our stretch goals will add more content and better components to improve the game for everyone.
Backers receive the game at a discount compared to after the campaign. This game is not going to distributors.
It may not be in your local store.
Without your help, we won't be able to print this game and share it with the world.
European copies will be sent from inside the EU to avoid VAT.

campaign.story:
Every spring, the cherry trees blossom all over Japan. The Japanese celebrate this occasion, as according to their traditions, the goddess of Fuji mountain, Konohana Sakuya Hima revives the fallen flowers at this time. The cherry flower is a symbol of vitality, it is called Sakura.
The players in this game aim to play cards without taking any tricks. They have to play two cards each time, one on each side of the Jin-Jang card following the rules. The players are aided in their success by several characters, who require payment (coins). The best tactician will earn the least points by managing their coins the best and will win the favor of the goddess and glory will be theirs till next spring.
For 2-6 players aged 10 and above.
 Easy to learn
The game is easy to learn and to teach. The active player has to play a card from hand onto each face-up card on the table.
The placed card must be the same colour as the card on the top of the pile, and it must be either greater or lesser in value then the top card, depending on the direction of the Yin- Yang card. Cards with the values of 1 and 13 count as adjacent. On the increasing side, a 1 may follow a 13, on the decreasing side a 13 may follow a 1.
OR  
The placed card is the same value as the top card on the deck but is of a different colour.
Example:
Tactical depth 
If you cannot play a card using the main rules, you may hire one or more characters. To win the game you have to manage your coins well and combine the available character skills. 
Example: The player in his last turn cannot play any card by default. He has 5 coins, so he can use the first Samurai for 2 coins. It reverses the Yin-yang card and now he can play a black number 3 onto the right side. Now he pays his remaining 3 coins on Konohana, which allows him to play a card in any color. That way he can play his number seven card on the left side.
You have to take the pile(s) where you cannot play new card(s) in your turn. You will get coins from the cards immediatelly, but unfortunately they contain penalty points too, and only the player with the fewest points can be the winner of Sakura.
             Note: Some components will not be included in the retail version and will be buyable only separately.
  The game components are language independent, the rulebook will be included in 4 languages: English, French, German and Hungarian. 
The latest rules are available on our homepage: http://a-games.hu/en/download/ 
Direct link: English rules, Hungarian rules, German rules, French rules
Additional: Spanish rules, Italian rules
Note: The rulebooks are subject to change in the final product. The German and French rules are under translation.
How to add games to your pledge? If you have a pledge already, press the "Manage Your Pledge" Button, otherwise you will have to choose one of the pledge levels first. Increase your pledge in the 'Pledge Amount' box by the total price of the add-ons you want to add. No additional shipping cost required. Overall up to 10 games allowed per pledge. After the campaign in the survey you will be able to confirm the details of your pledge.
   Shipping is a great challenge as always. The product should arrive on time, in mint condition and without exorbitant shipping costs. We decided to use Happyshops for their fulfillment services. The shipping cost will be added automatically to your pledge amount based on your location. Our campaign is EU and US friendly, it is guaranteed that you will not be charged with any additional fees on your pledge amount. We are shipping from within these regions. For other regions in some cases you may expect additional customs charges depending on your local regulations, but we and our experienced fulfillment partners will make sure to keep these fees as low as possible. We set the estimated delivery to October-November 2017 depending on your location.  
FREE Essen pickup (26th - 29th of October, 2017): As in previous years, we will have a booth (Hall 7, G101) again this year during the Essen Spiel. We invite you to come to our booth and pick up your games personally. For the Essen pickups the ordered game quantity is unlimited. Please use the separate Essen pickup pledge levels, if you would like to get your copy in Essen.
The summarized shipping prices: 
Due to an error please use the Essen pickup level, if you are from SWITZERLAND, and add 4EUR to your pledge manually. 
Maximum 10 games allowed per order. In order to offer the best possible deal, there is also a chance to add more games to you pledge. Buy more and lower your cost per game! For your pledge you get your second and further copies or add-ons with no additional shipping cost.
Retailers
Retailers will get the games the same time as any other backers , before the official release. If you're a retailer, please contact us at info@a-games.hu during the campaign for a private conversation.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are familiar with that producing a game is a great challenge with many tasks. This will be our 5th released game overall and we already had crowdfunding project on Kickstarter also. Ave Roma, our 1th Kickstarter project met the target in a bit over a day and closed on almost 400% funding. All extra copies of Ave Roma sold out in one day at Essen 2016 and we already had second printing due to the huge demand. A few lessons were learned from that campaign, we are sure we have an even better process for the packaging and delivery of our games worldwide.

During the campaign all the graphics, rules and minor fixes will be finalized and applied to Sakura. Our new main manufacturing partner is located in Poland and they have plenty of experience with several large publishers already. We are certain that we will have high quality components produced as the second print of Ave Roma was already made by them. Almost instantly after the campaign ends, the game will be in production. The fullfillment will be done now through Happyshops worldwide. For the freight shipping we will use our usual partner Kuehne + Nagel.

We want to keep you updated with all the relevant information about the progress of the project. We are confident to give you the best possible product and support. :)
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear backers,
Our Impression campaign is getting closer to its ending. Maybe some of you already saw the campaign page or even read the rules or tried it on Tabletopia. But, if you didn’t, there is still some time to check it out. During the past days we added 6 further videos, which are intended to help understand the game better. Also there is a solo playthrough which is a full-length solo game played by Attila. Feel free to check out these, so you can have a better understanding about our game idea. We hope you find them useful and you will join us in our campaign.

Dear backers,
It’s been a while since our last Kickstarter project. Now, we are getting closer to a new campaign. Our newest complex board game project called Impression is coming to Kickstarter on 15th of September. Until that we would like to post more info about it from time to time (on Facebook, BGG, A-games site). Now, in short, what you can expect:

Dear backers,
Our 2 week long campaign for our next release called Wombattle is started now. 
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1205265935/wombattle
This time it is a new category for us, it is a party board game. We believe many of you will like this game too. Wombattle will contain some unique elements as you got used to from us: a fun way of category selection and real awards. A fast phased, easy to learn board game coming this time. Please check out our campaign when it is started and of course we are glad, if you join.

Our new Kickstarter campaign just launched. Check out Attila Szőgyi's new design and back us if you like what you see!  
Prehistory link: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1205265935/prehistory
Kind regards,
A-games team

Dear backers,  
As you know, we had some troubles with the fulfillment lately, so we would like to follow up and share some news. Most of the packages arrived to our backers, but some of you still not received theirs. Unfortunately, we had some issues with Happyshops in the past months, and they don’t use tracking for many packages, which means slower delivery and causing troubles when we need to track an issue or find solution.
Solution: new process

Dear backers,
If you followed the comment section in the past weeks, you saw we had issues with Happyshops about the deliveries. We would like to summarize the status, so it will be easier you to follow up.  
Summary

Dear backers,  
We are sure, you are excited to have your games in your hand. Like us. We can assure you we feel the same. This great journey is coming near to its end where all of you can play our new release, Sakura.  
Shipping status

Dear backers,
We received those retail copies that will be available in Essen and the KS versions will be delivered directly to the fair on Wednesday. The other shipments are being organized and the fulfillment can start in time in November.

campaign.story:
Welcome to the final Heroes Wanted Card Game Kickstarter! If you're not familiar with Heroes Wanted, check out the game and its website! The heroes in Zeta City began fighting three years ago, and now we're back on Kickstarter to go out with a bang!
Earth! Air! Fire! Water! Danger? Zeta City has seen its share of heroes, but none the likes of these. Elemental heroes join the fray, harnessing the very forces of nature against an all new bevy of criminal geniuses, sentient websites, and opinionated baddies!
But wait! There's more! Not only does this expansion for Heroes Wanted add a brand new hero type to your already near-infinite game play options, it also provides even more content for the other hero types in the game. Players will now have bonus cards unique to their hero, as well as never-before-seen epic actions! And the fun doesn't stop there! Elements of Danger also introduces improved basic actions to make your hero even more unique!
Be a hero. Save the day. Make the team!
  Heroes Wanted Elements of Danger is a special release, not only is it the last in the Heroes Wanted line of games, it is not likely to go into distribution.  This kickstarter project and limited number of games at Essen & BGG CON (if we make it in time) will be the only way to get the expansion in 2017.  In 2018, we will be selling this expansion directly via conventions and Amazon only - it will not be entering normal distribution channels.  If there are any copies left, we may be selling those into distribution in 2019 or later - but there is no guarantee that we will do so.
Heroes Wanted: Elements of Danger is a superhero adventure game for 1-5 players that plays in 45 minutes. For more information, we encourage you to view the videos directly below, or simply read our draft rulebook here.
Click HERE to watch Rahdo Runs Through Heroes Wanted: Elements of Danger Gameplay.
Rahdo Runs Through Heroes Wanted
The Dice Tower Reviews - Heroes Wanted
Bearded Meeple reviews Heroes Wanted
     Heroes Wanted: Elements of Danger is the final expansion to the Heroes Wanted line of games, and what an expansion it will be! The ultimate Champion pledge will contain the newest expansion plus:
Heroes Wanted - The base game includes over 200 cards, four scenario boards, and tons of tokens. 
Extra, Extra - Fifty-four more heroes, villains, and quirks. 
Champions & Masterminds - Mini-expansion that allows you to play Heroes Wanted as a full co-op. 
The Stuff of Legend - The first big box expansion that includes 110 cards, two new hero types, new villains, new quirks, and two new scenario boards. 
Breaking News - Fifty-four more heroes, villains, and quirks. 
Champions & Masterminds 2 - Mini-expansion that adds new Champions to play as and Masterminds to battle.
In total, over 10,000 different hero combinations and over 400 different villain combinations equals near endless replayability!
                 We'll be making frequent updates during this project to let you know about all the great stretch goals we have planned for you!
Heroes Wanted: Elements of Danger is the 39th project from the combined teams behind Indie Boards and Cards & Action Phase Games. With the successful execution of our first 38 projects, we have become experienced publishers with a reputation for great games (in design and production) that are delivered in a timely fashion. 
Heroes Wanted: Elements of Danger was designed by Nick Little and Travis R. Chance. This game has undergone extensive testing and development to ensure the best possible experience. We are confident that this game will be in your collection for years to come. 
Heroes Wanted: Elements of Danger is not going into distribution. This may be your only opportunity to buy it.
All of the art assets are complete and ready for immediate upload after the project funds. 
Prices include US shipping. This project is also EU and Canadian friendly.
Kickstarter is the world's largest funding platform for creative projects. Every month, tens of thousands of people pledge millions of dollars to creative projects in dozens of categories. 
A person who supports a project is called a "backer." The process of giving money to this project is called a "pledge." 
In return for your pledge, we (the creators of the campaign) are able to offer "rewards," depending on the amount you pledge. For example, if you pledge $25 to help back the project, we'll offer you a copy of the game along with any stretch goals we achieve as soon as it is manufactured. 
You can become a backer in just three easy steps: 
Step 1: Read through the pledge levels and rewards we're offering in the right sidebar of this page. 
Step 2: Click the large, green "BACK THIS PROJECT" button to the right of the trailer video at the top of this page. 
Step 3: Enter your pledge amount, and complete the steps for filling in your information. This process takes just a few seconds! That's it! It's really that simple! Thank you for backing! 
Once you've backed this project, we encourage you to share this page on social media platforms, such as Facebook and Twitter, and share with your friends and family. Also, be sure to like Indie Boards and Cards on Facebook and follow us on Twitter for real-time updates about this project and more! 
CITIZEN: (Pledge $1 or more) Your continued support will help the superheroes of Zeta City!
HERO: (Pledge $25 or more) One copy of Heroes Wanted: Elements of Danger with all stretch goals. Shipping included in the US. Other shipping pledge rates based on location. For additional copies in the US and international, check our rates below. 
SIDEKICK: (Pledge $70 or more) One of all Heroes Wanted expansions - Extra Extra, Heroes Wanted: The Stuff of Legend, Breaking News, and Champions & Masterminds 1 & 2, as well as One copy of Elements of Danger with all of the stretch goals. Shipping included in the US. Other shipping pledge rates based on location. For additional copies in the US and international, check our rates below.
CHAMPION: (Pledge $100 or more) One of all Heroes Wanted games - Heroes Wanted, Extra Extra, Heroes Wanted: The Stuff of Legend, Breaking News, and Champions & Masterminds 1 & 2. As well as One copy of Elements of Danger with all of the stretch goals. Shipping included in the US. Other shipping pledge rates based on location. For additional copies in the US and international, check our rates below. 
We are not expecting to release Heroes Wanted: Elements of Danger expansion into retail. Kickstarter and conventions will be the only way to get the expansion in 2017. Any remaining copies from the small print run will sold directly by us via conventions and Amazon sales in 2018.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is the 39th Kickstarter project from the combined teams behind Indie Boards and Cards & Action Phase Games. We have learned how to streamline the game publishing process and have successfully delivered all of our previous Kickstarter projects to thousands of supporters. Our previous experiences will enable us to also deliver this project on time and we have every confidence that Heroes Wanted: Elements of Danger will be on schedule and of the highest possible quality.

That said, there are always complexities and considerations in a project of this scope that may cause delays. Indie Boards and Cards & Action Phase Games will use contract manufacturing to make this game, freight forwarders to get games through customs, and 3rd parties like Amazon, the US Post Office, and FEDEX to ship the games to you – we don't control everything and there are lots of opportunities for delay. We have a track record of making everything work out for backers in the end – so please be confident and supportive of our efforts to get this great game into your hands.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus 20% for Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment (usually 4 to 6 weeks before the actual shipping date), no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds after the 14 days close of the campaign may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card.

This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in and submit your project survey results (ie, provide us with your shipping address) for your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge (at additional cost for international backers) if you complete your project survey after the 8-week window has elapsed.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the general release.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
