campaign.story:
Clans of Caledonia is a highly replayable economic strategy game for 1 to 4 players set in 19th century Scotland. It was an era when Scotland made the challenging transition from an agricultural country to an industrialized one, heavily relying on trade and export. 
As proud members of the old clans you use your unique abilities and cunning skill to earn the greatest wealth and fame.
The game is designed by Juma Al-JouJou, a solo-entrepreneur and founder of Karma Games. Juma has also designed and self-published Green Deal which Tom Vasel rated as the 5th best economic game of all time. Clans of Caledonia is illustrated by Klemens Franz, the illustrator of award-winning games such as Agricola, Caverna and Isle of Skye.   
There are more than 220 custom wooden tokens! Click for larger view.
   Clans of Caledonia has a unique blend of mechanisms and includes elements of engine-building games (e.g. Terra Mystica) and economic mechanisms such as a dynamic market (e.g. Navegador) and export contracts (e.g. Voyages of Marco Polo). 
The way you produce whisky, bread and cheese from grain and milk is interwoven with the trade and export of goods. This makes it a highly interactive strategy game, with great strategic depth despite having a very accessible rule set.  
The modular board, the 8 different clans with unique powers and the multiple scoring and port tiles ensure outstanding replayability.
A game example at the 2-player count. Click for larger view.
     The modular board offering 16 different map setups. Click for larger view.
   The game features eight clans: Stewart, Robertson, MacDonald, MacKenzie, Campbell, Cunningham, Fergusson and Buchanan.

The Player Board. Click for larger view.
                                                                                                The Export Board. Click for larger view.
    The Market Board: Players change the market prices by buying and selling. Click for larger view.
    3D render image of coins. Click for larger view.
      In addition to all the components from the Clans of Caledonia pledge level including all Stretch Goals, the Premium Clans of Caledonia pledge level includes 70 metal coins and a KS exclusive box sleeve.
Metal Coins
Money is so important in this game! Upgrading the coins to 70 metal coins is the best upgrade possible. It feels great to hold heavy coins in your hands and their jingling sound is music in the ears of their wealthy and proud owner! In addition, there is basically no wear and tear! Perfect for a game with such a high replayability. 
The supplier is producing sample coins right now. The producer of the metal coins is the same supplier as the one for Scythe from Stonemaier Games, so expect some awesome metal coins! 
  Render image: Lily, The Lion Rampant of Scotland & Mary Stuart. Klemens designed the coins specifically for Clans of Caledonia. The coins have a diameter of 20, 22 and 24 mm respectively and will be 2 mm thick (just as thick as the coins in Scythe).
       Add-on: You can also add up to four additional sets of metal coins as an add-on to your pledge of the game by adding €19 per set of metal coins. Please check the FAQ for details. 
Excess Premium copies produced by this campaign may be sold in limited number at retail at a higher price. 
Box Sleeve (KS exclusive)
The premium sleeve slides onto the game box for a premium hold. The front proudly presents the eight clan chiefs of Clans of Caledonia.
  The sleeve features all of the clan crests on the sides and a map of Scotland on the back with the current clan seats. Click for larger view.
  Exclusivity: The sleeves and metal coins will not be widely available after the Kickstarter. There will only be enough sleeves printed to cover replacements. Take note that we also reserve the right to print similar box sleeves for special releases. Due to the high cost of producing metal coins, it is expected they will be very limited in retail. 
We also want to give you the chance to shape the final product in a truly unique way! You can make suggestions and vote first for an additional port tile, then for a scoring tile and finally for a clan tile. At certain points during the campaign, voting for these will take place and will end: 
Participate and shape the final product!
   You, Kickstarer backers, will add one extra port, scoring and clan tile that will be included in every single game in this print run! The additional 9th clan will also be eternalized on the box sleeve. These additional tiles will be clearly marked as untested. The community of players can playtest and balance these tiles after release together. 
The earlier you join in, the more you can shape the final game! Join this FB group to submit your ideas and vote!           
Clans of Caledonia includes more than 220 custom wooden tokens, a modular map and a full solo variant including custom silk-screened dice. We recognise that many of these features are often added as stretch goals but we don't want to compromise a top quality final product. Also, we don't want to risk the game balance by adding content that was not playtested (and that is not marked as untested). 
Even though we think that is the case, we are still going to add a few more components with your help!  
All Stretch Goals unlocked!
Facebook Shares 
Retweets 
Boardgamegeek Thumbs 
Download your favorite clan as a social media avatar.
                                      Videos
Review by Man vs. Meeple
Preview by Counter Culture
 First impressions by slickerdrips

Hunter & Cron (German)

Antlab Games, 2-Player
Slickerdrip, Solo
2-Player with Juma, the Game Designer, and Nick-Nack

Written Reviews
Boardgamequest: "If you’re a fan of games such as Terra Mystica, Clans of Caledonia offers something equally fulfilling in an equal or shorter playtime"
Meoples' Magazine: "Clans of Caledonia is great with two, three or four players.The clans are well balanced."

Spielkult (German)

Read the rules here.
And play the game on Tabletopia now!
                                   Within a month of receiving your copy (or if you haven't received your game by Dec 31, 2017) you can return the game and we even pay for return shipping, no strings attached. 
Depending on how early you pledge, you will receive:  
  The guarantee applies to your pledge amount. The pledge amount equals the tiers you chose plus shipping costs.  
Clans of Caledonia was heavily playtested and I continued tweaking and balancing the game even when everyone thought I should stop. Thus, I am confident that, if it's a style of game you usually like, you will love Clans of Caledonia!  
I strongly believe it's a stellar product that is truly outstanding and can bear comparison with the best Euro games on the market today.
Inspired by the so-called Stonemaier Method, we will ship games in bulk to fulfillment centers around the world to reduce customs fees & VAT and to keep shipping prices low. Country codes are here.
Shipping fee automatically added at checkout.
Backers are limited to 2 games per pledge (any combination is fine; you will only pay the shipping fee once per pledge, not once per game). To add an additional game beyond the first, manually enter the € total when making your pledge or click the "Manage your pledge" button at the top of the page. 

Shipping costs are heavily subsidized. If we had subsidized shipping even more to make it free in the US, we would have had to increase the pledge by €10. So we deliberately kept the tier low so you can actually save money by pleding for two copies because you pay shipping only once per pledge.  

We will be shipping from within US, within EU, within Canada and within China to the respective backers. Depending on the success of the campaign, we may also ship from within Australia. 
Customs & Duty Free Shipping in US, EU and CA

The game will contain two rulebooks, one rulebook in English, and one in German. Since the game materials are language independent, we plan to offer digital files of translations of the rules in various languages.
The game comes with printed rulebooks in English and German.
  Translations in French, Italian, Spanish and Dutch will be provided as digital files online.
  Juma is a solo-entrepreneur and game designer. There is no big publisher behind this project. Consequently Kickstarter is the only way for Juma to publish this game as it helps him to assess the level of demand for the game and to finance the costly production. 
  All Kickstarter backers receive a money-back guarantee, but the sooner you back the better your guarantee is. Backers during the first 3 days receive even a 110% money-back guarantee! 
Shape the final product! Based on your suggestions and votes, we will add one additional clan, one additional scoring tile and one additional port tile. The earlier you pledge, the more you can participate. 
 Approximately 30% off MRSP and subsidized shipping: you are not likely to get this game cheaper any time soon. We are known for keeping our prices stable. 
Exclusivity: The sleeves and metal coins will not be widely available after the Kickstarter.
There is no big publisher behind Clans of Caledonia so without your pledges this game won't be produced at all. 
By backing this Kickstarter, you allow me to devote more time to our awesome hobby and bring more great games to you soon!

We like to support game stores around the world by offering either version of the game to retailers during the campaign. Retailer backers, just like other backers, will receive their rewards before the games will go into distribution. If you're a retailer, please contact Juma at juma@karma-games.de (please use "Retailer" in the email object) during the campaign for pricing information. 
About the Creators
I am Juma.  
  I am the father of a small family in Berlin (Germany) and an avid gamer. I studied Philosophy & Economics (bachelor's degree) and Innovation Management & Entrepreneurship / Business Administration (master's degree). No wonder I love economic games. 

Karma Games is just me - there are no emloyees, no marketing manager, I do it all! :)  

When I was 16 I participated in a music school exchange program and was hosted by a lovely Scottish family on the Isle of Bute, west of Glasgow. I believe that the design process of this game can be traced back to that great experience!  

Klemens Franz is the illustrator of Clans of Caledonia. Klemens has illustrated many award-winning strategy games such as Agricola, Caverna and Isle of Skye. Klemens is based in Austria: http://www.atelier198.com/   
Dan Cunningham, founder of Iron Kitten Games, reached out to me, a few months ago and asked if he could help. He was incredibly helpful with various tasks, from creating 3D renders and animations, to production, Tabletopia implementation and Kickstarter related issues (a truly multitalented individual!).
Michael Csorba, recently asked if he could help and supports me with communication and running the Kickstarter. He is the only one who also resides in Berlin, it's great to see a team member face to face once in a while! 
Adriano Rahde, from Ao Amor in Brazil, has created the amazing Kickstarter video trailer! Thank you! 
Playtesters: More than 50 regular playtesters helped to create this awesome game. I'm grateful that you were all willing to play the prototype again and again -  even in the early stages of development when it was still rough around the edges. Your contribution and feedback was invaluable! 
A lot more people actively reached out to me and offered help, some Boardgamegeek users who helped so much with editing the rules (especially Francois Landry Corbin, Mike Poole, Steven Barba and many more). The truth is: without the many people who volunteered to help, this game would not be as great as it is. It was a real community effort. I was, and still am, amazed how awesome so many board game enthusiasts are. Thank you all! 
Other Products
Juma designed two other games that you can order from the Karma Games website.

  Fette Ernte is a card game for 3 to 5 kids to learn about growing vegetables (only available in German).
Please feel free to visit our website and sign up for our newsletter here: http://www.karma-games.com/
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I do have some experience with managing and fulfilling a crowd funding project. My last campaign was delivered one month ahead of schedule and only four months after the campaign finished. That game was also called 5th best economic game of all time by Tom Vasel. 

Despite my experience, there are still some risks involved that everyone backing the project must be aware of.

There could be delays: freight and worldwide fulfillment is complex and involves numerous companies. I read everything about the topic on Stonemaier Games' blog (an invaluable resource, thank you Jamey!) and consulted other creators for tips and tricks on how to manage fulfillment the best way possible.

In addition, I decided to work with the best fulfillment partners even if it comes at a higher cost. 

Due to proximity to the fulfillment centers or the factory some backers will receive their games significantly earlier than others. The majority of backers should receive their games around October 2017, ideally a few weeks before the game fair in Essen, though. If delays arise it may happen that the game is available at the game fair in Essen before some backers received their copies. 

I will do my best to solve any problems that may arise and keep you regularly updated.

Clans of Caledonia features variable player powers. It's tough to balance an asymmetric game. In the beginning the game was playtested with 50+ different play testers. They provided diverse qualitative feedback that led to the final gameplay mechanisms. 

Once the game mechanisms were nearly final, I focused on balancing the clans. Therefore, I playtested again and again with the best players of Clans of Caledonia only because the stats were far more reliable than with new players whose skills varies a lot. I gathered the stats, fine tuned the clans and made some quantitative analyses in Excel that indicated that the clans are very well balanced. My playtesters agreed. 

Nonetheless I am aware that other games with variable player powers ended up being perceived by players as much less balanced than the creators predicted. In order to mitigate this risk, I included a Clan auction variant that ensures nearly 100% fairness. Furthermore, one can also play this game without variable player powers.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
UPDATE:  Wow - FULLY FUNDED IN UNDER 4 HOURS WITH A STRETCH GOAL ALREADY UNLOCKED! You are all amazing! We'll be posting updates as the day progresses and catching up to all of your questions and comments soon. For now, THANK YOU SO MUCH!
UPDATE: Multilingual support added!
UPDATE: International partner Spieleschmiede campaign funds added to US total for stretch goal unlocks.
5-16-17 / 11pm 
TOTAL: $63,450 (US) + $4,853 (DE) = $68,303 worldwide
 Tesla vs. Edison: Duel is a fun, easy-to-learn, 2-player card game that takes less than 30 minutes to play. Duel distills the epic War of Currents to its essence while still preserving all major areas of play from the original smash hit. 
Choose Your Side. It's AC vs DC - and only one can win! 
Play as Famous Inventors. Select Nikola Tesla, Thomas Edison, or one of six other amazing inventors to run your electric company and compete for control over the nascent electricity industry of the United States. Each inventor plays differently leading to unique experiences every game. 
Recruit Heroes of Engineering, Business, and Popular Culture. Some of the most well-known historical figures from the actual War of Currents join your company and play key roles in your quest for glory. J.P. Morgan, H.G. Wells, Mark Twain, and others bring deeper thematic immersion and a wide range of special abilities. 
Build an Empire. Vie for victory by controlling two of the three available regions: New England, New York, and Out West. 
Claim Electricity Projects. From Boston to Chicago, players extend their influence over each region by completing projects in the important cities of the time. 
Discover New Technologies. Develop the "latest and greatest" technologies, seize pre-eminence from your opponent, and forge new relationships with other companies that assist your bid for victory. 
Play the Stock Market. Joust with your opponent for control of other enterprises. Six minor companies, each with their own preferred technology, are also in the electricity business and located across the three regions. Acquire their stock if you lead in a company’s preferred technology and increase your own regional influence. 
Conduct Nefarious Propaganda. Promote AC or DC to lead public perception for added bonuses. Lobby against your opponent’s technology to hamper their regional control. Propaganda is central to any winning strategy! 
All in Less Time Than Lunch! While Tesla vs. Edison: Duel is a recognizable adaptation of our best-selling core game Tesla vs. Edison, the experience is very different and entirely unique. With lightweight rules, minimal table space, and play time under 30 minutes, Duel is a great game-over-lunch experience for casuals with enough strategic depth for hobby gamers too! 
Come play the War of Currents heads-up and enjoy our latest addition to the world of Tesla vs. Edison!
                   Tesla vs. Edison: Duel pits two players head-to-head in a fast and fun area control game that packs a ton of electrifying goodness into a small package. Complete rules are available, and we’ve also highlighted some key aspects of play here.
It all start with your Inventor.  Pick Tesla, Edison, or one of six other geniuses and prepare for the Duel. Each Inventor also has a different "instant win" condition so be sure to keep a close eye on your opponent!
Your Assistants can claim projects, acquire stocks, influence playable power types in regions, conduct propaganda on the PR track, and advance technologies to help you expand your empire. Duel takes place over three phases. At the start of each phase, draft Assistants to work for your company. Alternate with your opponent and activate one Assistant each per turn by taking the two actions shown on each Assistant’s card until the phase is finished.  Play is smooth and speedy with almost no downtime.
Players battle for control of three regions. Regions award different bonuses and are scored at the end of each phase based on player influence. 
Claim a Project from the market and put it on your side of the board, contributing points to your control of that region. 
While you advocate for your preferred power, AC or DC, you also can develop technology of the time to lead in Transformers, Light Bulbs, or Electric Meters. Taking the card for one of these technologies endears you to smaller power companies that can help your bid for victory.
The stock market still plays a key role in Duel. Your company gives you influence in its home region. If you lead in a minor company’s preferred technology, you can also acquire their shares to increase your influence in the region where they do business. The more shares you hold, the more influence you wield. You can also sell stock shares for free actions!
Don’t forget the battle for public perception and PR. Place No AC or No DC tokens on a region to entirely block your opponent’s technology there - at least until they counter!  You can also increase the popularity of your chosen power technology on the PR track. Along with giving you more control over the No AC and No DC tokens, advancing here yields bonus actions and also serves as a tiebreaker for region control, sometimes literally winning you the game!
After three rounds of play, whichever player controls two or more of the game's three regions wins. But don't forget each Inventor's unique instant win condition - if they achieve this goal during the game then they win immediately!
         Tesla vs Edison: Duel will be manufactured in China. Copies will then be sent to our fulfillment partner depots in various regions around the world for ultimate distribution to backers. This saves you on shipping and extra taxes.
We're offering deeply discounted shipping to our backers everywhere. We recognize that even with these discounts, shipping to many parts of the world is just plain expensive, but we're doing what we can to make it easier.
Given our strategy of shipping to regional fulfillment depots, various countries will receive their copies at different times. Historically, backers in Asia and the Pacific receive their copies soonest since they are nearest to our manufacturer, then the U.S. and western Europe are relatively close together, and finally backers in the rest of the world receive theirs. We anticipate that all backers will receive their copies by October 2017, but most of you will receive your copies sooner. We'll keep you posted with more details via regular updates as we move forward into production and fulfillment.
Finally, we also hope to offer Gen Con pickup for backers as we have in the past for other Kickstarter campaigns. The summer con season is very important for us. There's a chance we land the ocean container here in time for the show, but if not, we're planning on air shipping a limited quantity to Indianapolis for backer pickup and sales. We realize that this may occur before some backers, particularly those in more remote locales, have received their games and we're offering Gen Con pickup to give people more fulfillment options as a result. We'll provide more details about this via updates closer to Gen Con. We hope you understand and still choose to support our project!
    Artana is committed to supporting our retail partners. We offer wholesale pricing to verified stores and other gaming establishments. We treat you like other backers, but you will receive your rewards ahead of other normal distributions channels. If you are a verifiable retailer, please contact us through Kickstarter or send an email to hello@artana.com for more information about how to pledge at this level.
(Designer) Dirk Knemeyer is the creative director of Artana. This is his tenth published game, including award-winners Tesla vs. Edison, Tomorrow, and The New Science. Dirk is also a host of The Game Design Round Table podcast, a show that talks to both digital and tabletop game designers about the theory and practice of game design. Outside of gaming, Dirk is a social futurist, studying culture and technology in order to propose better systems of existence. He lives in the Boston, Massachusetts area with his wife and two of his children.
(Lead Developer) J.R. Honeycutt is a full-time developer at Artana. In addition to Tesla vs. Edison: Duel and other projects at the studio, he was the lead developer for SeaFall. JR is the co-designer of Unpub: The Published Card Game, Fantasy Fantasy Baseball, and other games. JR plays games and helps people through DFW Nerd Night, a community organization that has helped raise more than $75,000 for charities. He lives in Fort Worth, TX with his wife, Amy, and their two cats.
(Art Director) Heiko Günther grew up on a mostly forgotten mesa in the depths of South America. He was raised by direct descendants of the Incan Empire and trained in the ancient art of Shinobi warfare. At the age of 8, he was given into the care of a globetrotting science fiction writer and acquired degrees in literature, science, and arts. From the age of 14 until 17, he worked on fishing trawler in the far eastern seas, perfecting his knowledge of forgotten languages and Polynesian mysticism. Since then, he lives in Saarbrücken, Germany, mostly, does graphic design and likes board games.
  Founded in 2015, Artana produces quality games and accessories to customers around the world. This is our fifth Kickstarter, also including Einstein,  Tesla vs. Edison and the Powering Up! Expansion, Corrupted Kingdoms, and The Best Damn Gaming Coins Ever. The Artana team includes game industry veterans in all aspects of game design, development, art, and business. We seek to provide fresh themes, innovative mechanics, engaging play, beautiful components, and thought-provoking experiences.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with all Kickstarter projects, there are risks outside our control that could slow down delivery of the project - shipping or customs delays, acts of God, unexpected power outages, etc. However, our team at Artana has finalized almost all of the art, components, and design of Tesla vs. Edison: Duel. We've tested it, retested it, given it love, and are ready to send the game to print as soon as the campaign is over. Artana has successfully delivered three Kickstarter campaigns with a fourth on the way. We know how to quickly and accurately fulfill pledges for our backers. We believe that the process of delivering Tesla vs. Edison: Duel! will be smooth and seamless, and should result in your having a light, fun, and strategic 1-2 player version of a much-loved game and expansion in your hands within our shipping timeframe.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Lovelace & Babbage NOW LIVE - New Artana Kickstarter
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!
You’re getting this update since you previously backed Tesla vs. Edison: Duel and we have a fabulous new history and science game we think you'll love that just launched on Kickstarter – Lovelace & Babbage by Scott Almes of Tiny Epic fame! The campaign funded in under an hour and has over 1,300 backers with a bunch of stretch goals already unlocked so come check it out and join the fun!

updates.update_userinfo: Fulfillment Completing + Our Newest Game Now On Kickstarter - Speakeasy Blues!
updates.update_content: Hi everyone!  Fulfillment for Duel is largely complete and is winding down.  If you're in the US, Canada, or the EU and haven't received your game by Monday, please PM us so we can address your issue.  APAC is largely complete though the Chinese holiday slowed things down a bit so please give those games about one more week and then message us if you haven't received yours.  For everyone else, the games are making their way to you and if they haven't arrived already they should be there in the next couple of weeks.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping Update Plus A New Review
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone - nothing but great news here from Artana today!  So, without further ado...
Games Are Shipping To Depots!

updates.update_userinfo: Production Update and Gen Con Pickups
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone!  Hope you are enjoying a fantastic summer.  We have all good news to report in this latest update!
Gen Con Pick Up
As expected, it's on!  For those of you who indicated in the pledge manager that you wanted Gen Con pick up of Duel, we're delighted to report that you'll be able to get your rewards at the show next week.  You should have already received an email to confirm your pick up.  If you haven't seen it yet, please check your spam folder or PM us for assistance and we'll be happy to help.  See you at booth 1159 next week!

In the midst of getting the survey out to everyone just now, we didn't enable one of the most important questions - whether you want Gen Con pickup or not!  We've now added the question.  For those of you that completed your surveys before this update, please go back and check that box yes or no so we can get a sense for how many we may need to ship.  Most people haven't yet so it should not be an issue.  If you have any problems with things, just PM us and we'll address things for you.

updates.update_userinfo: Official Campaign Survey Now Available + Gen Con Pickup
updates.update_content:
Hi all! 
 We hope that everyone (at least in the Northern Hemisphere) is enjoying the summer months. We've got some great news in this update so please read carefully!
First, mass production of Tesla vs. Edison: Duel is well under way and ahead of schedule. Based on this and as with many of our prior campaigns, Disclaimer: if there's some crazy unexpected mishap late in production that could change things, but we think the likelihood of this is low. We'll officially confirm in a later update, but tentatively and barring the unexpected, it's on for Gen Con!

updates.update_userinfo: Production Begins, Some Art, and Other News
updates.update_content:
Greetings, dear backers! We have a bunch of Tesla goodness for you in this latest update.
Production Is Starting
First, we're thrilled to report that Duel is officially entering production! We've been busy the past few weeks obtaining translations for the multilingual components, tweaking art, finalizing balance, and generally reviewing everything one last time. We're finally satisfied and it's time to get this show on the road. All files have been uploaded and approved by Panda!

A short but meaningful update today...
They did it!!!

updates.update_userinfo: A Huge Thanks and Where We Go From Here
updates.update_content: First, thank you all for bringing Tesla vs. Edison: Duel to life!  We're coming down from Duel's frenetic finish and sending out this much deserved update to all of you to acknowledge your role in making this project possible.  We've run a lot of Kickstarter campaigns over the years, but every time we feel the same deep emotion at the end - gratitude. We wouldn't be here without you, our fans, and we're incredibly grateful for your faith in us and support which makes us able to create and share our games with everyone.  You all are the best!

updates.update_userinfo: Overworld Games Becomes PULL THE PIN GAMES
updates.update_content: First off barkers, please STEP RIGHT UP and see the amazing, the fearless, the courageous... ZORRO™! He has the fastest reflexes, the greatest leaps, and the pointiest sword in all the land. You can witness his heroics for a limited time only in our next Kickstarter campaign that just launched for The Zorro Dice Game!

updates.update_userinfo: Barker’s Row in Barnes & Noble and a New Salem Re-Launch
updates.update_content:
Hello Barkers!
Today we have two pieces of news for you related to Barker’s Row. As you may know, one of our other games, New Salem, was illustrated by the same artist as Barker's Row, but its most recent campaign for a 2nd Edition only made it to 93% funding. :( But that's just the bad news.... the good news is that we have just re-launched it and it funded right away! If you need more magical illustrations from Andrea Olgiati in your life, take a look at that 3-8 player drafting and set collection game .

updates.update_userinfo: Is That a Witch in Your Carnival?
updates.update_content:
Greeting Barkers! 
Lemme ask you a question... so how did you feel about the artwork in Barker's Row? A little creepy but you can't look away, right? Now can you imagine what it would look like if that artist illustrated a game about witches? Well HE DID and it just launched on Kickstarter a few minutes ago!

updates.update_userinfo: Expansion Ideas and Andrea's Next Show
updates.update_content:
We hope everyone and their little rubes are enjoying some ferocious beasts and mind-boggling freaks! In this update, we'd like your thoughts on a possible expansion for Barker's Row, an opportunity to playtest our next game, and MORE! 
Before we get started, we wanted to put the spotlight on an expertly-crafted written review of Barker's Row from Lindsay Joanne Miller of Shiny Happy Meeples Co that is really fun to read if you have an appreciation for the written word.
Campaign Feedback

updates.update_userinfo: Advanced Play Variant and Move Videos
updates.update_content:
Hi! This is a little sooner than we usually do an update but we have so much to talk about now that the game is getting into your hands. If you don't have your copy yet and you also don't have a tracking number, definitely send us a message on Kickstarter or an email to support@overworldgames.com and we'll jump on the case.
Advanced Play Variant

You heard it right, all games have now shipped! Whew, this took a little longer than expected for non-US backers, especially compared to the US shipping that went lightning fast, but it's good to know this milestone has been completed. If you don't have your game yet and you haven't received tracking info by Monday, send us a Kickstarter message or an email to support@overworldgames.com and we'll track it down.
We recently attended the GAMA Trade Show and got to show off the game to retailers and distributors all over the world. One of the best parts was hearing everyone’s when they demo'ed the game. As you know, when you play an attraction, you can say, “STEP RIGHT UP and see the… (adjective) (adjective) (adjective) (attraction name),” which turns your board game into what feels/sounds like a real carnival. The following is one of our favorites from the GAMA Trade Show -- can you do better than this one?

updates.update_userinfo: Local Shipping Begins! And a How to Play Video!
updates.update_content: The day has finally arrived! Games have started shipping to backers’ doors! In order to give our best effort at simultaneous fulfillment to all regions, we’ve started with shipping the games to destination countries with a history of taking a long time to arrive due to customs or slower postal services. We’ll keep shipping to regions with quicker and more consistent delivery times until we’ve got ‘em all. The delivery window for all regions is:

updates.update_userinfo: Last Chance for Address Changes! Freight Shipping Has Begun!
updates.update_content:
Attention beautiful barkers! 
Your games are now officially on the move by boat and truck to the fulfillment centers we will be using to send them to your door! On average, this "freight shipping" process takes about 5 weeks. Sometimes it’s shorter and sometimes it’s longer, but we’ll keep you updated on how it’s coming along. Once the fulfillment centers receive your games, they will pack them up nicely and then ship them to your door. Keep reading for the deets!

updates.update_userinfo: Production Pictures and a Precarious Tower
updates.update_content:
Gather 'round for another big update from your favorite carnival, Barker's Row! Alright now... are you sitting down? If not, you better find a chair because we're going to hit you with a strong shot of good and bad news. OK, here goes.
We received the first copy of Barker’s Row off the production line and it looks SO AWESOME… except for one part: The strongman tower just does not stand up well enough. As badly as we want to get this game out to you now, we need it to be perfect when you get it, so this must be fixed. Unfortunately, making a change when everything was already done manufacturing will cause about a . But trust us, this was the right decision. So chin up everyone! It will be here before you know it!

Happy Thanksgiving to those who are celebrating it today! Even if you're not, we hope you're spending some quality time with friends, family, and pets -- and either watching or playing some games! Meanwhile, in the world of creepy carnivals, we're getting closer, folks! And that means we can give you more accurate estimate of when you'll have Barker's Row in your hands.
Schedule

campaign.story:
Designed by renowned video game designer and author Scott Rogers, Rayguns & Rocketships is a miniatures board game for 2-4 players. Featuring an inventive dual-scale system, players in Rayguns & Rocketships take command of their bulky-but-powerful Rocketship, as well as their agile crew of Planeteers! Players will need to think strategically and plan ahead as their Rocketship’s movements must be pre-programmed. Luckily, any poor decisions on the Rocketship scale can be quickly adjusted on the crew scale. Provided you have enough action points saved up, you can send your crew to repair the ship, man the Rayguns, or push the engines into overdrive!
You’ll need everything you can muster if you wish to successfully command your crew as you race your opponents to accumulate enough victory points to claim the galaxy for yourself!
Here's our extended look at the rules, strategies, and game play from Episode 03 - The Frozen Fear! out of the Episode book! We hope it gives you a feel for the excitement and strategies found in Rayguns & Rocketships game play. As well as the diversity of content in the episode book.
Scott talks with the New York Film Academy about Rayguns & Rocketships. Please note that he's showing his original prototype in this video.
    The Galactic Astro Rangers are a peacekeeping force dedicated to bringing justice to a lawless, broken galaxy. Their ranks consist of adventurers, star jockeys, idealists, and scoundrels. Astro Rangers are the fastest of the Planeteer factions, whether at the cockpit of their speedy Rocketships, or flying their jetpacks through the inky void of space. All Astro Rangers are armed with deadly neuralizer pistols and circuit-swords—AI-driven weapons that give their wielders a lethal advantage!
    The Grand Zardian Navy is the military force of the proud Zard race from the planet Zardia. Once feared as savages, the Zard have evolved into highly cultured, highly civilized beings, despite their fearsome appearance. The modern Zardian culture is layered with ceremony, tradition, and manners. Instead of outright warfare, the Zard prefer dueling, and have developed superior melee skills. Swordszardship is taught as soon as a Zard hatchling can wield a blade.
  The Star Pirates of Samadi were once the mighty military of the galactic empire, but now they have turned to piracy, displaying a fearsome skull to strike fear into the hearts of their victims, and to show that they take no prisoners. The crew don terrifying skull masks that disguise their identities. Emerging from a hidden base in the Samadi asteroid belt, the Star Pirates prey on passing merchant- and pleasure-ships. Their heavily armored Rocketships possess the strongest Raygun weapons of all of the Planeteers.
  The Blaarg Collective are an alien race from another galaxy. They are a hive mind led by a gigantic leader who controls the smaller Blaarglings to carry out his every command. The Blaarglings have no individual identities, and live and die to serve their master as they scurry around their saucer in their mechanical pants. The Blaarg have found the chaos left in the wake of the galactic cataclysm to be the perfect environment to torment any being they encounter, which they dominate with their terrible mind powers. Will the galaxy survive their invasion?
    Mercenaries are alternative captains for your standard crew. Occasionally, the captains of these powerful crews need to either celebrate an amazing victory, or nurse a few recently added scars. When these occasions arise, the captains call on the mercenaries to take control of their Rocketships, Rayguns, and Crew until their ready to pilot again. Adding new models, special powers, and gameplay options, mercenaries not only look amazing, they add another level or replay-ability to your game!
The WarWulf is a legendary warrior with a fearsome reputation. Some claim that the WarWulf is thousands of years old and shows up whenever the galaxy is in turmoil. Others say that the WarWulf is the state-of-the-art product of the Empire's weapons manufacturing labs. And a few whisper that the truth is anyone can become a WarWulf – and it is a dread curse passed down through the ages. None have survived a battle against this awesome beast to learn the truth.
Read more about the WarWulf on the Official Rayguns & Rocketship blog here!
Rayguns & Rocketships is a dual-scale miniatures board game that plays over the course of a series of rounds. The objective of the game is to be the crew that earns enough victory points to command dominance over the entire galaxy!
Each round in Rayguns & Rocketships happens in 3 phases: 
 Rocketship Movement:
During this phase, each player will select 3 of their command cards and place them face down into 3 piles. 
Starting with the first player, each player flips over their first command card, and moves their ship the indicated amount in the indicated direction.
They also collect the amount of action tokens indicated on the card.
Rocketship Attack:
During this phase, all players, starting with the first, will check to see if their ships are in range of any enemy ships. Ships that have crew members on their Rayguns get a bonus to their accuracy and range. 
Once the available targets are selected, players will roll a number of d8s to equal the amount of Rayguns facing their target.
Successful hits can either be dealt directly to the ship, blocking the spaces where the blast markers are placed, or can be used to blow up enemy Rayguns.
 Crew Action:
Each player, starting with the first, can select any number of their crew members to perform the following: 
Make a move action (move 2 spaces) and perform one attack, or spend an action token to perform one action.
Actions include things like repairing damage, opening the airlock, using the hatch, or making either a ranged or melee attack.
During this phase, action tokens can be used to repeat the movement and attack cycle, dodge incoming crew-to-crew attacks, or use the special ship features.
After these 3 phases have been completed, players, starting with the first, will flip over their second command card and begin the round cycle again.
Destroying Rayguns, defeating crew members, and dealing damage to your opponents' ships all reward you with victory points. Depending on the number of current players, there is a victory point limit. Once one player has reached that goal, all players will have one final round to do as much damage as they can in an attempt to challenge the victor.
Scott Rogers is a veteran video game designer who helped create over 50 AAA titles, including God of War, Pac-Man World, the Maximo series, Drawn to Life, and Darksiders. A former Disney Imagineer, Scott teaches video and tabletop game design at the New York Film Academy in Los Angeles. He has authored two books on game design: Level Up! The Guide to Great Video Game Design and Swipe This! The Guide to Touchscreen Game Design. Rayguns & Rocketships represents a return to his first love, board games, and is his "love letter" to the golden age of space opera. You can follow Scott on Twitter @MightyBedbug or on the Rayguns & Rocketships Facebook page.
                All of the below add-ons are available for you to pledge for IMMEDIATELY. Just click the MANAGE MY PLEDGEbutton at the top of the page and add the amount on money equal to the add-ons you want. We will sort out the rest in our pledge manager after the campaign ends.  
Upgrade your ship's deck with a full arsenal of plastic Raygun miniatures! Scaled to fit your crew, and ample enough to replace all the needed Rayguns in the game, these are sure to make your board blast off with beauty! 
The Planeteer Plastic Pack not only gets you 30 Action Tokens and 30 Blast Tokens, enough to replace all of the cardboard Blast and Action Tokens in your game, but you will also receive a LIMITED EDITION canvas bag to carry all those tokens in! Why the big ? in the middle of the bag? Well Planeteer, that's because we want your help picking the design!
Go here to vote on what our bag will look like by 4/28!
For just $10 you can upgrade all the punchboard Action Tokens from your core game!
For just $10 you can upgrade all the punchboard Action Tokens from your core game!
Each copy of Rayguns & Rocketships comes with:
1 Space Pirate captain & 6 Space Pirate crew members miniatures
1 Zard captain & 6 Zard crew members miniatures
1 Astro Ranger captain & 6 Astro Ranger crew members miniatures
1 Blaarg captain & 6 Blaarg crew members miniatures
4 Rocketship miniatures (Blaarg, Zardian, Astro Rangers, Space Pirates)
1 Star Map board 
4 Rocketship boards (Blaarg, Zardian, Astro Rangers, Space Pirates)
4 Crew Command decks (Blaarg, Zardian, Astro Rangers, Space Pirates)
30 Action tokens
30 Blast tokens
26 Raygun tokens
1 Episode Book
1 Rulebook
Players looking for exciting, dual-scale action can pick up and play Rayguns & Rocketships at a moment's notice by simply setting up for a standard skirmish game. But what would a golden-age space opera be without princesses to save, robots to battle, and asteroids to avoid?
The Rayguns & Rocketships Episode Book allows players to pick from a variety of specially designed Episodes that truly capture that golden-age space opera feel! Giving players unique objectives, Episodes in the Episode Book let you and your friends battle out your differences among the stars while scoring additional victory points for capturing Warbots, saving or kidnapping Princess Persevone, or charging up your Rocketship with the powerful atomic core.
  Congratulations, Planeteer! You've earned yourself a copy of Rayguns & Rocketships, the exclusive Warwulf Mercenary captain and his captain's card, and all the stretch goals we unlock during the campaign at a special EARLY BIRD price! This pledge is LIMITED TO THE FIRST 500 BACKERS! 
Blast off for an adventure like you've never experienced before! By backing our project, you're getting a copy of Rayguns & Rocketships, the exclusive Warwulf Mercenary captain and his captain's card, and all the stretch goals we unlock during the campaign!
IMPORTANT: Shipping Information
We will be charging shipping through our pledge manager after the Kickstarter campaign has successfully completed. It is our intent to charge backers shipping that is based on the cost to ship from our fulfillment partner’s hubs to you. We will ship your rewards at our cost to our fulfillment partner’s hubs. From there, our partners will ship the packages out to you as quickly and efficiently as possible.
Please review the shipping chart below for an estimate of what we are currently expecting shipping to cost. PLEASE NOTE: shipping costs may increase as we unlock more stretch goals, or if you add on additional copies or optional buys.
USA: $12 - $18
Canada: $12 - $18
EU: €7 - €17
Aus & NZ: $13 - $16
Asia: $15 - $20
RotW: $18 - $35
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
IDW is an established publisher of highly regarded comic books, games, and entertainment properties. As such, we've been working with our manufacturing partners for years to continue to bring exciting and inventive products to market. This strong relationship makes us confident that Rayguns & Rocketships with be another great product that every backer can look forward to.

However, with any complicated process, such as molding plastics, or organizing schedules, there is always a chance that delays or technical setbacks could occur. We'll do our best to prevent this, but if they happen to arise, we'll be sure to quickly and clearly communicate these developments to you, our backers.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone, 
It is great to see reports of people in the EU receiving their games! 
Our fulfillment partner has let us know that everyone should have received an email with their shipping delivery information and that they are shipping out! 
If you have not received that information, please email us at - support@idwgames.com - and we can follow up to see what is going on.

Hello Everyone, 
We know you have all been anxious to receive your games and we want you to receive your games too! 
Our fulfillment partners have let us know that games will begin shipping next week. The emails that went out a couple weeks ago, were when they printed their shipping labels. We are hoping that everyone receives their games over the next couple weeks.

Hello planeteers,
Well, after what was a... stressful... few weeks of radio silence, we can confirm that EU has begun fulfillment! 
Turns out our fulfillment parter was closed for the Christmas holiday, which ran, for them, until the 9th of January. Unfortunately, they did not notify us that they were going to be closed and it seems our contact forgot to turn on their "out of office" automated response.

Hey Everyone, 
We are very sorry if you do not have your games yet in the EU. In our last couple updates, we talked about how we were waiting on our fulfillment partner to let us know when they have started shipping, which we are still waiting on. We know that product arrived on the 18th of December to our fulfillment partner, but we do not know if it has shipped yet.
We are consistently contacting them, as we assumed that they would ship product once they had it. The estimates we gave in the last couple updates were the estimates that they gave us and this should have been a very easy process. Obviously, we are still waiting for EU fulfillment for Rayguns & Rocketships and we are disappointed that it has taken so long.

Hey Everyone, 
Thank you all for your patience and we wanted to give everyone an update for EU Shipping.
We received notification that the games have cleared customs and were received last Wednesday at our fulfillment partners. They took Thursday and Friday to organize the games and began packing orders yesterday. We expect them to finish very soon and we will post another update as soon as we know exactly when they expect to finish and have those games out the door.

Hey Everyone, 
Thank you for your patience for EU Shipping and we are very sorry that it has not arrived at your door yet. 
We just heard from our Fulfillment Partner that it has cleared customs on Friday and is scheduled to be delivered to their warehouse this week. From there, it should only take a couple days from their warehouse/offices to arrive to you.

Hello Everyone,
Quick update on shipping! First, we just wanted to thank everyone who played Rayguns and Rocketships with Scott at BGG Con last week, or stopped by the booth at PAX Unplugged to talk with Ross and check out the other games from IDW!
As for shipping, as we mentioned last time, USA, Canada, and Asia are complete. If you have not received your copy please email - support@IDWGames.com -. If you sent an email last week, we're still working through some of them as the conventions kept the staff busy. We will try to wrap up the remaining support request tomorrow before the holiday.

Hello Planeteers!
Dropping in with a shipping update! Please check the regions below to see what's up with Rayguns & Rocketships deliveries:
Asia/Australia: These pledges shipped hot off the presses. They should have all arrived by now. If you have not received you pledge please email our Customer Service at - support@IDWGames.com -

Hello Planeteers! 
Just dropping in to give you all a fulfillment update!
Asia, Australia, & New Zealand: Shipped! Tracking numbers were just given to us today, we will upload them to the Backerkit to give you the ability to track your boxes soon. Sorry for the delay on this. Our fulfillment partners took a bit longer than expected to generate and send us the tracking info.

updates.update_userinfo: Fulfillment Update and Gen Con 50 Photos!

We are excited to start off this announcement by saying that we are expecting to begin fulfilling orders in October! The game is finishing production now and will be on the water in the next few weeks. Backers in the USA should be receiving product in October and Backers in the EU in November. 
   Gen Con 50 was a blast for Rayguns & Rocketships too! We had early production copies for designer Scott Rogers who ran demos for some excited gamers.

campaign.story:
That's right... Cytosis: A Cell Biology Game is a worker placement game that takes place inside a Human Cell!
2 to 5 Players, Ages 10 & up, Plays in 50 to 75 mins
Players utilize the organelles within a cell to collect cellular resources such as mRNA from the Nucleus, Lipids from the Smooth E.R., ATP from the Mitochondria, etc. and score points when they use these resources to complete Hormones, Receptors or Enzymes!
  EVERY BACKER of this campaign will get the Virus Expansion included with thier copy of Cytosis. Players must build up their antibodies for each viral strain to help them defend against the attacking viruses! This expansion adds a whole new element of game play and an interesting push-your-luck experience involving all players!
         The Collector's Edition rewards level for Cytosis will have:
An upgraded Game Box embossed with metallic ink 
Each box will be individually numbered. 
Upgraded custom shaped macromolecule resources screen printed to detail each macromolecule! 
Final resources will include additional screen printing
The shapes represent each macromolecule resource (as closely and accurately as we can with custom wooden pieces). The final production of these custom wooden resources will include screen printing to show a bit more detail of each particular macromolecule (e.g. for carbs, the chemical structure for a glucose molecule).
        A great review by David McMillan from Meeple Mountain
  Wouldn't it be amazing if your kids said, "That was the best day of Science Class EVER!" Well now they can!  
Genius Games has been publishing Science-Based Games for over three years! There are hundreds of chemistry teachers across the globe using Ion and Covalence in their classrooms with raving success.
My First Science Textbook: Protons & Neutrons, Electrons and Atoms - If you’ve been looking for a way to introduce young kids to the wonders of the subatomic, this is the series for you!  
With a playful rhyming style and adorably colorful artwork, Chem 101 has never been so much fun. You can get the 3-book set here! 
A Kickstarter Launch Story - A Documentary Series
Want to know more about what it took to design and launch Cytosis on Kickstarter? Well, we've been filming a documentary series along the way just for you! A Kickstarter Launch Story is a series of short documentaries about the process we went through to design, develop, prototype, prep for Kickstarter, etc, and we're going to keep filming until we have the final game in our hands!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All projects have some level of risk, and ours is no different. In an effort to reduce the overall cost of production (and ultimately lower our funding goal) we are continuing to work with the same overseas manufacturing company we did with all of our previous games including Linkage, Peptide, Ion, Covalence and Virulence. We've had a great experience working with them and are excited to continue building on our connections.

Our turnaround for delivery will be similar to our previous games as we continue to feel out the process with the manufacturer's representatives. We do not expect delays, but anything can happen half a world away just as it could domestically. We rely on our suppliers just as you rely on us, and hope for a relationship of mutual understanding.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Bridges to Nowhere is a fun, strategic, card drafting micro-game where players build unique bridge designs!  This dynamic game challenges players to keep their wits about them at every draw of the card. Players gain points for their bridge based on construction, height, aesthetics, and completing contract objectives. The player with the highest scoring bridge wins!
What will you build today?
      Help us to spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, and Kicktraq to unlock a new mat design! 
First, take turns drafting bridge cards and building your bridge! Pick any card you want, but be aware your opponent will get to pick next. Look for high-point cards and those with excellent synergies like matching bridge types and symbols. Bridge cards can be built onto to your pillar cards so long as they match the bridge type.
Each round, draft new bridge cards and add them to your bridge! Try to draft cards which fit your bridge or cards you know your opponent needs! When building, you can add more pillars to give your bridge great diversity and height for scoring bonuses.
In the final round, finish your bridge by completing all the segments! Draft your last cards and build what you can to finish your bridges, then attach your last pillars to complete each bridge segment. Only completed segments can score.
Determine the winner! Score points printed on each bridge card, multiplying them by their level (x2 for second level, and so on). Award bonus points for each set of adjacent matching symbols. Finally, award points if you met the Contract requirements!
Time for a new match! The player with the highest scoring bridge keeps the Contract card as a victory token. Set up a new game with the loser deciding which player goes first, then play again. The first player to win two Contract cards wins the game!
The Challenge
Bridge parts can only be attached in certain ways and how you navigate these restrictions while striving to fulfill the Contract’s building requirements ultimately determines how well your bridge scores.
For the current rules, click here, or watch our How to Play video below.
                                                                                                                                                         The following is a breakdown of the components of the base game, deluxe game, and the promos.  They also include any unlocked or forth coming stretch goals.
                                                                                                                               You can be a part of bringing Bridges to Nowhere to life by making a pledge to this Kickstarter!
Pledge $12 or more and we will send you one copy of Bridges to Nowhere! This pledge also entitles you to:
any unlocked stretch goals for the base game
one of our limited promo packs
the high quality Print and Play
Pledge $22 or more and get one copy of Bridges to Nowhere Deluxe Edition! You’ll also get:
any unlocked Deluxe stretch goals
TWO of our limited promo packs
the high quality Print and Play
Pledge $30 or more and get one copy of Bridges to Nowhere Deluxe Edition AND one copy of Bridges to Nowhere! You’ll also get:
any unlocked stretch goals
THREE limited promo packs
the high quality Print and Play  
Pledge $35 or more and we’ll send you one copy of Bridges to Nowhere Deluxe Edition including
any unlocked Deluxe stretch goals
two of our limited promo packs
the high quality Print and Play
and our beautiful 14" x 24" game mat to play the game on! This sturdy fabric mat with rubber backing is perfect for protecting your cards, enhancing the look of the game, or just for collecting!
Pledge $100 or more (US and CAN only) and we’ll send you one copy of Bridges to Nowhere Deluxe Edition and 
our beautiful game mat
all unlocked Deluxe stretch goals
the high quality Print and Play
two limited promo packs
and an 11"x14" canvas wrapped print of our game cover artwork to hang wherever you love to see beautiful art. Add $20 to your pledge and we’ll increase the canvas print to 16"x20"!
Pledge $5 or more and receive a high quality version of the Deluxe Edition Print and Play. If you are in an area we don't ship to, please see our note to you in the Shipping section near the end of the page.
Pledge $50 or more (US and CAN only) and receive 
THREE copies of Bridges to Nowhere
THREE copies of Bridges to Nowhere Deluxe Edition
NINE limited promo packs for you or your customers
all unlocked stretch goals
You must have a valid retail license. Additional game copies are available upon request and can be handled after the campaign is over.
     After we reach our funding goal, we would love to add content, upgrades, and promos to Bridges to Nowhere. Each stretch goal has a funding level which unlocks specific upgrades outlined below.
                                                                                                                     Other Great Reviews!
Bearded Meeple (video review)
Unfiltered Gamer (video review)
GJJ Games (written review)
What's Eric Playing? (written review)
We want to thank each reviewer for their time and efforts in showcasing our game on their websites and feeds! We hope to have many more to send you!
    Bridges to Nowhere features multiple ways to play the game! 
 This is a two player dueling card game where players compete to be the first to win two contracts. This mode features the greatest strategic depth as players must decide with each draft if they will focus on making the best bridge possible or prevent large scoring plays by their opponent. 
The solo game uses the same components as the dueling game and requires the player win two contracts within three matches. Instead of scoring against an opponent, the player scores against an escalating point requirement predetermined by their skill level. The solo game captures the strategic challenge of the two player game while remaining a streamlined and fun solitary experience.
3 to 4 players compete with one another to be the first to win two contracts. It features a unique drafting method to keep options tight which keeps the game fast while maintaining maximum strategic depth. This mode is great for players of any skill level!
Bridges to Nowhere in Action!
    We offer several add-ons that can be purchased in addition to your pledge.
Bridges to Nowhere Game Mat  (14" x 24" x 1/16") - Add $13 to your pledge (+$3 shipping outside the US/CAN) to receive our beautiful, high quality fabric game mat with rubber backing. It's large enough to support your best bridge designs. (limit 4 total mats with any pledge)
One additional copy of Bridges to Nowhere base game - Add $10 to your pledge to receive one additional copy of Bridges to Nowhere base game. (limit 1)  
One additional copy of Bridges to Nowhere Deluxe Edition - Add $20 to your pledge to receive one additional copy of Bridges to Nowhere Deluxe Edition. (limit 1)  
Additional retail copies (US and CAN only) - If a retail owner would like to purchase additional copies of either version of the game, please pledge at the $50 retail level and contact us directly for rates.
We are offering free shipping to backers in the United States and Canada. This free shipping extends to everything offered with the specific pledge plus any add-ons purchased with the product.
We offer EU friendly shipping for $8 and $10 shipping for countries outside the US/CAN/EU for the base game, Deluxe Edition, and the Deluxe Combo. +$3 shipping for every game mat included for outside of the US/CAN.  We are shipping the product through a UK fulfillment company which will facilitate delivery and reduce external costs.
Below is our expected timeline for production of the game including the expected delivery dates.
To our supporters outside the US, Canada, and the EU  
We are grateful for your patience with us as we explored options to be able to ship the game world-wide. We are pleased to offer you the ability to purchase the base game, Deluxe game, Deluxe Combo, and now Deluxe Plus. We sincerely hope you enjoy our game.
Doomsday Robots Game Company is a board game design and publishing company based out of Dallas, Texas. The company was founded by John Olson in 2013 and includes co-designers, Brad Shankle and Josh Geimer.
Our Vision - We see games as art and creativity as the cornerstone of great design. Our passion is to create fun, high-quality, innovative board games that harmonize mechanics, theme, and presentation into a beautiful tabletop experience!  
We believe we've accomplished this goal with Bridges to Nowhere and hope you will help this project to become the first of many more great tabletop games!
The Doomsday Robots Team
If you'd like to know more about us or subscribe to our mailing list, please go to our website and follow us on Facebook. 
We couldn't have done this alone.  Special thanks to:
Marc Hampson (www.littlebrothersns.com) - Artist and Animator
Marco Cervone - Videographer
Nick Haley - Narrator
The following people and entities have helped us get Bridges to Nowhere to Kickstarter and they deserve special mention. We are grateful for their help and hope they will continue to serve as amazing resources for others.
Dallas Designer Group
   Daniel Zayas
   Jamey Stegmaier
   James Mathe
   James Hudson
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Being the first Kickstarter project for Doomsday Robots, there is much we are learning as we go. While we have a pretty good handle on some elements, like our art, rules, and play-testing, we are still learning how to optimize both manufacturing and fulfillment and expect that we will experience challenges along the way. This is one of the primary reasons we were slow to offer shipping world-wide, to reduce the risks to deliver our product as expected.

We also recognize that we must also provide good customer service and as such are offering a money back guarantee for our product. If you don't like the game or if it arrives damaged, please contact us to coordinate its return and we will refund your money.

While we bring to the table strong planning and financial skills due to our day jobs, there are likely still surprises we are in for, so we are prepared to front additional capital needed to cover any of these unexpected financial issues that may arise.

While we recognize our weaknesses, we must also recognize one of our greatest strengths - we have a solid, amazing game that has been rigorously tested, and we are confident you will enjoy it thoroughly.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Because of your belief in us and our product, Bridges to Nowhere, Doomsday Robots Game Company is a real thing. Being a new company and first time creator we realize you took a chance on us and frankly, we made some mistakes along the way, but you’ve been incredibly supportive of us and for that we are very grateful. We hope you’ll continue to follow us on this journey as we grow as a publisher. We appreciate the feedback we’ve received on how we can be better and will continue to welcome it.

If you live outside the US, NOW is the time to finalize your shipping address.  I will close address modifications at 4:00 am GMT Wednesday.
I will then send that list to our fulfillment partner for shipping.

Assuming no additional customs delays, the product will make its way directly to us in Dallas, TX.  Once we have it, we will begin shipping orders to our US backers.
As those in the EU know, we changed fulfillment companies.  Considering the problems with our previous company, we had to find someone more reliable, so we switched to  Spiral Galaxy Games (SGG), but the transition has been slow - more forms to fill out and more customs headaches.  We do not have an ETA yet for when the freight will arrive at the port in the UK, so we still aren't certain how long before SGG will ship the product to backers.  I can assure you the shipment will remain EU friendly.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 2nd attempt at this campaign. We learned a lot of things since launching the first time and it has helped us make this project better for both us and you, our backers. We will continue to be as transparent as possible as we want to build trust with our backers. Everyone understands that there always risks involved with Kickstarter campaigns but we will do our best to minimize those risks.

The risks we face are mostly in the manufacturing and fulfillment process as all the art and rulebook are done in house by our team. The artwork is about 85% complete with just some final adjustments to be made. The rulebook is also close to being finished with just some fine tuning of wording and updating the artwork as it is completed.

We have our manufacturer lined up and have talked to fulfillment centres to make sure everything will run as smoothly as possible. All our files will be ready for manufacturing as soon as the Kickstarter is successful. This way we can get started on getting complete samples made and start the manufacturing process as soon as possible.

We've done our best to provide our backers with a reasonable Kickstarter discount for both the game itself and the shipping costs. We hope you'll join in helping us bring this project to life and enjoy playing it as much as we enjoyed designing it.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
