updates.update_userinfo: Delivery status, missing items requests and other news
updates.update_content:
Ladies & Gentlemen,
Our apologies for a 2-week silence, we took a bit of holidays and also 2 member of our team took the time to get married :)
1/ Status of shipped games
From what we know, all European and North American backers should already have received their games. Also, most backers from Asia (Taiwan, Philippines, China and Hong Kong being the exceptions) should be in the same situation. If you're in one of these regions and your games have not reached your home yet, please drop us a message.

Ladies & Gentlemen,
Some of you have asked for the card list in Strawberry Ninja so you can check if your game boxes are complete. So... here it is:
4x Movement 
1x Scoring track 
1x Strawberry Ninja

Ladies & Gentlemen,
We have good news :)
In short, your games have been packed and shipped! The only thing left now to do is sit back and wait for your postman to bring  your copy :)
We must admit that we have a little bit underestimated the amount of time and work it takes to pack almost 1500 packages, therefore we had to be silent so we can recover.

Ladies & Gentlemen,
For the past few days we have been centralizing huge Excel files with your shipping addresses, preparing labels and contracting our local post to come and pick up more than 1400 packages. So, we're all set for shipping.
Now, if you want to know in details what is about to happen, here it is...

updates.update_userinfo: Production almost ready, getting ready to ship
updates.update_content:
Ladies & Gentlemen,
We have just learned that Strawberry Ninja game boxes are almost done, and we will receive them next week.
Since all rewards are shipped from Poland, we have decided to lock down surveys. All of you have already received such a notification, so please update your address (if you need to) in the next 48 hours. After that, we can no longer allow any changes of address and we won't be able to make exceptions from this rule.

Ladies & Gentlemen,
We have just opened the post-campaign survey. It's a very simple one, basically all we need from you is your delivery address and phone number for the courier. If you have any remark about your pledge, there's also a field to write to us.
The address will stay editable for as long as possible, weeks or even days before we are ready to send out your packages. Changing address after your original answer is quite straightforward: on the main campaign page you can look for a button/link saying and once you clink on it you will be able to edit your survey.

Ladies & Gentlemen,
We have good news! The files that we had to prepare for production are almost ready and we plan to deliver them to our factory next week, which means that they will be able to start doing their part sooner than we have originally planned.
We do not know if we can already promise some earlier delivery, but we can assure you that we are on the right track :)

Ladies & Gentlemen,
After a weekend off when we had time to recharge our batteries, we're back to work at full speed and we want to brief you on our battle plan.
1. Finalizing files for printing
With the artwork ready, all we need to do is prepare the final files for printing. Production will take place in Poland with our long term partners Granna in Warsaw, and we already have their specifications. We estimate to deliver final files in about 10 days.

Ladies and Gentlemen!
With the Strawberry Ninja project over, we look at those last weeks, look at the number of backers, and the final tally, and there is just one thing we can really say now:

campaign.story:
Food Truck Champion is a fast-paced card game for 2 to 5 players ages 8+ and plays in about 1 hour. 
In Food Truck Champion, you are the owner of a new food truck, out to make a name for yourself. Hire staff, cook food, and please customers to earn awards and gain popularity. At the end of the day, the food truck with the most popularity wins!
1 Card Serves 3 Functions!
Game cards can be used for 3 distinct functions: Staff Action, Order Ticket, or Ingredient. Clever hand management and action selections will be key in using your game cards to help you win the game. You'll also need to time actions so that you can gain cards from the Marketplace (center card pool) that benefit you the most!
Game Flow
On your turn, you can either do Market Research (draw 2 cards), Take Charge (draw your Owner/Wild card), or initiate an Action Round by playing a card from your hand as a Staff Action. Use Staff Actions to move cards to and from different zones (the Marketplace, your Hand, Player Board) in an effort to complete Orders Tickets.
There are 5 different Staff Actions: 
Driver: Move a card from the Marketplace to your Fridge as an Ingredient.
Cashier: Move a card from the Marketplace to your Plating Area as an Order Ticket.
Manager: Move a card from the Marketplace to your Hired Staff for a bonus Staff Action in future turns.
Prep Cook: Move a card that is an Ingredient from your Fridge to an Order Ticket in your Plating Area.
Exec. Chef: Play a card as an Ingredient from your hand onto an Order Ticket in your Plating Area.
When you complete an Order Ticket, you'll take a Popularity Token from 1 of 3 stacks. Add that token to your Food Truck board to upgrade (level up) your abilities! 
The Meat of the Game...  
The Action Round is where a lot of tough decisions and game play will take place. If you initiate an Action Round, all other players will get a chance to follow your Staff Action by either playing a card from their hand or relying on one of their Hired Staff.  
Be careful, because a player can take several of the same action by following you! For example, if you lead with a Driver, your opponent can have a Driver in their Hired Staff and still play a Driver from their hand to take that action twice! Timing is everything if you want to serve up a hot meal and be the cream of the crop. 
We've Sprinkled in Some Spice...
Besides fulfilling Order Tickets for Popularity Tokens, there are 2 more ways to gain bonus points:
Flavor Profiles: Each food truck has a Flavor Profile that will help you get 5 bonus points for a set. Add Order Tickets to your Awards when a Critique token comes up. This set collection mechanic seamlessly layers in added game play and strategy.
Signature Dishes: Each Order Ticket has a food truck logo on it signifying that it is one of that food truck's Signature Dish. Try to match Order Tickets that have your food truck logo on them to get a bonus point at the end of the game.
Check, Please!
The game ends when 2 out of the 3 Popularity Token stacks are empty. Players take equal turns, then count up their Popularity on tokens they've gained throughout the game, bonus points for sets of Flavor Profile icons in their Awards, and bonus points for Signature Dishes. The player with the most Popularity becomes the FOOD TRUCK CHAMPION!
   Game Contents:
36 Cardboard Tokens
5 Player Boards
5 Player Cards
100 Game Cards
1 First Player Card
1 Active Player Token
1 Beautifully Illustrated Rulebook
Deluxe Food Truck Champion
The Deluxe Food Truck Champion pledge includes everything above, plus the items below. 
Kickstarter Limited Exclusive Token
1 First Player Knife Token
Helper Mini-Expansion
We've Added Another Helper Thanks to Our Backers!
Kickstarter Limited Exclusive Mini-Helper Expansion
6 Double-sided Helper Cards
5 Food Truck Logo Cardboard Tokens
We have some great Stretch Goals planned to help us add even more content, illustrations, and upgraded materials! Thank you for your support.
                                                                                                                                                                                                              We like to support game stores around the world by offering the Kickstarter versions of the game to retailers during the campaign. We treat retailer backers just like other backers in that they receive their rewards before we release regular retail games into distribution. For pricing, contact David at david@dailymagicgames.com.
Every game we create is a discrete project with its own development schedule and it's own budget of production and marketing expenses. We bring each project to Kickstarter when it's ready to give you, our fans and supporters, the opportunity to help us put the final touches on the game and to reserve your copies at the time it will do the game the most good, both financially and creatively. 
Some say that a creator should not launch a new project until their previous project is completed and delivered. That system might work for a designer who is self-publishing a game, but for an up-and-coming company like Daily Magic Games, that system is not viable. At any point in time we are working on a dozen projects in various stages of completion. Right now, for example...  
Quests of Valeria is shipping to backers. 
Merchants of Araby is at the printer.
Go Nuts for Donuts has been taken over by GameWright.
Kitten Klash is at the printer. 
10 Minute Heist: The Wizard's Tower is at the printer 
VCK Flames & Frost is at the printer.
Food Truck Champion is on Kickstarter now.
Sailing Toward Osiris is prepping for Kickstarter May 2nd .
Horizons is in final playtesting.  
We're hoping that our track record for successfully completing and delivering previous projects will give you the confidence to support this new project, and that the forthright communications we present when projects do hit snags will assuage any fears that we're going to screw it all up.
Swinging Jivecat Voodoo Lounge delivered one month late in December 2015 and is nearly sold out. 
Valeria: Card Kingdoms delivered on time in January 2016. 
ManaSurge delivered one month late in June 2016 and is currently sold out. 
Villages of Valeria delivered 4 months late due to production and fulfillment delays. 
Quests of Valeria delivered on time in February 2017. 
Merchants of Araby is at the printer and is on-track for early delivery in May 2017.  
Go Nuts for Donuts has partnered with Gamewright and on-track for delivery in July 2017. 
10 Minute Heist: The Wizard's Tower is at the printer and on-track for delivery in August 2017. 
Valeria: Card Kingdoms - Flames & Frost is at the printer and on-track for delivery in August 2017. 
We are very happy to announce that Schwerkraft-Verlag will be joining us on this print run to bring Food Truck Champion in the German language to Germany.
Schwerkraft-Verlag is a German board game publisher specialized in the localization of foreign language games. They are well known for their German versions of Terraforming Mars, Raiders of the North Sea, Tiny Epic Kingdoms, and other top sellers. 
They are also an experienced partner when it comes to fulfilling German language pledges. Schwerkraft-Verlag has already provided excellent fulfillment service to backers of games like Mare Nostrum and Catacombs, and we have full confidence in their abilities and customer service.
All backers of a German language version of Food Truck Champion will get their service and delivery via Schwerkraft-Verlag. You can contact them via their website: www.Schwerkraft-Verlag.de
Daily Magic Games is a designer-friendly and customer-focused publisher specializing in casual tabletop games that are easy to learn and play, yet layered with strategy and depth. 
  Isaias Vallejo, Wizard-in-Chief, Game Designer, and Developer
David MacKenzie, Conjurer and Game Developer
Levi Mote, Alchemist, Game Designer, and Developer
Sarah Sharp, Enchantress and Convention Event Planner
Dylan Pharaoh-Whitney, Sorcerer and Graphic Designer
Claire Donaldson, Illusionist, Illustrator, and Graphic Designer
We are focused on listening to what our customers have to say and making sure that we are producing the type of games you want at the high quality you demand. We are actively involved in the Comments section of each Kickstarter and keep backers up to date with plenty of updates post-Kickstarter. We like to make casual and gateway games in an effort to get more people to the table. Our games are easy to learn to help new players get in to the game faster, but they're also layered with strategy for the more seasoned players. 
We're based out of Seattle, Washington and like to focus on the growth and promotion of game design in the Pacific Northwest. We've even started a playtesting event network called playtestNW to help local designers meet each other and engage with playtesters on a regular basis. Our hope is that we're helping designers build better games.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Daily Magic Games is committed to delivering quality products on time. We realize that the publication of a board game can be complicated and, no matter how experienced the project creators and mangers are, some problems may occur. In an effort to reduce the likelihood of delays and mistakes, we have taken several steps to prepare for success:

1. This game project, as well as the Kickstarter campaign itself, are in the hands of two well-seasoned professionals. David MacKenzie has been running Kickstarter projects since 2010 (Alien Frontiers, Sunrise City, King's Forge, Swinging Jivecat Voodoo Lounge, Valeria: Card Kingdoms, ManaSurge, Villages of Valeria, Quests of Valeria, Merchants of Araby, Go Nuts For Donuts, 10 Minute Heist), and Isaias Vallejo comes from a digital games background as Executive Producer at Big Fish Games and has designed several successful board games: Sunrise City, Valeria: Card Kingdoms, Valeria: Card Kingdoms - Flames & Frost, Villages of Valeria, and Quests of Valeria.

2. We are dedicated to backer communication and feedback. Throughout every campaign, we are as transparent about the process and as open to feedback as possible without jeopardizing production and delivery timelines.

3. We have done significant pre-production. All the art and graphic design for Food Truck Champion are completed with the exception of the stretch goals content and Helper cards. The art and design for the stretch goals content has been sketched out and is ready to push forward as soon as each goal is achieved.

4. We have our manufacturer lined up and ready to begin the pre-press process as soon as the the files are delivered. We hope that everything goes as planned, but if something falls through the cracks, we are ready and willing to employ every tool at our disposal to get the project back on track and running smoothly.

Thank you for your support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Optional Buys
How to adjust your Kickstarter Pledge for Optional Buys (Article)
How to adjust your Kickstarter Pledge for Optional Buys (Video)
You can also purchase optional buys during the Backerkit survey, but those funds won't go towards stretch goals!
   More details about all of the gameplay add-ons are available here!
                                                                                                                      Photo Cards will be Space Goat Exclusive, included in addition to illustrated cards with all $60 pledges and above! (They will packaged separately from the core box) 
All Torso Endoskeletons unlocked will be added to the Termination box!
  All Torso Endoskeletons unlocked will be added to the Termination box!
  The Cyberdyne coin will be made of plastic and included in all Termination boxes!
Gameplay
The Terminator™: The Official Board Game is an asymmetrical strategy game for 2-5 players played across two boards: one in 1984 and one in 2029. One player takes control of all of Skynet’s forces: Hunter Killer machines, Terminator cyborgs, and more. The rest of the players take the role of the human resistance, struggling against the impossible odds of the machine uprising. Each of the two game boards play differently: 2029 focuses on light troop and resource management in a lopsided battle for dominance. 1984 focuses on personal missions with high stakes and intense pacing. Missions arise through the course of gameplay, and have players make decisions in 1984 that will affect the future, erasing and adding components in real time.
Gameplay and Actions in The Terminator:
The Lynnvander team teaches how to play:
  Follow along with the Rules Booklet by downloading the PDF here:
     Press
The Terminator: The Official Board Game has been featured at the following outlets!
Retailer Info
We understand the struggle retailers have when it comes to Kickstarter campaigns, as there’s a lot of Kickstarter exclusive goodies that retailers don’t get access to through their normal retailer channels. That’s why Space Goat has made every Kickstarter product available to retailers while the campaign is running! If there’s something we offer on the Kickstarter, you’ll be able to buy it for your shop.
We are also soliciting the game with a number of distributors while the campaign is running, in case you want to get less than 6.
Who We Are
Created in 2006, Space Goat Productions has decades of combined experience producing comic books, TV, animation, video games, commercial art, and concept design. This past year, Space Goat began production on board games for both the Evil Dead and Terminator franchises, and has since acquired The Howling along with a few other top secret licenses soon to be announced. Space Goat has transformed from the industry's premier service provider, to a highly successful comic book and board game publisher.Space Goat is also the comic book industry’s premier production studio. We’ve provided art and creative services for Marvel, DC, Nike, Microsoft, Universal Studios, Riot Games, and Blizzard Entertainment.
About Lynnvander
Lynnvander Inc. is a Southern Ontario based company inspired to enhance existing or create new intellectual properties. Founded in July of 2005 by Thomas M. Gofton, Lynnvander is responsible for the inception of several media initiatives including projects of film, literature, game design, and company leadership.
Lynnvander produced the award-winning series “Mind’s Eye“, the acclaimed comedy “The Gamers: Natural One” and the The Gamers: Dorkness Rising sequel “Hands of Fate.”
Lynnvander created the RPG setting "Legacy of Mana" before being published in Shadowrun’s “A World of Shadows” anthology. Delving into tabletop game design, Lynnvander is responsible for "The Legacy Series (Albion’s, Neverland’s and Sherwood’s)" and “Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Board Game” as well as the up and coming 2017 releases; “Cowboy Bebop”, “Dragon Ball Z”, “The Terminator”, “Galaxy Quest” and “Dark Stalkers Vs Street Fighter” board games.
About Taylor Smith
Taylor Smith designed Evil Dead 2: The Official Board Game and rumors have it that the Dark Ones have been inhabiting his mortal vessel ever since. Editor, Creative Director, and official Captain (he has the hat to prove it) at Space Goat Productions, Taylor worked behind the scenes on major projects in the worlds of Elder Scrolls, Halo, Guild Wars, StarCraft, and more. He's also made a couple RPGs and released them independently under the moniker of Whimsy Machine Games—they're pretty neat.
Why Kickstarter?
We literally could not make a game of this scale without Kickstarter. We want to make a game that hardcore board game fans and Terminator fans will love with the coolest miniatures possible, but we can’t do that without funding assistance from Kickstarter. We’ve done all we can on our own, but after this point we need backers’ help.
The Kickstarter community is amazing and we love them! With their feedback, support, and advice, we made Evil Dead 2 a way better game than if we did it by ourselves. We want backers to be part of the process, we want their ideas for stretch goals, optional buys, mechanics, etc. We may not be able to use everything you suggest, but the suggestions we do use will make it a much better game.
We know a lot of companies just try and use Kickstarter as an ATM, but that’s not something we we want to be a part of at Space Goat. Kickstarter is a wonderful community that we’re privileged to be a part of, and we want to do our best to serve that community. If people have suggestions that would improve the game, we’ll try to implement them! If we can’t, we’ll explain why. We’re happy to give you as much information as we can, to the point that we’ll send you way too much on the intricacies of board game pre-press if we have to.
Shipping
Shipping will be charged after the Kickstarter ends based on actual shipping costs and is collected via Backerkit. This allows us to charge shipping fairly for all backers and avoid a 'one size fits all' mentality to shipping.
Below are shipping estimates for the core game (estimated to be around 3lbs). These are just estimates. Costs may rise due to weight increase as more items are unlocked via stretch goals and optional buy purchases you choose. This will be calculated by Backerkit after backer surveys are turned in. We will not be able to ship to China.
USA - $15
EU (including UK) - $20.00
Canada - $20
AU - $35
Mexico - $35
Most other countries - $35
We have customs friendly local shipping in USA, EU, Canada and Australia. We will look for the same arrangement in all locations where we have a significant number of backers.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
====== 

License 

======

The Terminator™: The Official Board Game has been developed by Space Goat Productions with full support and license from Studiocanal.

Products presented on this Kickstarter page and during the campaign may be subject to change in order to meet the expectations of the Studiocanal licensing agreement.

By pledging on this Kickstarter you acknowledge that the final look and contents of the pledges may change and differ from what is presented at the start of the campaign.

T1, THE TERMINATOR, ENDOSKELETON, and any depiction of Endoskeleton are trademarks of Studiocanal S.A.S. All Rights Reserved. © 2017 Studiocanal S.A.S. ® All Rights Reserved. 
========= 

Challenges 

=========

This is our second Kickstarter project, and hoo boy did we learn a lot from the last one. There is a lot of challenges that come with designing a board game of this size and scale.

Including (but not limited to)

Production 
Shipping 
Customs
Creation of art assets,
Licensor Approval

Space Goat’s first Kickstarter is about to be sent to the manufacturer, and despite some learning from Space Goat’s side of things, is still on track to be delivered to backers in Spring 2017. We’ve made all updates public, so if you’d like to see how our previous campaign (Evil Dead 2) is going, we encourage you to look at the Kickstarter page! You can also feel free to message us on Kickstarter with any questions or concerns you may have.

Lynnvander, who has co-designed the game with us and helping us with the Kickstarter process, has run 8 Kickstarter campaigns and they are bringing their considerable expertise to help make sure this process process runs smoothly.

We have estimated the delivery for Winter 2017 but please understand this is only an estimate. Due to the global logistics involved in shipping, some regions may receive their pledges sooner than others. We will, however, ensure a global release of any The Terminator™: The official Board Game products for retailers.

We have prepared as much as possible with our production for a successful Kickstarter, however we will refund pledges if for some unforeseen reason the game cannot be delivered at all.

======= 

Refunds 

=======

After the Kickstarter closes, we will give refunds for individual pledges minus Kickstarter processing fees. (We don’t have that money anymore, so we can’t give it back to you.) This will likely be around 90% of what you originally pledged. We can give 90% refund pledges up until the survey closes. After the survey closes, we will not be able to offer you a refund as we will have locked in everyone’s pledges for manufacturing. We will provide ample warning to backers when the survey is about to close.

Refunds are reversed via Stripe to your credit/debit card. 

This is a USD Kickstarter and refunds will be processed in USD for the amount received, excluding any applicable fees dependent on the day at which the refund is processed as detailed above.

================= 

Terms and Conditions 

=================

If you do not confirm your shipping and pledge details within 10 weeks of our notification via email to confirm it will be treated as abandoned. We will however look at each case sympathetically and try our best to satisfy each customer.

By pledging on this Kickstarter you agree that our responsibility to you is for shipping your order as entered into the pledge management system. You are responsible for import or other duties that may be payable to relevant tax authorities. You also accept that you are fully liable for incorrect shipping details and will risk your pledge being unable to be delivered or lost in transit.

We are unable to ship to PO Boxes.

If you do not accept the proposed terms please do not pledge on this Kickstarter project and wait for the global general release.

=================

About Creative Licensing 

Located in Los Angeles CA, Creative Licensing is a full service independent merchandise licensing agency that specializes in long-term brand development. Founded in 1982, Creative Licensing currently represents a large catalogue of classic films and properties. http://www.creativelicensingcorporation.com/

About Studiocanal 

STUDIOCANAL is a subsidiary of the CANAL+ Group. It is one of Europe’s leading companies in the market for co-production, acquisition, distribution and sale of international feature films. STUDIOCANAL is the only studio operating simultaneously in three main territories across Europe: France, the United Kingdom and Germany. The company distributes a total of more than 50 films a year throughout Europe. Additionally, STUDIOCANAL owns one of the most important libraries in the world, with more than 5,000 international titles.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Dear Backers -  
With the apparent failure of the equity crowdfunding campaign, we have taken a step back to regroup and consider a number of options. Some paths forward have been presented to us. We need a few weeks to find the best path forward. As soon as we find that best path forward, you all will be the first to know.  
Sincerely, Shon Bury

updates.update_userinfo: And Now a Letter from our Founder
updates.update_content:
Hello Everyone,
THE BOARD
Last week we talked about some updates to the 2029 board. We received a lot of good backer feedback about that--including a few folks suggesting that we make those barriers modular chipboard tiles that would allow you to change the setup on your 2029 boards to keep the action fresh each time you play the game. Even potentially allowing you to play out some different scenarios on the future board.

Hello Everyone,
Let’s dive into this board!
Last week I told you about some functional adjustments that we need to make to increase the playability of the board.
In case you missed the last update, here’s another look at the original board….

Hello Everyone,
This week we’re going to talk about the 2029 Skynet Board! Throughout playtesting, I kept running into areas where this board felt like it could be improved. 
 Let’s get right into it!

Hello Everyone,
The last few weeks have been a whirlwind for me. I ran into some health issues that required a bit of surgery (all good now...and yes, I know some of you don’t want to know about that AT ALL)--but things are better now and I’m making up for lost time and trying to keep things all moving forward.

Hello Everyone --
This week I wanted to show you pages from the rulebook with the new rules I have been talking about in place for you to review and ask questions about -- but I have been under the weather, and haven't gotten that finished just yet.  As I write this I'm not feeling terribly well, but like the post office of old - no rain nor sleet nor snow is going to keep me from posting this update (but the medicine I'm on right now is trying its best).

Hello Everyone (I dropped the terrible Terminator puns)! --
Another week -- another update!  
This week the Terminator portion of my brain has been working on updating the rulebook to properly reflect the changes that I mentioned last week and making a few minor graphics tweaks to the game.  Nothing terribly interesting -- but all of it very necessary to ensure that you have a great game that's easy to understand when it hits your table.

Hello Everyone!
Another week -- another update -- 
Victor and I met today to go over the details and prep for his starting at the end of the week.  He will begin taking over direct messages in the next few days -- so be on the lookout if you're waiting for a reply!  He'll need some time to ramp up, but we'll have this HK-Tank running smoothly before you know it!

project_data.project_name: The Terminator™: The Official Board Game

campaign.story:
Dogs has been previously published in Brazil (selling out 3 print runs) and is a complete game.  This is an English language translation of that same game with some small enhancements to the layout and components as well as a revised two-player variant. The game, its art, and all the components are complete.  The funds raised through this Kickstarter campaign will be going directly to printing costs.
To be clear, upon successful funding of the project we will be moving aggressively to collecting the Dog Names and then sending everything to the Printer. Our goal is to have this game in your hands by August, 2017.
In Dogs, each player owns an Animal Rescue Center and wants to turn it into the largest and most comfortable shelter for city and country dogs. Each game round is divided into three phases:
In Phase 1 players move their trucks through two different areas of the board, Country and City, collecting various stray dogs. Certain dogs will provide immediate financial rewards, while other lost and abandoned dogs of differing breeds will need medical care and food, yielding valuable points at the end of the game. Players will be competing for the same breeds, so tactics and strategy should be carefully considered.
In Phase 2 players select special cards and can perform important actions in five different places: City Hall, the Warehouse, the Pet Shop, a Veterinary Clinic, and the Dog Fair. The number of players who can use each location in the round is limited so choosing the right action is crucial to bringing about good results. In addition, there are three types of resources in the game (gas, food, and medicine) and it is essential to manage them successfully in order to avoid penalties.
In Phase 3 players feed the dogs in their kennels, pay the salaries of assistants, and organize the board for the next round.
Upon completion of a certain number of rounds, the kennel with the highest score wins the game!
The basic game is the same as the original version which was released in Brazil.  We have made some changes to the art and added new rules for the two-player game as well as some advanced options for when you’re ready for even more of a challenge.
The two-player game changes things up a bit, there are fewer dogs and resources making decisions tougher.  Roadwork tiles are added to the bag and appear on the board randomly, costing extra valuable gas to move through.  Several new game end triggers were also added, so keep a close eye on your opponents' actions!
Advanced options are flexible, add in just one or select them all. Use the two-player Roadwork tiles in a 3 or 4 player game.  Limit the amount of food and medicine that can be purchased from the Pet Store.  Use one or two of the two-player end game triggers. The choice is yours.  While Dogs is primarily a family game, it also has enough depth to engage the strategy  gamer.
  We have two reward levels.  For the Standard level, you will receive the game and all the stretch goals (shipping costs vary by country).  For the Name reward level, you get the game and all stretch goals and you also get to personally name one of the dogs!  The Name reward level is split into 12 categories, one for each breed of dog in the game.  There are 7 tokens for each breed, giving a total of 84 opportunities to name a dog.  For this option, the dog's name and city will appear on the back of chosen breed's token, as well as in the rulebook. This is a family game so we do reserve the right to decline a name that is not family friendly.  Space is limited to 12 (Latin characters only, sorry no pictographic) characters for the dog's name as well as for the city. Your dog's name will appear in all copies of this Kickstarter edition. As a thank you for putting your dog in our game, worldwide shipping is on us for these Name reward levels.
This project will ship around the world but we have been working with our distributors and can offer EU, AU, Canada and US friendly shipping!
    We have three stretch goals defined with more to come if we unlock the third.
At the $21,000 level, we will be upgrading the cardboard worker tokens to wooden meeples.  Your workers deserve arms and legs don't they?
At the $22,000 level, we will be upgrading the cardboard kennel tokens to wooden dog house tokens.  Your furry friends deserve good looking kennels.
At $23,000 level we will upgrade the starting player token from cardboard to a wooden dog token.  This will make the starting player truly the top dog!
We have some other great stretch goals as well, which we will reveal as the campaign unfolds.
     Dogs includes:
1 Mounted Game Board
4 Animal Rescue Centers
20 Player Tokens
4 Player Truck Tiles
42 Country Dog Tokens
42 City Dog Tokens
9 Reward Dog Cards
42 Bonus Cards
24 Money Tokens
36 Gasoline Tokes
22 Food Tokens
22 Medicine Tokens
1 Action Space / Dog Fair Board
4 Wooden Trucks
6 Roadwork Tokens (for 2 player or advanced game)
1 Starting Player Token
2 Draw Bags
1 Rulebook
       Want to see what others think of Dogs?  Here are some video reviews!
This is the original Rahdo Runthrough about Dogs:
Rahdo recently did an update based on an early copy of our new version!  Take a look!
 The folks over at The Cardboard Stacker have posted up a play though of Dogs with the new 2 Player Rules.  Many thanks Guys!!!
   The awesome team over at the Unfiltered Gamer have posted their overview of the game!!!  Thank you guys so much!  Take a look:
  To find out more about the game check out these links.
    Special thanks to Nick Peck for the great sound design, Debbie Gatton for lending us her amazing voice, and Indie Game Alliance for their advice.

updates.update_userinfo: We have launched our next game!
updates.update_content:
Hello Dog Backers!   I wanted to take a quick moment to let you know that we here at Gray Mass Games have launched our second project: Senatus!   It is a fast paced, highly competitive game about controlling the politics of Rome circa 100 AD.  We are very excited about this project and all the art is done by the same artist (Diego Sanchez) that did the art for Dogs.  We hope you will head on over to the project page and take a look and maybe even add this game to your collection!  
Here is the link:  http://kck.st/2DNhJEO
All the Best,

Folks we have some great news!!!!   Our shipment made port this AM and is now sitting in Customs in the UK!!!!  WooHOO!!!!!   That means we move to the final stages of fulfillment for this project.  This is very exciting for us here at Gray Mass Games and more importantly means that you are all very close to getting Dogs in your hands!!!
So a couple of things triggered by today's news.  One is that I have closed the BackerKit for new or add on orders.  If you have payed for additional copies via a Credit Card you will see the charge hit today.  If there was an issue with processing that order you will be receiving an email asking you to address the issue.  If you can please do this as quickly as possible because we need to give our Distributor the final mailing list as soon as possible.

All,
Many apologies for the delay on an update but between GenCon, work, a move, a wedding, a surprise visit form my son and a heat wave the last 30 days or so have been..  well pretty full..  ;-)
However..  there is good news!  During all of that we received the second set of proofs from the publisher and they looked great!   We approved the proof and the printer completed the printing and loaded up the palettes!  But wait there is more!  Our palettes are on a BOAT (Well technically a Cargo Ship)!!!   Yup the games are officially at Sea and steaming their way to our distributor!   Currently we are anticipating that the ship will reach it's destination in early October and then it will need to be offloaded, clear customs and then off to distribution.  We are not sure of exact dates yet but will be able to update you once the ship make port.

Hello everyone! Gary and I are currently on a plane heading to Indianapolis for GenCon 50 and I thought I would take a moment to post a quick update.
We had mentioned that the first proof from the printers had problems and we decided that we needed to have the cards reprinted as well as some other items. It appears that there have been additional issues which have delayed the reprint of the cards and components so we can see a second proof to make sure everything looks awesome before we release the game to the shippers. As a further complication the lead up to GenCon is a very busy time for printers and it seems we got bumped on the queue by larger game orders.

All,
Thanks to everyone who has filled out their BackerKit survey and a special thank you to those who have chosen to purchase additional copies of the game!  We are thrilled as punch!!!!!
We are currently holding at about 95% completion on the surveys.  We want to get everyone who backed us their copy of the game as soon as possible so if you have not replied to your survey please, please do so this week!

updates.update_userinfo: Release the Kracken!! I mean the BackerKit Survey!!!!!!
updates.update_content:
Ok!   Our Smoke Test has gone very well!  We caught an issue with the shipping rates for Add-Ons and got that resolved so I think we are good to go!!  I am going to release the rest of the Surveys now so expect to see them today.
A few notes:
If you are a Backer (Even for $1!) you can choose to Add-On copies of the Game for $29 a copy plus the shipping (Base shipping to your Region + small incremental fee / additional copy).

All,
Many of you have anxiously been awaiting the BackerKit Survey.  We have been working on getting it all set up so that you can order additional copies of Dogs should you choose to do so.  I have in the process of doing this learned more than I ever wished to know about Shipping and Logistics but now feel like I can not only create BackerKit Surveys but also be available for Birthday Parties and Bar Mitzvahs!   Lemme tell you Shipping Tables are FUN kids!  ;-)

updates.update_userinfo: Quick Update on the Backer Survey and new Dog Stories
updates.update_content:
All,
Just a quick update to let everyone know that the BackerKit Survey is being reviewed and should be on it's way to everyone Monday or Tuesday of this week.  
We should be getting final proofs from the printer this week and if everything looks good we will be proceeding to prepping the games for shipment!  We have been working with our logistics partner and they are ready to pick up the games as soon as they are ready.  We won't have a firm date for delivery until we actually get put into a container and placed on a ship but we will let you know as soon as those details become available.

One of the amazing things that happened as part of this project was something that we never really planned.  As part of the named Pledge Levels we started receiving stories about the Dogs that people were naming their pledges after.  These are amazing stories and as we went along Gary encouraged people to send these stories in to us, and you did.  He has complied all those submitted and put them together into a PDF.  Here is a link to those collected so far.:

Folks,
We had an update from the Printer overnight and it looks like they have completed printing the Boards!  Woo Hoo!   There is still several pieces that have to come together for the game to be ready to ship AND we have not seen the actual printing results (we will double check to make sure everything printed fine and the materiel looks good, etc.) but barring any issues around those we are likely to have the games ready to get on a ship in mid-June.   We are coordinating with the Shipper and will have a better estimate of arrival times to the distribution points when we get closer to delivery of the printed games to Shanghai.

campaign.story:
From the team that brought you Control comes Campy Creatures. Players are mad scientist in need of precious Mortals for future experiments. Rather than getting your hands dirty, your army of Campy Creatures awaits to do your bidding. Capture the most valuable Mortals over the course of three nights to win. But be warned—the Mortals won’t go down without a fight.
What is Campy Creatures?
It's a ghoulish game of bluffing, deduction, and set collection for 2-5 players. Players begin each round with the same hand of creatures. Their goal is to capture valuable Mortals by outguessing their opponents. Each player has perfect information at the start so knowing what a person might do in a particular situation is key.
What’s in the box?
Five Creature Decks: 45 Poker-size Cards (9 Creatures each)
The Mortal Deck: 30 Poker-size Cards
The Clash-O-Meter (The Board) and Player Markers
5 Monstrous Meeples
The Rules
We've made a component update mid-campaign and are now including small meeples in the game! This will replace the current score-trackers and sit nicely around the board. 
      Mortal Artwork Incoming
All Mortal cards will be fully illustrated and Josh is working hard to finish them up during the campaign. Follow along on our Instagram where we share in-progress shots to see them developed out.
Who’s Campy Creatures for?
If you enjoy the thrill and tension of reading people and outwitting them in a particular situation, then Campy Creatures is for you. The heart of the game is outguessing the other players as much of the time you have perfect information as to what’s in their hand.
This would be a light-to-medium weight game. Non-gamers and casuals should be able to pick it up and have a blast within no time.  For the masters of meeples out there, we believe this could be a great starter to game night or a nice lunch-break or convention game.
The theme is playfully dark, but all content will be family-friendly. The box must say 14 and up, but we found the game has been enjoyed by kids as young as 8. 
A free companion app for iOS and Android will launch with the game to make it super portable
      Download the Print-n-Play
We firmly believe in this game, but feel free to kick the tires first. We're giving the PnP away for free for a limited time (only during the Kickstarter). We'd love to hear you thoughts if you end up playing the game. As people found with our earlier game Control, the final components will be top-notch so we believe there's still reason enough to back the game if you PnP.
  The download above includes A4 and US letter sizes along the rules in English. You can find other translations here:
German Rules Translation
Spanish Rules Translation
Dutch Rules Translation
Example Gameplay
You can download the full rules here, or watch an example of the setup for a three player game and how a round plays out.
Video notes: The Mortal illustrations will be finalized during the campaign.
      Where does Campy Creatures fit into my collection?
Campy Creatures is in a different genre than social deduction games like The Resistance or Coup. We love bidding / simultaneous-action selection games like For Sale, Libertalia, or Eggs & Empires and Campy Creatures would fall closer into their categories. It owes a lot to these games, but we believe it stands on its own as it offers a bit more of a cerebral take on a few things.
First, we wanted the game to be easily portable and affordable. Second, we wanted there to be a fun tension of doublethink present as you second-guess yourself or your opponents—there's a reason all those creature eyes are watching :) Third, we wanted the game to shine at all player counts—we found these style of games didn't accommodate two players, the two-player experience was just alright, or it required extra rules. We wanted to create a great two-player experience while keeping the gameplay unchanged. We looked at great two-player games like Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation and Brave Rats and sought to inject some of the fun found there into Campy. And lastly, we wanted a unique yet meaningful tie-breaker system. It was thanks to the forums on BGG discussing tie-breaker variants for Libertalia that birthed the idea for Campy Creatures' Clash-O-Meter—something that's integral to the game as you'll often make decisions based on your positioning.
  A Series of Tart Ales 
Campy Creatures not only plays great over beer ’n pretzels, but there will actually be a series of beer released alongside the game by Bottle Logic Brewing. This board game / beer series combo might be the first of its kind. The limited edition series will be tart ales with art from the game and each release over 2017 will feature a different creature from the game.
Campy Creatures Posters
Each poster is an 8 x 10 inch giclée prints on archival paper. In layman terms, the print is high quality—almost seeming like it's been painted—and the paper is nicely textured and able to hold the print for a very long time. Each creature has been updated with campy flavor text to give the posters a cinematic feel. If you click the image below, you'll go to a higher res version to better view the posters. 
  Josh Emrich (the game's illustrator) also has collector's edition movie-size posters available through his site.
  Retailers
We are currently not working with a distributor, but we love providing games at a 50% discount directly to friendly local game stores. Please reach out to us here with proof of being a retailer and we can get the conversation started. Minimum order starts at 5 games. 
It's Alive! – The Art
We approached Josh Emrich some months ago about illustrating and designing a creature game. Never in our wildest dreams could we have imagined what's before you today. To say we're excited about the art is a vast understatement. We believe he has captured the inspired styles and era of creature features in immense detail. Josh is a mad scientist when it comes to design and illustration—he has truly brought these creatures to life.

This will be our second game we have Kickstarted. We learned some valuable lessons with the first and are grateful to have had many happy backers. We've set up the necessary channels to make this a smooth experience for everyone. Your trust is extremely important to us. We will communicate all updates in a timely manner during the project.

We are working with Panda Games Manufacturing to make the best version of the game possible. We will be working with ShipNaked to fulfill all of the games.

updates.update_content:
Hello Creepers!
We hope everyone had a safe and fun Halloween! We saw a lot of posts sharing that Campy Creatures was an important addition to your Halloween gaming parties and get togethers! Even though we love playing Campy at any time, it’s still great to have a holiday where the game really comes to life, literally!
Wanted to let you know we are in the final 48 hours of our current Campy Creatures Kickstarter Campaign for Expansion I and 2nd Edition! Don’t miss your chance to get Expansion I with an included Conversion Kit upgrade to the Spooky Edition to get the GLOW-IN-THE-DARK box and Creature Pin (both exclusive to the Kickstarter).

Greetings fellow miscreants!
Here at Keymaster, our devious plots and mad ideas require more mortals than ever. As such, we have been in the lab cooking up some new monsters to capture those meddling kids.
Campy Creatures Expansion I provides 4 new creatures, a new mortal and a new gameplay feature, LOCATIONS. At the beginning of the game, Player's will choose the creatures with which they'd like to play. Players will collectively choose to have all matching hands or play "chaotically" where every player builds their own unique hand of creatures. Either way, a player's hand must contain a single card of each number (0-8). With the addition of a new mortal card, the Expansion also invites you to customize your game play experience with a unique mortal deck every time you play the game. Every round, or Night, you'll also play to win location cards that give you added bonuses in future Nights.

Hello Mortals!
Turns out we can use space travel to escape the grasp of the creatures here on Earth! Rockets have been fueled up and rides are now available on Kickstarter: EnjoytheGalaxy.com.
Space Park features a style reminiscent of Campy Creatures, but entirely its own as each destination feels like a space travel poster. It's our newest game where players are seeking to become the galaxy’s next great explorer. We wanted to key you in on what's we've been up to lately and yes, those Campy expansions are still in the works :)

Mortals, this has been one fun ride. All games were shipped and delivered a couple months ago and it's been so fun to see your thoughts and reviews. If for some odd reason, you haven't receive your game, please email us here if you aren't already in contact with us.

Mortals, 
One of our backers (Branden) was at the docks when the ironically named Ever Living arrived in New York. There were reports of fire raining from the sky and creatures emerging from the deep. In the midst of all the chaos, he was still able to snap a pic.

updates.update_userinfo: Creatures Sighted at Sea and GenCon Pickup
Manufacturing, Surveys, and the Lair of Fun
updates.update_content:
Howdy Mortals,
It's been too long since we've chatted. Things have been going smoothly with production so there hasn't been a lot of news to update on—which is a good thing. We recently received the mass-produced copy of the game (the version you'll be receiving) so check it out in the video below.

updates.update_userinfo: The Mortals, The Demogorgon, & The Surveys
updates.update_content:
Hello there Mortals,
Thanks for tuning in to your bi-weekly update of this ghoulish feature: Campy Creatures. Things are moving right along with the project as we recently delivered all the files to Panda. Woohoo!

We cannot believe how good you Mortals have been to us. The last couple days of the campaign were a blur of fun. Now that the project is over, the work of making this a reality has begun. Currently, we’re finalizing all the art assets in the next week so we can deliver them to Panda (our manufacturer) as we're shooting to have these games in your hands by the end of August.

campaign.story:
You've just entered your food truck into the "Truck Off: The Food Truck Frenzy" competition hoping to be crowned the Food Truck Titan. Over the next 5 days, you'll send your team of food trucks to various locations trying to score sweet parking spots at lucrative venues. The player with the most sales after five days takes home the title of Food Truck Titan.  Pick Venues, Roll Dice, Play Actions, Get Paid!
THE TRUCKS
           THE VENUES
  GAME CONTENTS
36 Chipboard Food Trucks
60 Chipboard Money Tokens
54 Action Cards
6 Venue Cards
22 Venue Modifier Cards - STRETCH GOAL #2
6 Dice (D20, D12, D10, D8, D6, D4)
1 First Player Token
1 Rulebook
  RULEBOOK || PRINT AND PLAY
HOW TO PLAY PREVIEW
 REWARDS
$1 Thank you for your support! We'll keep you informed of our shenanigans.
$6 An emailed PDF of the printed components
$19 Truck Off: The Food Truck Frenzy
$36 Truck Off: The Food Truck Frenzy x 2
$59 Truck Off: The Food Truck Frenzy AND one copy of Brewin' USA ($50 MSRP - Brewin USA shipped immediately upon funding)
$68 Truck Off: The Food Truck Frenzy x 4
$225 Retailer Discount: 20 Copies of the Game.  You must message us with proof that you're an established retailer for this reward.  (US and UK / EU only).
$400 Truck Off: The Food Truck Frenzy.  Provide a name for and artwork direction for your own custom set of food trucks.
PRESS
Beer & Board Games Video (recommended for ages 18+)
Dad's Gaming Addiction 
WDYPTW Podcast 
Card Board Hoard Review
Gaming Trend likes it!
Casual Game Revolution
If you have an article about Truck Off, please message us so we can have it featured here. We're also happy to answer any questions you have for the articles. Thanks!
SHIPPING
We came through on UK /  EU-Friendly rewards on our last project and didn't tell anybody.  Now we're confident in the process. We'll use a fulfillment company to eliminate VAT for UK and EU backers.  Each country has received the same subsidized shipping discount of $4.
STRETCH GOALS
  Venue Modifier Example. This image links to the working document.
               THE GAME 
Players have a team of food trucks matching each venue. Each round, players secretly select and reveal two venues to sell their grub.
  Players select actions to play this round, and then play them clockwise one at a time hoping to better their chances at a fat payout.
  At the end of a round, the customers are split evenly between # of trucks. Any remainder is discarded. Food trucks return to players and actions are discarded from the game.
TWO PLAYER VARIANT
 WHY KICKSTARTER?
If we reach our goal, we will be able to pay for the manufacturing and shipping of Truck Off: The Food Truck Frenzy. Manufacturing is lined up. Artwork files will be shipping to the printer shortly after the project. All that is left is the funding.  
We're still small, and we love Kickstarter because it puts us directly in contact with incredible people willing to help build something they believe in. We're engaged with the community attending events and meetups around the midwest including Gen Con four years in a row.  We feel energized by these connections and building trust within the community. We reward our supporters with discounts on the game and free flowing communication with us the creators. As a backer, you'll be a copilot and chef on this journey to create awesome games.
PAST PROJECTS
In February 2015, we raised $36,078 on Kickstarter with our first game, Brewin' USA. This game takes place at the inception of the craft beer revolution. Players auction over brewing ingredients, brew their signature line of craft beers, and compete for city and regional area control! The game has continued to grow including selling out of inventory at GenCon 2016. This project was a wonderful ride and we owe a huge thanks to our backers.  
Brewin' USA (Kickstarter)
Brewin' USA website
Brewin' USA (Amazon)
MEET THE DESIGNER
From Ryan Lambert - I started gaming when I was little, especially with my Dad. We played the standards like Monopoly, Risk, Pay Day, and Careers. Eventually, we discovered games like Catan and Agricola and the collection has gotten out of hand since then. My favorite game right now is Pandemic Legacy. It’s cliche, but the experience is just too good. A close second would be Imperial Assault or Blood Rage. 
I started designing games a couple years ago because I love to create and explore themes and mechanics. Truck Off started with theme. Food trucks are abundant in the Twin Cities and the idea of owning one has always appealed to me. After so many iterations, I love how clean the design of Truck Off ended up with a good mix of strategy and luck. It’s a great casual game that scales well for groups and I hope you have as much fun with it as I have.
MEET THE PROJECT CREATOR
Still a small outfit, Adam and Chris from Adam's Apple Games are eager to continue to grow in the gaming industry.  We're engaged in this community, and will continue to deliver awesome projects and give our commitment and energy back in return. We write our final rules in as a female lead player. Check us out from Gen Con 2016, and we're pumped to announce we'll be back at Gen Con 2017! 
MEET THE ARTIST
John Ed de Vera on Instagram
John specializes in a unique paper craft artwork style.  This means literally cutting paper and then photographing his work.  This is a super unique style that captures depth and shadows making his pieces look unbelievably real.  He is a master at his craft, hands down.
More artwork on the way soon!
 SHOW YOUR SUPPORT AVATARS
Place these in your profile picture on Kickstarter or as your profile pic on social media to showcase your support!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
"Anything that gets your blood racing is probably worth doing." This is one of those things, but making new things is also tough! This is our second campaign and we're putting our experience making happy backers to work again with this campaign. 

I will communicate along the way. You'll know if anything unexpected happens and do my best to make it right. I strive to deliver on time against project deadlines and to avoid unexpected shipping delays. Game play is solid with little to no tweaks expected. Artwork is paid for and final files are on track for completion before the end of the project.

Thanks so much for checking out our project and helping us make the "American Dream on Wheels" come to life.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Production Complete, Shipment Underway, Gen Con pickup option
updates.update_content:
Happy Monday Truck Off backers,  
The production of Truck Off: The Food Truck Frenzy was successfully completed on schedule and the shipping plans are now underway! You have until 8/05 when your shipping address is locked so please make any address changes necessary before then. 23 surveys are still outstanding and I will be reaching out via messages with a reminder. Gen Con 2017 Also around the corner is Gen Con 2017 and we’ve been busy planning to make a big splash with Truck Off.

Sorry for two updates back to back so I'm keeping this one short and sweet.  All backers at The Menu tier and above receive Print and Play files via the dropbox link below.
Truck Off PnP
Front only and Front / back PnP files are both available.  I would recommend using a thicker material for the trucks.  You can also use coins from another game to minimize cutting needed.  (Sheriff of Nottingham coins work particularly well.)

Greetings Truck Off backers,
Gears are turning in China with the production of Truck Off.  This is the time during a KS project where it feels like time stands still, but I remind myself that good quality is worth the wait.  I have a few important things to share including the project schedule, a meeting with the manufacturer, and images of the production ready prototype.

Status Update:
We're still on schedule to meet our delivery date.  Final files were shipped to the printer on 3/27.  I received low-resolution proofs a week later.  Low-res proofs are approved and a full digitally printed product sample is paid for and in production.  Once that digitally printed sample is approved, the full manufacturing will begin.  I will be finalizing shipping plans over the next month, and you will receive an address survey on 5/1 (excluding lunch & beer tier as I already have your surveys).
More Venue Artwork:

Kickstarter funds have now been processed.  I am targeting April 15th to send the KS surveys.  I will be sending early surveys today at 1:00pm CT to Lunch and a Beer backers to get their Brewin' USA games asap.

campaign.story:
Yukon Salon is a creative, fast-paced card game for 2-4 players competing to be the best stylist in the Yukon by styling hairdos for Grizzly Bears and beards for Lumberjacks.
Each client that you style rewards you with a combination of points to win the game and abilities and bonuses to help attempt riskier styles on more difficult clients.
Sway the clients into choosing your style by making outrageous, unique claims and press your luck to earn the right mix of points and rewards. 
    Benjamin from the Board Game Vault shows you how to play in under 2 minutes
       The Parks and Beauty Agency Beautician's Training Manual
The Parks and Beauty Agency Beautician's Training Manual is a 32-page booklet that details the history and selling points of every unique style in the game, providing creative jumping-off points for when you need to make up some flattery to sell your clients on the style you want them to wear. It also provides a glimpse into the absurd, cheeky world of Yukon Salon, where the Canadian government decided to subsidize the beautification of forest dwellers during the height of beauty parlours in popular culture.
My favorite thing about this stretch goal, is I get to write some of the entries in the Training Manual alongside this star-studded lineup of guest authors:
Keith Baker, creator of Phoenix Dawn Command, Gloom, Illimat, the Eberron campaign setting for D&D, and many other things.
David Malki, creator of Wondermark and co-creator of Machine of Death.
Erik Scott de Bie, author of the World of Ruin series, Shadowbane series, and Forgotten Realms designer.
Clinton J. Boomer, prolific speculative fiction author and tabletop RPG designer.
Simon Berman, former Privateer Press staff writer (Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying, WARMACHINE, HORDES)
Chris Adams, co-creator of the Yamara comic and co-designer of Oh My God! There’s An Axe In My Head and the CºNTINUUM RPG
Matthew Moore, creator of Bring your Own Book and video game designer.
Evan J. Peterson, journalist and author of the PrEP Diaries, fiction, and nonfiction works, producer and host of SHRIEK: Women of Horror Film.
Playmats
Looking for the downloadable playmat pdfs? They're available right here!
Custom Dice
To include additional sets of 2 custom dice, add the following amounts to your pledge:
2 additional dice: add $4.00 to your pledge (includes shipping)
4 additional dice: add $7.00 to your pledge (includes shipping)
6 additional dice: add $10.00 to your pledge (includes shipping)
(add $3 per additional set of 2 dice)
There will be an option in the backer survey to indicate that you ordered additional custom dice, please make sure to do this, or I won't know to send them to you!
Additional copies
If you'd like more than two copies of the game, add $15.00 per copy to your pledge.
We ♥ Friendly Local Game Stores 
This project is retailer-friendly. I’m offering the Kickstarter version of the game during the campaign to brick-and-mortar game stores. Retailer backers will receive their rewards before I release the game into distribution. Please click here to send me a private message to inquire about retail rates and verify your status as a retailer.
We will be charging shipping after the Kickstarter concludes based on the actual costs incurred to ship. We will collect this via our pledge manager, BackerKit, after the campaign ends. This is so we can be fair to all our backers as shipping is rarely one size fits all, and also give you more stretch goal rewards and any additional material you might want.
Following is a list of rough estimates for shipping a standard 6" x 4" x 1" game package (10 oz. volumetric weight). Keep in mind these are just estimates, and costs may rise based on weight increases from unlocked stretch goals and any optional buys you choose, or straight-up postal rate changes.
USA 
1 copy $6.00
2 copies: $12.00 
International
1 copy $7.50 to most countries
2 copies: $12 to most countries
Local Pickup
If you're local to the Seattle area and would like to pick up your game in person, I'll include an option for that in the backer survey so you can skip the postage! I may be able to make this an option for Portland backers as well, if there are enough.

  Welcome to the Salon! Click here to try the print-and-play version for free.
  David Fooden — Game Designer/Art Director
David is a game designer and artist living in Seattle, WA. He began working on tabletop games in the 90's, illustrating role-playing games and card games for White Wolf Games, AEG, Wizards of the Coast, and many others. David co-authored CºNTINUUM: roleplaying in the Yet and The Chi-Chian Roleplaying Game. More recently, he co-designed Oh My God! There's An Axe In My Head. The Game of International Diplomacy, was a developer on Machine of Death: The Game of Creative Assassination and has developed games for mass-market audiences.
Robert Tritthardt — Illustrator
Robert is an illustrator and webcomic artist in Seattle, WA. He creates two weekly webcomics, Writhe and Shine and Overcast With A Chance Of DOOM! and is an accomplished illustrator. Prints and originals of his beautifully rendered bear illustrations in Yukon Salon are available directly from Robert in his online store. If you enjoy his comics and artwork, please consider supporting his Patreon.
Simon Berman — Kickstarter Consultant
Simon has successfully managed seven Kickstarter projects for both Privateer Press and Strix Publishing. His experience and advice are invaluable to keep this project on track.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I ran a Kickstarter project for the game Oh My God! There's An Axe In My Head (as Game Company No. 3) and successfully delivered it despite encountering delays and unexpected production issues during manufacturing. Because of that experience I've already secured printing with AdMagic and fulfillment through Card Kingdom in advance of launching Yukon Salon. In addition, I'll be using BackerKit to help ensure organized fulfillment post-campaign.

I've also enlisted Simon Berman as a consultant on this project. Simon has successfully managed seven Kickstarter projects. His experience and advice are invaluable and help keep me on track.

That said, it’s not impossible that I'll run into issues. Most of the game is already print-ready but I could always hit the regular types of delays that occur across all types of Kickstarter projects; getting the printing process right, making sure the cards and packaging are up to my standards, etc. In the event of any issues I will strive to be as transparent as possible and keep backers up to date as things develop.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
