updates.update_userinfo: The Yukon Salon is Open for Business!
updates.update_content: It's been a long trek, and we might have gotten here sooner if we'd just used sled dogs, but Yukon Salon was finally delivered to our loading dock a short while ago!

We're all getting used to disappointment this winter, whenever shipping is involved. The good news is that there has been progress; Yukon Salon was loaded on a train on Friday, and is crossing the country from Los Angeles to Chicago. The updated ETA is this coming Friday, February 26th. I think the odds are good that it won't actually be here until the following week, but we are getting close enough that it's prepping the salon to open for business at last.

updates.update_userinfo: The Winter of Our Shipping Discontent
updates.update_content:
I woke up here in Duluth to wind chills of -25º F. I can see why bears like to spend this season asleep under a warm natural blanket of some kind. But while I warm myself with a cup of bitter coffee, I thought I'd give everyone an update on things out in that chilly world.
I am happy to report that Yukon Salon is in fact on the ocean. It's a relatively small shipment -- a less-than-container load -- which is actually a good thing in the screwed up state of shipping right now. It was loaded on a container ship named EVER LAMBENT, which departed from the port of Ningbo, China, on January 18th. The EVER LAMBENT is due to arrive at the port of Los Angeles on January 31st. If everything goes according to schedule, the load will finally be at our warehouse on February 17th.

Howdy all! It's winter, which is a busy time in the north woods for a lumberjack. Now is the time that we (or our teams of oxen/horses) can easily haul logs on a sledge across the frozen bogs, to a convenient river where nature can wash them down to the mill by Lake Superior come spring.
Between chopping down old growth white and red pines, we heard the cries of backers asking, "What about those playmats? Will we get downloadable playmats?" While we had not promised to take that commitment on, heck, it's a festive giving time of year, and we'd hate to disappoint you, so we went ahead and did it. There is now a   on the Atlas Games website, and it includes in the right-hand column a link for the downloadable , free to any and all. Enjoy!

Hi, all! Just a quick note to let you know that Yukon Salon has been proofread, finalized, and delivered to our manufacturer for printing and assembly. We'll let you know when mass production has wrapped up and we have a better idea of our shipping transit time -- but for now, take a look at what's being created!
Here's the press sheet. Huge cardstock sheets of this design will be printed, then the cards will be cut out, stacked, and packed in the game's tin alongside the dice. In our last update, a few backers asked if the game's rules have changed. The answer is no; design tweaks on the cards make them easier to read and understand but do not change the rules of the game.

updates.update_userinfo: An Update from Atlas Games: Yukon Salon Heads to Proofreading
updates.update_content:
Currently, Yukon Salon is in proofreading, which is a critical step before it can head to press. 
Over the past weeks, a few subtle design tweaks have been made to increase card legibility and rules clarity. To do so, some icons were removed and font weight was standardized on card effects. The overall layout hasn't changed much, but these small details are what our game producers focus on to make each game as intuitive and playable as possible. Take a peek to see what we mean:

updates.update_userinfo: An Update from Atlas Games: Yukon Salon is in Production!
updates.update_content: This is a quick update to let you know that Yukon Salon is officially in pre-press production! Since our last update, we have evaluated David's in-progress files and made a plan going forward. Kyla, one of Atlas Games' board and card game producers, is already working on the layout files. When they're ready, we'll send them to our manufacturer for printing and assembly.

Fellow Bears and Lumberjacks,
If you’re anything like us, after months in semi-isolation growing quarantine beards and long, shaggy mats of hair, you really could use a trip to the salon for a trim and styling. We’ve decided we need to do our part to make that happen and ensure the Yukon Salon opens for business!

Hey everyone, sorry for the long silence. The game is still happening. I expect to have everything to the printer by the end of the month and a print window and ship date ready to announce by then. Thank you for bearing with me, I appreciate your patience.

Hey everyone, just a quick update. Sorry to take so long between communications, I know a few of you have expressed concerns. I apologize for distressing you.
I'm still here and the game is still coming out, but I'm pushing back the release to November. I dropped out of touch for a little while, dealing with some depression, anxiety, and a couple of personal setbacks. Some folks are better at discussing this stuff publicly, I'm not so comfortable doing that.

project_data.project_name: Yukon Salon: A Beary Hairy Game

campaign.story:
WELCOME TO TORTUGA!
The year is 1667 and you are a pirate sailing the waters of the Caribbean. A Spanish Galleon floats nearby, and you’ve talked your crewmates into working together to steal all of its treasure. What you haven’t told your fellow pirates is that you have no intentions on sharing the treasure once you have it. Your crewmates have told you that they share your loyalty and that they’ll help you maroon the greedy pirates on your ship to the rocky island of Tortuga. But you’ve seen your friends’ loaded pistols and heard their whisperings of a mutiny. You know that nobody can be trusted.
For 2-9 Players. 20-40 minutes. Ages 12+.
  GAME CONTENTS
1 Faux book container
1 Rulebook (includes character biographies)
64 Cards (9 Brethren of the Coast, 16 Event, 30 Vote, 9 Loyalty)
1 Rubber playing mat
1 Burlap pouch
9 Wooden pawns
8 Wooden treasure chests
THE GAME
The game is packaged in a faux book box. The box has 3 magnets to keep it closed when you're moving it to and from game night.
  The game fits nicely inside the faux book box. The box is big enough for cards to be sleeved, if desired.
  The game board is a rubber playmat. The board rolls up like a map.
  The 8 wooden treasure pieces come in a burlap bag.
  Each of the 9 wooden pawns matches with 1 of the 9 pirates you can be in the game. Each pirate is based on a real pirate who roamed Tortuga and the Caribbean seas in the year 1667.
     Each player has a secret loyalty: British, Dutch, or French. But be careful who you trust; someone claiming to share your loyalty may stab you in the back and steal your hard-earned treasure.
  Use Event cards during the game to help your team get treasure, or to maroon members of the opposite team to the island of Tortuga.
  Use Vote cards during the game to secretly impact Attacks against the Spanish, Mutinies against your Captain, and Brawls against your fellow pirates.
REWARDS
We're not big into confusing reward levels or expensive add-ons. We want each of our backers to get the best reward we can offer: this beautiful game! We splurged on a few items that we felt really added to the game quality (the rubber playmat, faux book, burlap bag, wooden treasures), while still keeping the overall costs low and eliminating unnecessary pieces. We're proud to give our Kickstarter backers the best price that this game will ever see.
$1-$9 Thank you for your support!
$10 An emailed PDF of the cards & board, ready for printing
$23 Tortuga 1667 
$44 Tortuga 1667 x2 
$63 Tortuga 1667 x3 
$80 Tortuga 1667 x4 
$100 "Make 100" Kickstarter special. Includes Tortuga 1667 x2, plus our illustrator will turn any person you'd like (perhaps you or a friend) into a pirate. We'll send you 2 custom "Brethren of the Coast" cards of this pirate that you can use interchangeably in the game. 
$150+ Tortuga 1667 x4 + Special Mention in the back of the rulebook + Print and Play version of the game. Thank you for your extra support! 
$175 Tortuga 1667 x10
$250 Retailer Discount: 20 Copies of the Game. You must message us with proof that you're an established retailer of some kind for this reward. (Only available in the US, UK, & EU)
Shipping: We are using fulfillment companies around the world to make shipping costs as cheap as possible for our backers. For our European and UK backers we will be shipping from within the EU so that you do not have to pay any customs charges. 
TESTIMONIALS
I don’t trust my friends anymore. But I love this game. -Tessa
Tortuga is a game full of surprises! Each round brings with it new and intriguing events that ultimately make you the master of the sea or scum of Tortuga. It all depends on how proficient you are at finding your team and making that knowledge count. -Alex R.
I have played this game basically every week for the last couple of months. I have loved it every single time and never been bored. It’s a great game to play with friends and really makes you think. -Abigail S
I love this game!!! No game is ever the same, and it's always exciting. You never know who is going to do what or if you are trusting the right person. Everyone I have introduced to this game has loved it too. -Alex W.
Tortuga is a great social deduction game and it looks great on your game shelf too! Love the game even though sometimes it makes me question my friends and family. -Brett A.
A game where I can deceive and be called Captain is a very good game indeed." -Derek H.
Tortuga is unique in the fact that it allows the perfect amount of deception for those that enjoy tricking and deceiving others, but it also provides the opportunity to work off of pure logic and reason for the other players that do not particularly excel in manipulation. I have had the opportunity of playing this game numerous times with many different crowds, and every game is completely different because of the different strategies and techniques that people can utilize. -Levi H.
PRESS
Dice Tower News: http://www.dicetowernews.com/facade-games-welcomes-you-to-tortuga-1667-on-kickstarter/35996
Geek & Sundry: http://geekandsundry.com/tortuga-1667-kickstarter-brings-treacherous-pirates-to-tabletop-gaming/
Cwowd.com (French): http://www.cwowd.com/tortuga-cap-sur-bonne-esperance/
Beasts of War: http://www.beastsofwar.com/tortuga-1667/command-ship-secure-treasure-tortuga-1667-ks/ 
Viva Veltoro: http://www.vivaveltoro.com/2017/02/tortuga-1667-pirate-game.html
Tabletop Gaming: https://www.tabletopgaming.co.uk/board-games/news/tortuga-1667-is-a-gorgeous-social-deception-game-with-pirates 
DDO Players: http://ddoplayers.com/2017/01/22/tortuga-1667-a-pirate-game-on-kickstarter/
Club Fantasci: http://www.clubfantasci.com/kickstarter-week-tortuga-1667/
Board Game Stories: http://boardgamestories.com/news/party/no-pirate-trusted-tortuga-1667/
If you have an article about Tortuga 1667 or this project, please message us so we can have it featured here. We're also happy to answer any questions you have for the articles. Thanks!
RULES OVERVIEW
PLAY

  Note: The video above gives a brief overview of the gameplay and rules. Complete rules, including tips & tricks, rule clarifications, advanced optional rules, event card descriptions, and character biographies are not shown in the video, but are all included in the game rulebook. If you'd like to look at the complete rules now please visit the links below: 
English 
French
German
Spanish 
Dutch
Italian
Portuguese
Hungarian
Turkish
Play the game as 1 of these 9 actual pirates from history. Biographies of each pirate are in the back of the rulebook.
  Each player has a secret loyalty card. This is your team. Part of the game is deciphering who is your teammate and who is your enemy.
  The Tortuga playing board. Teams win if they have the most treasure in their team's treasure holds when the Spanish Armada card is revealed.
  Players choose to perform one action on their turn. One potential action is to reveal one of five available Event cards.
  Be careful about which Event cards you reveal! Some may maroon you or your teammates to Tortuga.
  If you reveal one of the three treasure maps, you must give it to someone you trust. If you reveal the Spanish Armada, the game is over.
  During the game, Captains can call for Attacks, First Mates can call for Mutinies, and the Governor of Tortuga can call for Brawls. When one of these votes is called for, use your Vote cards to secretly cast your vote!
  Depending on the player count, you'll need to rely more heavily on certain skills to win the game. We love the flexibility and variability of Tortuga 1667 based on the player count!
TORTUGA CREATION PROCESS
A great game (in our opinion), needs three things: solid mechanics, an awesome theme, and beautiful design.
1. Mechanics
Tortuga is all about the interactions you have with the other players. In some cases, such as when you and your shipmates are attacking the Spanish Galleon, you need to rely on your enemies in order to succeed. In the very next turn, however, your shipmates might stab you in the back with a mutiny in order to keep all the treasure for themselves.
Since nobody holds a "hand" of cards, this game is also about knowledge and communication regarding the community Event cards. Unless you are in desperation mode, it is not wise to reveal Event cards at random. Almost half of the Event cards can hurt your team drastically. It's often in your best interest to use an action to view the cards first, or to rely on the knowledge of a trusted ally. Knowing where harmful Event cards are located allows you to force an enemy to reveal those cards and suffer the consequences. The most successful players are the ones who are able to discern who is on their team and then share vital information with them at opportune moments.
Vote cards also play a key role in the game. Each Vote card has three sections - one each for Attacks, Mutinies, and Brawls. Players must put themselves in the best position to use their Vote cards, since their hand of Vote cards may not always be ideal based on their pawn location. For example, sometimes it may be worth putting in Water, causing an attack to fail, in order to save a Crossbones card for when you want to Mutiny against your captain.
A game in progress.
  2. Theme
Tortuga, a small island off of Haiti, was an important pirate settlement and hideout during the golden age of piracy. British, French, and Dutch pirates lived together on the island in a loose alliance and formed a pirate government known as “The Brethren of the Coast.” Rich from its support of piracy and protected by the Brethren, Tortuga was full of taverns, gambling houses, and prostitutes.
The French and British governments, in an attempt to weaken the mighty Spanish, would often legalize piracy by giving pirates letters of marque. These gave pirates permission to unofficially plunder Spanish ships and towns. Many of the pirates on Tortuga chose the privateering life over full-blown piracy, which was illegal. Loyalty to country was fleeting, though, and pirates often walked the line between patriotism and rebellion.
Tortuga 1667 aims to capture the atmosphere of these loose alliances and shifting political loyalties.
All parts of the game were designed to bring the players into the canvas, wooden planks, and golden treasure world of the 1667 pirates!
3. Design
The illustrations from Sarah Keele and graphic design from Holly Hancock take players deep into the world of privateers and pirate life. We used textures consistent to what pirates would see on an everyday basis: wooden planks and tables, canvas sails, and weather-torn maps.
All pieces of the game were carefully chosen for their color and aesthetic contributions to the theme. The burlap bag conjures images of a pirate's bag of possessions. Many of the cards use a canvas background like the sails on a ship. The playmat rolls out and looks just like an old treasure map. The faux book is worn and colored a piratey brown, dark maroon, and black.
Some of Sarah's initial sketches and process for creating the beautiful illustrations in the game.
STRETCH GOALS
Because we've reached the following milestones, we will be adding 8 "game-changer" cards to every copy of the game! When setting up, players will add 3 of these game-changers into the Event deck. These cards have the potential to turn the tide in your team's favor! Cards will now also all be given a high-quality linen finish, 2 and 3-player setup rules will be added to the rulebook, a "Captain's Helm" illustration will be added to the blank Mutiny sections on the Vote cards, 2 "double-vote" Vote cards will be added to each copy of the game, a wooden explosion token will be added to each copy of the game, Brethren of the Coast cards will have player action lists on the back of them, the Treasure map will include a compass rose and map legend, and we're adding a Quick-Start/Certified First Edition card to every copy of the game!
  WHY KICKSTARTER?
If we reach our goal, we will be able to pay for the manufacturing and shipping of the first edition of Tortuga 1667. We already have our manufacturers lined up and ready to go! As you can see from our photos, samples of the game have already been produced and designs are complete. We just need to raise the funds and say go!
We fell in love with the Kickstarter community when we launched our last game, Salem. The feedback, support, trust, and positivity from the community was incredible. We're proud to reward our Kickstarter backers with discounts on the game, first-in-line knowledge and insight into the project, and a direct line of communication to us as the creators. We consider each Kickstarter backer to be a close ally in our game-making endeavors.
THE DARK CITIES SERIES
Tortuga 1667 is Volume 1 in Facade Games' Dark Cities Series! Each game in the series will:
Be packaged in a faux book. 
Focus on a particular city and year. 
Include a dark, mysterious, or deceptive element in its gameplay. 
Accommodate at least 4-9 players. 
We know your game closet is a mess. Start your bookshelf collection of games with Dark Cities Volume 1: Tortuga 1667!
PAST PROJECTS
In April 2015 we raised $103,000 on Kickstarter with our first game, Salem. This game takes players into the dark world of the Salem Witch Trials. Players must hunt down the witches before becoming one! The game has now sold over 10,000 copies and is played around the world. 

We are extremely proud to have delivered Salem on time to our backers! Here's what one of our backers had to say: 

I have backed over 46 projects and I just wanted to say this project has been an absolute delight to have been a backer for. Your updates have been insightful, but not overbearing. You clearly put a lot of time, thought, and effort into this game and it really shows. I was impressed with how fast this project came together. It was a fast, well organized campaign. Kudos to you and thank you for a wonderful end product. I couldn't be happier. -Snuffles00

Salem's Kickstarter Page
Salem's Store Page
Salem's Amazon Page (check out the reviews!)

We've made Salem available as an "Add-on" reward for this Kickstarter campaign. If you add $25 to your pledge, we'll send you Salem inside the Tortuga 1667 package sent out in August. See the FAQ section for details. 

THE CREATORS
Game creation and graphic design is by Facade Games, owned and operated by Travis and Holly Hancock. Learn more at www.facadegames.com, or follow us on facebook, instagram, or twitter.
Illustrations were drawn by Sarah Keele. Follow her beautiful artwork on instagram.
A huge thank you to the hundreds of hours put in by our many play-testers!

Risks and challenges
We will do everything in our power to achieve on-time delivery, and we will reach out concerning any unforeseen circumstances. Currently our manufacturers are lined up and just waiting for the green light once we are funded. Our first project, Salem, was delivered on time to backers as promised. Please never hesitate to message us directly with comments, concerns, or suggestions.

Thank you for making this exciting project possible!

support.title: GUILDER
support.descp:
Immediately after the campaign ends, you will be sent a token of my appreciation, in the form of a heavy ceramic poker chip. One side says Honor Among Thieves, the other says No Honor Among Thieves.
To add the Guilder to another pledge level, increase your pledge by $4 and let me know that you want one. Every Guilder after the first is $3.
Shipping is included in the pledge.

support.title: GALLERY
support.descp:
Get a digital art book with illustrations from the cards and other game components.
Like the Guilder, this pledge can be added to another pledge by increasing your pledge level by $9. Alternatively, you can increase your pledge by $15 to get every add-on currently in the campaign--the Guilder, the Action Coin, and the Gallery, as well as an exclusive card called The Sponsor (note: The Sponsor is all but useless in actual gameplay). See the section on add-ons just above shipping information in the main page for more details, in the section labeled "The Wealthy Sponsor Pack."

support.title: SCHEMER
support.descp:

$12 in shipping is included in the value of the pledge, which means that shipping to North America and the EU has no extra charge.
Shipping to the rest of the world is an additional $10 (for a total cost of $55). This is taking into account the $12 in included shipping that the US and EU pledges have.
The game is expected to have a final MSRP of $49.

support.title: BROKER
support.descp:

Do not pledge at this level if you are not a retailer or distributor. Message me if you have any questions or concerns.

campaign.story:
Far away in the middle of somewhere lies a small collection of beautiful tropical islands filled with unusual plants and even more unusual creatures. The locals of the islands, fearless themselves, have learned how to use different combinations of local ingredients to transform the island's animals into delightfully scary monsters. Though harmless, the monsters are used by the natives to keep the outside world afraid and away from their tiny island paradise.   
As tradition dictates, the natives compete to capture the best creatures, feed them the right foods, and win scare competitions to determine who can earn the job of Island Protector. Can you and your fellow players take on the role of island natives and raise the scariest creatures?
Welcome to the Isle of Monsters!
    Limited Edition backers will get a hand-numbered sticker included with their game. Only 500 copies will have the Platinum Level Backer Sticker, so back now! 
Early delivery to your door! Backers will get this game several weeks in advance of the release date, or even earlier! 
Savings! We expect the game to retail for around $30 or more, so you're getting the game at a discount off of the retail price.
Cheap Shipping! We're subsidizing the shipping for all of you so shipping is extremely affordable.
Great stretch rewards, including improved components and stickers for the food tokens!
                                        Mayday is offering Limited Edition stickers to Platinum and Early Monster level backers. Be one of the first 500 backers to back Isle of Monsters at Early Monster or Platinum level and get a hand numbered Platinum sticker with your game!  
These stickers come separately with your game so YOU can choose what to do with it. Inside of your box? Sure! On your box so your gamer friends know you supported this game on Kickstarter? Why not?!  
As copies disappear, additional levels will open up; including gold, silver, and copper at 500 copies each. Once all of those are gone, too, the unlimited copies won't come with any limited edition stickers.
                Click here for the PDF of the Isle of Monsters rulebook. 
                                                          Note: Isle of Monsters as designed is a well-rounded game with little room for crazy stretch rewards. To that end, we're keepin' the bonuses straightforward for this campaign.
 We're also featured In the Casual Game Crowdfunding Roundup!
  Shipping is calculated based on your country, so please pledge and enter the country you want your rewards delivered to.
   Zone 1: $4 shipping. USA, China, Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore, Taiwan
Zone 2: $6 shipping. Canada, EU 
Zone 3: $8 shipping. Rest of the World  
The game is lightweight and durable so the game will fit easily into a bubble mailer. We are also shipping all the rewards outside of the USA directly from our fulfillment warehouse in China to you. That means the rewards will get shipped quickly and efficiently.
Note that shipping will be from the USA for all US backers and all other rewards will ship directly from our fulfillment warehouse in China. We will state the direct manufacturing replacement cost on the customs form for all non-USA shipments, which means that even on a 2-pack shipment that your reward will fall well below the VAT/CUSTOMS/DUTY thresholds for you.  
We've fulfilled several other projects in this same manner and our backers have happily had no issues getting their rewards duty-free due to the low cost of our games.  
Shipping policy for incorrect addresses  
If your address is incorrect when we ship to you due to you moving and not updating your address, we can re-ship to you, but you'll need to pay the shipping balance (and only the shipping balance) again. We'll be sure to give everyone plenty of notice before we start shipping and locking down Pledge Manager entries.
Will my shipment be traceable? I want a tracking number when it ships.  
No, your shipment will not be traceable, it will show up as a first class package through your post office and those do NOT have tracking numbers. We can say that your reward will arrive in 7-30 business days after it ships. We can send you a screen shot of the shipping notice and confirm that it went out if it doesn't show up, but there is no tracking number. That is how we are able to offer such low shipping rates. 
If you want a tracking number, you can pay a little extra on your shipping service to get a tracking number. Here are the rates: 
Tracking Number Add On: 
Zone 1 (See countries above): +$1 more 
Zone 2: +$1 more 
Zone 3: +$2 more 
I want my game shipped in a box instead of a bubble mailer. 
We're quoting very cheap shipping because of the weight, and this specific game comes in a nice sturdy box. It's tough and we expect it will be able to handle the rough ride through the mail. Shipping the game in a box will add about 150 grams and another $0.30-0.60 in packaging to the cost of your shipment.
If you want your reward to ship in a box rather than a bubble mailer, here are the rates: 
Shipping Box Add On: 
Zone 1 (See countries above): +$2 more 
Zone 2: +$3 more 
Zone 3: +$4 more 
I want both a tracking number and a box for my shipment. 
No problem, just add both the costs for the shipping box and the tracking number. The totals to add on are: 
Zone 1: $3 more 
Zone 2: $4 more 
Zone 3: $6 more
  We've had a lot of previous successful Kickstarter projects in the past. You'd think by now that we'd be set and not need to run such a project any more, right? Well, not so much. While Mayday has been successful, we're still very small with our cash is tied up in other projects. In fact, if you look at Mayday's early publishing history, we introduced just three new games in 2010 and 2011 before we discovered Kickstarter.  
Since utilizing Kickstarter, we've launched over 30 new games, and that is ALL thanks to backers like you. By using Kickstarter, we're able to gauge interest and get the game made in much larger quantities and with cheaper prices to our customers. This is a large part of why we were able to offer our last few projects at such a low price point. With this much stuff in the game and such a small company, this would only be possible with the support of the Kickstarter community.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 32nd project, and it doesn't have any risks to speak of if we meet our goal. The factory is ready to publish and the art and layout has been completed. Any additionally needed changes should be completed prior to the end of the campaign. We have launched 25+ prior Kickstarter projects.

Anyone missing anything at all from any prior project please send us a message here on Kickstarter and we'll get you replacements sent immediately. We've had over 34,000 backers, so we expect a few of you may have slipped through the cracks. Thanks again for all of the support!

We have a few partially undelivered KS projects at present, but we expect to have this one delivered on time. We're putting extra time into our forecast for delivery to ensure this project will NOT be delayed beyond the estimated delivery date.

For a list of prior campaigns please check here:

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bkBCeeQtxuCHymJ3-L1Bu9L26i_TqGQnNILzAe9Uafk/edit#gid=0

For a current list of the status of all our projects that are not fully fulfilled yet jump over to here:

https://www.maydaygames.com/pages/kickstarter
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: HIDE (Hidden Identity Dice Espionage) is LIVE on Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Being a spy for The Agency isn't all glitzy gadgets and huge paydays. You need to select your missions carefully, go undercover while trying to ferret out the competition's disguises, and if necessary, be the last one standing with the briefcase of secrets from your target at the end of the day.  
Mayday Games' latest project, the hidden identity deduction dice game HIDE (Hidden Identity Dice Espionage), puts you into the shoes of an agent for The Agency vying to either become the Legendary Agent or the richest at the end of the game by completing missions and eliminating the competition.

campaign.story:
For a simplified breakdown of the pledges, click here!
THE WALKING DEAD: NO SANCTUARY—designed by the award-winning team of Adam and Brady Sadler—is the game fans of The Walking Dead have been waiting for! Cryptozoic is proud to introduce this intense new 1-4 board game based on the hit AMC TV show. The game redefines the survival horror genre with gameplay that emulates the group dynamics from the series, as one player takes on the reins of Leadership and the other players can decide whether or not to support his or her choices. With stunningly detailed miniatures, get ready to play as your favorite characters like Rick Grimes, Glenn Rhee, Andrea Harrison, and—of course—Daryl Dixon.  The Walking Dead © 2016 AMC Film Holdings, LLC. All Rights Reserved.
UPCOMING STRETCH GOAL
REVIEWS
        REWARDS
All art and sculpts are not final and subject to change for final approval.
      STRETCH GOALS
                      SOCIAL STRETCH GOALS
Road to the Farm - 10 Crawler Walkers: Undead that are impossible to hit at range. - Survivor Tier and Above (COMPLETED!)
Road to the Prison - A Vision of Lori: A new non-playable sculpt of Lori’s ghost that shows up randomly to cause havoc. - No Sanctuary Tier and Above (COMPLETED!)
Road to Woodbury - The Governor: a Survivor Deck, Sculpt, and Survivor Board that make The Governor a playable character. - No Sanctuary Tier and Above (COMPLETED!)
MADE TO SUFFER  - Exclusive "Made to Suffer" scenario which includes 4 map tiles, 10 event cards, 1 Governor Nemesis Board, and 1 Woodbury Rival Board (COMPLETED!)
Congrats on unlocking all Social Stretch Goals! Let's continue spreading the word by sharing this link to make our group stronger and our stretch goals many! https://www.facebook.com/cryptozoic/posts/1249432728402501
   Gameplay
This isn’t your typical survival horror game in which you attempt to eliminate each other and take out as many of the undead as possible. In THE WALKING DEAD: NO SANCTUARY, you have to work together to win. One player becomes the Leader and tries to get the others to follow his or her Approach. If the other players defy their Leader, Trust falters and Stress builds. This can result in a new Leader taking over and in Group Tension, which can reduce Morale. If Group Morale hits zero, you all lose. Likewise, if one of the survivors dies, the entire team loses. In other words, you better find a way to work as a team!

PLAY

In the game, each player picks one of four Survivors, each of whom comes with unique character boards and card decks, allowing him or her to perform abilities that directly reflect the character’s attributes on the show. Players must cooperate with their teammates to overcome six different Scenarios, which draw from the show’s storylines and consist of several objectives each.
  The endlessly riveting gameplay will take you right into the world of The Walking Dead, as you experience all the horror, action, and drama of the TV show!
Check out our Rules Primer here!
Check out details on Solo Play!
Tyreese (not final and subject to approval)

The miniatures in the game are 35mm and utilize a 95-degree PVC process, making them sturdy and highly detailed, yet not brittle. With our painstaking attention to detail on the sculpts, you can be sure the minis will resemble their counterparts from the TV show.
Daryl, Rick, Andrea, and Glenn

The base game includes stunning figures for the four playable characters—Rick, Glenn, Andrea, and Daryl—as well as for the different Walkers and other antagonists. Each expansion will come with an additional four playable characters, as well as more Walkers and miscellaneous other figures.
REVIEWS
   ROLLING DICE Podcast: Listen to it here!
      WHY KICKSTARTER?   
Two words: fans first. That’s Cryptozoic’s motto and it’s exactly why this project is on Kickstarter. During (and after) the campaign, the fans get the chance tell us what they like and don’t like. The end result? A better game. And the more support we get from everyone out there, the more amazing stuff we can add to the Kickstarter versions of the game. Get ready for some EXCLUSIVES that are so awesome they may reanimate the dead!
Check out the different tiers and add-ons and get the version of the game you want.  
SHIPPING  
We’re proud to announce that Shipwire will be our fulfillment partner for The Walking Dead: No Sanctuary. Shipwire is an Ingram Micro Company with over $50 billion in annual revenue that partners with over 20,000 companies and utilizes 132 distribution centers worldwide. They have a proven track record that makes us confident that you’ll get your games, stretch goals, and add-ons as fast as humanly possible.
Their global network of warehouses are conveniently located in the United States, Canada, Europe, and Asia. Because of this global footprint, the first copy of the game and the last copy will all be delivered in the same 30-day window, no matter the size of the package for your order.*
*Some countries in South America and Africa may fall outside this window, but they will still receive a timely delivery.
Everything will be delivered to you in consistent and highly secure packaging, ensuring your game arrives in the same condition it was first shipped. In the very rare case that something does arrive to you with a problem, getting answers and replacements will be straightforward and easy. There will be a single customer service source for all backers without any mixed messaging or confusion.
We have saved the best for last: Everyone will receive a tracking number. When your game is ready for delivery you will receive at least two emails. The first will have your tracking number and a notification that your order is being prepared. The second email will arrive shortly thereafter and will let you know that your package has left the closest Shipwire warehouse and is headed directly to you.
All of this boils down to one thing: The Walking Dead: No Sanctuary backers will get their games before it is sold at retail!
Shipping will be charged after the Kickstarter campaign ends through our Pledge Manager. The amount charged will be based on the ACTUAL cost required to ship you your games, stretch goals, and add-ons. Depending on where you live, we’ll either ship from the EU, Asia, Australia (Australia and New Zealand backers), or here in the States (backers in the U.S.A. and the rest of the world).
To give you a sense of shipping costs, it will likely cost around $10 to ship to the U.S., $15 to Australia, $15-$25 to the EU and Canada, and $50 to South America and certain parts of Asia. Please remember: These are rough ESTIMATES, so the cost of shipping may be higher or lower depending on the stretch goals unlocked, the tiers you specify, the add-ons you select, and other choices you make.  
You have our guarantee that we will do everything to get you all your rewards as quickly as possible and before it hits retail. The most exciting part of backing the game on Kickstarter is that you’re going to get a special version of the game at a special price, with exclusive items you can’t get anywhere else!  

This game is AUS, CAN, and EU friendly. If for some reason your courier charges you VAT fees, we will reimburse you. However, we are not responsible for taxes incurred in other countries outside of the EU (including but not limited to Brazil).
AVATARS
Proudly show off you're a backer for The Walking Dead: No Sanctuary with one of our custom Kickstarter Avatars. Grab yours here:
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/wrixibs0ylt12wf/AACl97R5SmrTb-C3Se8uJpGsa?dl=0
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The estimated delivery date of THE WALKING DEAD: NO SANCTUARY is July 2017. But as fans of The Walking Dead already know, life is filled with unexpected challenges. So, there’s always the chance there could be a delay during production and shipping due to various factors: manufacturing issues, walker-infested shipping freighters, strange viruses that bring the dead back to life. At Cryptozoic, we are committed to giving you a gaming experience you’ll never forget and we won’t deliver the game until we have reached that high standard. If there are any delays, we’ll let you know right away.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Last call for missing orders and incomplete Pledge Manager
updates.update_content:
Survivors,
We hope you are enjoying your copies of THE WALKING DEAD: NO SANCTUARY! Please note that after the END OF JUNE, we will not be able to guarantee fulfillment of any full rewards offered during the Kickstarter campaign, including the game, expansions, and other add-ons. The reason: We will no longer have rewards at our shipping hubs to send out to backers. So, if you never completed your Pledge Manager or are missing something from your order, reach out to us at Kickstarter@cryptozoic.com right away . . . before it’s too late!

Survivors,
We’re happy that most of you are enjoying your copies of THE WALKING DEAD: NO SANCTUARY. We’ve been AMAZED by some of the painted miniatures we’ve seen, so we thought we’d take a moment to highlight some of our favorites.

updates.update_userinfo: Wave 2 of shipping begins! And announcing CULT!
updates.update_content:
Survivors,
The first wave of shipping for backers of THE WALKING DEAD: NO SANCTUARY has concluded. If you completed your order on time on the Pledge Manager, you should have received your rewards. If you haven’t received your order or have any missing/broken items, please reach out to us at Kickstarter@cryptozoic.com and we’ll send your replacement items as quickly as possible.

updates.update_userinfo: Components FAQ and first wave of shipping nearing completion
updates.update_content:
Survivors,
We’re approaching the end of the first wave of shipping for backers all around the world. This includes everyone who completed their order on time on Pledge Manager. The second wave of shipping, when it commences, will largely be for backers who did not complete their orders on Pledge Manager or gave us incorrect shipping information.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping continues and getting replacement items
updates.update_content:
Survivors,
Shipping continues for backers all over the world. If you haven’t received your rewards yet, they should be coming soon! A quick note on split shipments: Only backers in the first wave of EU/UK shipments should have experienced cases in which the main game and add-ons were shipped separately from the expansions. If you are outside of that region and are missing expansions (or the main game/add-ons), please contact us. See below for instructions.

Survivors,
More shipping news for THE WALKING DEAD: NO SANCTUARY: Orders from the hubs in Canada and Hong Kong (backers in Asia) are starting to go out! Shipwire’s Australia hub (Australia and New Zealand backers) will start sending out rewards early next week.
US, UK, and EU backers: There was a slight slowdown as we made sure expansions would be shipped with the games and add-ons, rather than separately. More of you should begin receiving your rewards imminently. If you got a tracking number but have not received anything yet, your order is being consolidated so you do not receive your expansions separately. You will be getting an updated tracking number shortly. If you have received everything but your expansions, expect a second shipment soon.

Survivors,
Happy Friday! Shipments of THE WALKING DEAD: NO SANCTUARY have started going out to backers in the US, UK, and EU. Some of these first shipments have been broken up into two parts by the warehouse. The first shipment will have your main order and add-ons and the second one will have your two expansions (if they were part of your pledge). So, if you’ve already received your copy of the game and thought the expansions were missing, don’t worry: Your expansions are at Shipwire’s warehouse and will be on their way very soon! There will be no added charge to you for any split shipments.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping out! It’s time to take on The Walking Dead!
updates.update_content:
Survivors,
Are you ready for THE WALKING DEAD: NO SANCTUARY? Rewards have arrived at the hubs in the US and UK! Shipwire will begin sending them out later this week to US, UK, and EU backers.
Backers in Canada, Asia, Australia, and New Zealand: Your rewards will start going out next week!

Hello Survivors,
Happy New Year! We're excited to report that before the end of 2017, rewards for THE WALKING DEAD: NO SANCTUARY set sail from the factory and headed to various Shipwire hubs: US, UK (backers in UK/EU), Canada, Hong Kong (backers in Asia), and Australia (backers in Australia and New Zealand). We expect them to start arriving at the hubs within a week and then the games should start going out a week or so after that, starting with the US in the second half of January.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping update for Canada, Asia, and Australia/NZ
updates.update_content:
Hello Survivors,
We’re happy to report more progress on shipping THE WALKING DEAD: NO SANCTUARY around the world! Games are scheduled to be shipped from the factory in approximately two weeks to Shipwire’s hubs in Canada, Hong Kong (backers in Asia), and Australia (backers in Australia and New Zealand). Given travel times and schedules at these hubs, backer rewards in all these regions should start going out by late January, if everything goes according to plan.

campaign.story:
The officially licensed Evil Dead 2 Board Game is the tabletop experience Evil Dead 2 fans have been dying for--featuring at least 8 custom figures with art depicting the terrifying and iconic characters, monsters, and locales from the cult classic film. 2-6 players will work together in 60–90 minute sessions to gather pages of the Ex-Mortis while trying to survive demon attacks, supernatural events, and avoid turning into evil deadites themselves.
These dice will be constructed by Mike Pasquale of http://www.evildeadworkshed.com/. He recovered the wood from the original Evil Dead 2 set and will be signing the certificates of authenticity.
 More Add-Ons will unlock as the campaign goes on! To buy these Add-Ons, simply increase your pledge amount by how much is listed. After the campaign ends you will then be able to select your options through your Backerkit survey.
You'll play as your favorite Evil Dead 2 characters (and Jake) as you explore the cabin for missing pages of the Ex-Mortis. If you find all of the pages, you can open a portal to banish the Kandarian Demons and win the game. But you will have to face Deadites, demons, Ash’s Freaking Hand!, that tree, and the deadite versions of your fellow players to do it!
                        For the last year, Space Goat has been publishing the critically-acclaimed Evil Dead 2 comic book that cater to hardcore Evil Dead fans. Now we’re doing the same with the official-licensed board game. Space Goat is also the comic book industry’s premier production studio. We’ve provided art and creative services for Marvel, DC, Nike, Microsoft, Universal Studios, Riot Games, and Blizzard Entertainment. You can be sure that this premium box of Deadite-slaying goodness is in good hands.
Kickstarter is a fantastic tool not just for funding great projects, but for helping fans become aware those projects exist while getting them involved with the creative process. That’s what we hope to do with our Kickstarter campaign. Plus with the help of Evil Dead fans and Kickstarter we can add more bad ass miniatures, game play expansions, and extra Evil Dead greatness that we would never be able to offer without their help.  
Additionally, we want to reward hardcore Evil Dead fans by offering exclusives to Kickstarter backers, like a deluxe edition of the game with an Ex-Mortis box, which has miniatures of combat Ash and Deadite Henrietta. We want to make the best, most official Evil Dead 2 game possible, and we can only do that with your help.
Some of the top game and horror press outlets like Comic Book Resources, Deadites Online, HorrorFuel, iHorror, Bloody Disgusting, Popcorn Horror and MovieWeb have covered the game, and here's what other press has had to say about it:
"Our dream of giving deadite scum a fistful of boomstick from the comfort of our own living rooms is about to come a reality." - Dread Central
"An 'Evil Dead 2' card game is coming—and it looks super groovy" - The Daily Dot
"...an official tile and figure based survival game that every Evil Dead fan is going to want to own." -GoresTruly
"Much like a more bad-ass, interactive version of Clue.." - Wicked Horror
"[With} the idea that the players are working together but they can turn against their friends and you have an interesting concept for a game" - Beasts of War
"Smells like a cash-in." -Some guy on Reddit
"As unappealing as any form of game is to me at this point in life, I’d jump at the opportunity to pick this one up...I’m certain a great deal of genre fans would strangle a Deadite to get their hands on this beauty!" - HorrorFreak News 
"Here’s one that, I’m sure, will get a lot of people going, 'Oh, I’m soooooo going to be backing that!!'" - Tabletop Gaming News
"[It] looks like it will be a frightening twist on family game night." - Daily Dead
Here's a listicle from our boss you can read and share around social media.
Shipping will be charged after the Kickstarter ends based on actual shipping costs and is collected via Backerkit. This allows us to charge shipping fairly for all backers and avoid a 'one size fits all' mentality to shipping. 
Below are shipping estimates for the core game (estimated to be around 3lbs). These are just estimates. Costs may rise due to weight increase as more items are unlocked via stretch goals and add-on purchases you choose. This will be calculated by Backerkit after backer surveys are turned in.
USA - $20
EU (including UK) - $20.00
Canada - $20
AU - $35
Mexico - $35
Most other countries - $35
We proudly offer EU-Friendly shipping!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
====== 
License 
======

Evil Dead 2™: The Official Board Game has been developed by Space Goat Productions with full support and license from StudioCanal.

Products presented on this Kickstarter page and during the campaign may be subject to change in order to meet the expectations of the StudioCanal licensing agreement.

By pledging on this Kickstarter you acknowledge that the final look and contents of the pledges may change and differ from what is presented at the start of the campaign.

========= 
Challenges 
=========

This is our first Kickstarter project. But as a production company with decades of experience, we are aware of potential delays including production, shipping, customs, creation of art assets, and licensing approval.

We have estimated the delivery for November 2016 but please understand this is only an estimate. Due to the global logistics involved in shipping, some regions may receive their pledges sooner than others. We will, however, ensure a global release of any Evil Dead 2: The official Board Game products for retailers.

We have prepared as much as possible with our production for a successful Kickstarter, however we will refund pledges if for some unforeseen reason the game cannot be delivered at all.

======= 
Refunds 
=======

Refunds may be given within 60 days of the campaign ending including fees. After this time refunds may be given minus the Kickstarter and payment processing fees due to us not being able to claim them back after 60 days.

If we have begun the packaging and shipment stages of the project (around 6-8 weeks before the actual shipping date) we are unable to refund at this stage.

Refunds within 60 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit/debit card. Refunds after 60 days of the campaign ending are processed via PayPal only.

This is a USD Kickstarter and refunds will be processed in USD for the amount received, excluding any applicable fees dependent on the day at which the refund is processed as detailed above.

================= 
Terms and Conditions 
=================

If you do not confirm your shipping and pledge details within 10 weeks of our notification via email to confirm it will be treated as abandoned. We will however look at each case sympathetically and try our best to satisfy each customer.

By pledging on this Kickstarter you agree that our responsibility to you is for shipping your order as entered into the pledge management system. You are responsible for import or other duties that may be payable to relevant tax authorities. You also accept that you are fully liable for incorrect shipping details and will risk your pledge being unable to be delivered or lost in transit.

We are unable to ship to PO Boxes.

If you do not accept the proposed terms please do not pledge on this Kickstarter project and wait for the global general release.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear Backers -  
With the apparent failure of the equity crowdfunding campaign, we have taken a step back to regroup and consider a number of options. Some paths forward have been presented to us. We need a few weeks to find the best path forward. As soon as we find that best path forward, you all will be the first to know.  
Sincerely, Shon Bury

updates.update_userinfo: And Now a Letter from our Founder
updates.update_content:
Greetings Soul Suckers!
I come to you today with another update. I know we’re all probably still reeling from the news of the Ash vs. The Evil Dead cancellation...and Bruce’s subsequent retirement from the character, but the world of Evil Dead is going to live forever in a variety of ways...and I’m proud to be a part of one of them with this board game.

Greetings, Soul Suckers!
This week things have been firing on all cylinders here at the Space Goat Cabin, and we’ve been able to make some great progress in a variety of areas.
First, THE BOX!

Hello Everyone!
It's been a LONG week here at the cabin.  Vic and I spent a good deal of time this week sorting through how to do all of this as smoothly as possible -- Honestly, the Kickstarter system is fairly archaic with a number of things -- particularly how to handle direct messages when you are not the project owner.

Greetings, Deadites!
I’d like to introduce myself. I’m Michael. For the past 6 weeks, I’ve been managing the Terminator: The Official Board Game campaign for Space Goat. This week Space Goat also brought on board Victor, my lifelong friend and co-designer of Grim and Bitten, two games we have released through our publishing company Grim Games. Victor and I will be handling the Evil Dead 2: The Official Board Game campaign project and community management moving forward. We’re really excited to join the space goat team and work on these dream games.

updates.update_userinfo: Evil Dead Update - Weekly Updates + THE RULEBOOK!
updates.update_content:
Hello, Soul Suckers!
We hope everyone is having a good New Year so far. We've been busy organizing and proofing a number of things on our end as we push your game further down the manufacturing pipeline. Taylor will be back with updates next month, but in the meanwhile we have 2D asset PROOFS inbound from China.

campaign.story:
Huge UPDATE June 25: 
Now you can add a 3rd or 4th copy of the game to your rewards for +$18 each and no extra shipping charge!  Also help us out by clicking on this link and giving the box image a "thumbs up" and please share the campaign on your Facebook or Twitter account!
In Nerdy Inventions, you and your fellow players are inventors creating contraptions with the most powerful device known to man: DICE!
The art and game design for this game are by Chih-Fan Chen, the designer of Flip City and several other games!  He is an established designer from Taiwan.
  Limited Edition backers will get a hand-numbered sticker included with their game. Only 500 copies will have the Platinum Level Backer Sticker, so back now!
Early delivery to your door! Backers will get this game several weeks in advance of the release date, or even earlier!
Huge Savings! We expect the game to retail for $20-$25 USD, so you're getting the game at a discount off of the retail price. 
Free/Low Shipping! Shipping in the USA, China, Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore, and Taiwan is FREE, with subsidized shipping to the EU, Canada, and the rest of the world.
Stretch Rewards! We've got some great stretch rewards planned to improve the quality of the game, including upgrading to 300 gsm cardstock, reference cards, and more!
              Mayday is offering Limited Edition stickers to Platinum and Genius level backers. Be one of the first 500 backers to back Nerdy Inventions at the Genius or Platinum level and get a hand numbered Platinum sticker with your game!  
These stickers come separately with your game so YOU can choose what to do with it. Inside of your box? Sure! On your box so your gamer friends know you supported this game on Kickstarter? Why not?!
As copies disappear, additional levels will open up; including gold, silver, and copper at 500 copies each. Once all of those are gone, too, the unlimited copies won't come with any limited edition stickers.
                         Download the rulebook HERE.
                                     "When I first played this game in Tokyo, I was immediately drawn to it. I loved the replayability and the depth of choices this game packs into such a small package. I immediately knew we wanted to publish it and begged the designer to sign the contract. That's how powerfully we feel about this game. It's very solid and will be one that I will play for years to come. We believe it will be one of our top games along with Get Bit, Dead Man's Draw and Garbage Day. I'm so EXCITED for this, our 31st Kickstarter project!"  -Seth Hiatt, Mayday Games, Suzhou China                
"Nerdy Inventions is a sweet little steam punk themed dice roller." - Mike Vander Veen, BGG
""This was a game I was sure I was going to like. The art is simple but modern. The teal color used is nice. It is a dice game to try and get cards with points to eventually get the time machine to end and win the game. It was cute. I wouldn't mind trying again." - Steph, BGG
                  That silky-smooth linen finish!
             Please note that we are working on additional stretch goal possibilities, stay tuned!
  Shipping is calculated based on your country, so please pledge and enter the country you want your rewards delivered to.
Zone 1: Free shipping! USA, China, Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore, Taiwan
Zone 2: $2 shipping. Canada, EU
Zone 3: $4 shipping. Rest of the World
The game is lightweight and durable so the game will fit easily into a bubble mailer. We are also shipping all the rewards outside of the USA directly from our fulfillment warehouse in China to you. That means the rewards will get shipped quickly and efficiently.
Note that shipping will be from the USA for all US backers and all other rewards will ship directly from our fulfillment warehouse in China. We will state the direct manufacturing replacement cost on the customs form for all non-USA shipments, which means that even on a 2-pack shipment that your reward will fall well below the VAT/CUSTOMS/DUTY thresholds for you.
We have fulfilled several other projects in this same manner and our backers have happily had no issues getting their rewards duty-free due to the low cost of our games.
Will my shipment be traceable? I want a tracking number when it ships.
No, your shipment will not be traceable, it will show up as a first class package through your post office and those do NOT have tracking numbers. We can say that your reward will arrive in 7-30 business days after it ships. We can send you a screen shot of the shipping notice and confirm that it went out if it doesn't show up, but there is no tracking number. That is how we are able to offer such low shipping rates. 
If you want a tracking number, you can pay a little extra on your shipping service to get a tracking number. Here are the rates:
Tracking Number Add On:
Zone 1 (See countries above): +$1 more
Zone 2: +$1 more
Zone 3: +$2 more
I want my game shipped in a box instead of a bubble mailer.
We're quoting very cheap shipping because of the weight, and this specific game comes in a nice sturdy box. It's tough and we expect it will be able to handle the rough ride through the mail. Shipping the game in a box will add about 150 grams and another $0.30-0.60 in packaging to the cost of your shipment. 
If you want your reward to ship in a box rather than a bubble mailer, here are the rates: 
Shipping Box Add On:
Zone 1 (See countries above): +$2 more
Zone 2: +$3 more
Zone 3: +$4 more
I want both a tracking number and a box for my shipment.
No problem, just add both the costs for the shipping box and the tracking number. The totals to add on are:
Zone 1: $3 more
Zone 2: $4 more
Zone 3: $6 more
  We've had a lot of previous successful Kickstarter projects in the past. You'd think by now that we'd be set and not need to run such a project any more, right? Well, not so much. While Mayday has been successful, we're still very small with our cash is tied up in other projects. In fact, if you look at Mayday's early publishing history, we introduced just three new games in 2010 and 2011 before we discovered Kickstarter.  
Since utilizing Kickstarter, we've launched over 30 new games, and that is ALL thanks to backers like you. By using Kickstarter, we're able to gauge interest and get the game made in much larger quantities and with cheaper prices to our customers. This is a large part of why we were able to offer our last few projects at such a low price point. With this much stuff in the game and such a small company, this would only be possible with the support of the Kickstarter community.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 31st Kickstarter project, and it doesn't have any risks to speak of if we meet our goal. The factory is ready to publish and the art and layout has been completed. Any additionally needed changes should be completed prior to the end of the campaign. We've launched 30 prior Kickstarter projects.

Anyone missing anything at all from any prior project please send us a message here on Kickstarter and we'll get you replacements or other solutions as soon as possible. We've had over 33,000 backers, so we expect a few of you may have slipped through the cracks. Thanks again for all of the support!

We have a few partially undelivered KS projects at present, but we expect to have this one delivered on time. We're putting extra time into our forecast for delivery to ensure this project will NOT be delayed beyond the estimated delivery date.

For a list of prior campaigns please check here:

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bkBCeeQtxuCHymJ3-L1Bu9L26i_TqGQnNILzAe9Uafk/edit?usp=sharing

For a current list of the status of all our projects that are not fully fulfilled yet jump over to here:

https://www.maydaygames.com/pages/kickstarter
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: HIDE (Hidden Identity Dice Espionage) is LIVE on Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Being a spy for The Agency isn't all glitzy gadgets and huge paydays. You need to select your missions carefully, go undercover while trying to ferret out the competition's disguises, and if necessary, be the last one standing with the briefcase of secrets from your target at the end of the day.  
Mayday Games' latest project, the hidden identity deduction dice game HIDE (Hidden Identity Dice Espionage), puts you into the shoes of an agent for The Agency vying to either become the Legendary Agent or the richest at the end of the game by completing missions and eliminating the competition.

campaign.story:
Welcome to the Kickstarter campaign for Planetarium! We're really happy that you've decided to learn more about the game, and we'd love to have your support in making it a reality. Our ambition is to create a version of Planetarium full of fantastic art and top quality components, and the funds raised during this campaign will make that possible. We've already invested a lot of love, time and resources in the game and now with the support of backers we've hit our funding goal and the game will be made! 
We'd love you to be a part of the project too, and in appreciation we're discounting the game, and we've already added a load of fun and free bonuses for being part of the campaign! We also want everyone that would like the game to know about it, and have a chance to be a part of the campaign, so spreading the word on social media is a great help. You can find out a lot more information below, including ways to buy multiple copies, stretch goals, reviews and art that is being created during the campaign. And if you have any other questions, please feel free to message us! 
Thanks,
Stéphane Vachon (Designer) and Dann May (Game Salute Creative Officer and Art Director)
                               Play Free on Tabletopia
The game will be free to play on Tabletopia for the duration of the campaign (featuring prototype cards).
  Introduction to Game Play
PLAY

         Game Design and Development: Stéphane Vachon
Additional Design/Development, Art Direction, Graphics: Dann May
Illustration: Greg May
Development (Science Consultant): James Lewis
Production Management: Cody Jones
Playtesting/Special Thanks: Bryan Burgoyne, Jonathan Calleja, Allen Chang, Michael Coulston, Romain Enselme, Claudia Gutierrez ,Fabien Haond, Michael Fox, Guido Moyano Loyola, Anthony Sweet, Jon Tennant, Alex Wynnter, Adam Wyse, Dan Yarrington, and the many people that have played Planetarium at events.
... and every Kickstarter backer
    More art that has been created during the campaign...
    The shipping for different regions is:
U.S.A: $9
Canada: $12
European Union (include Switzerland, Liechtenstein, and Norway): $20
Asia, Australia, and most other locations: $35
If your location isn't listed when you back the project, please message us and we will add it (as a quirk of Kickstarter and shipping costs we need to add countries individually, as there are a few countries that incur unusual shipping costs). 
Would you like to order more than one copy of Planetarium? Teaming up with some friends to buy multiple copies can be a great way to reduce shipping costs (or to stock up on gifts!). To do this, pledge for one copy and pledge the following amounts (you will also be charged the standard shipping for your region, the extra shipping costs are bundled into the extra pledge amount).
For U.S Backers
2 copies, pledge $61 (+$9)
3 copies, pledge $94 (+$9)
4 copies, pledge $128  (+$9)
For Canadian Backers  
2 copies, pledge $63 (+$12)
3 copies, pledge $95 (+$12)
4 copies, pledge $128 (+$12)
For European Union (and UK) Backers   
2 copies, pledge $68 (+$20)
3 copies, pledge $102 (+$20)
4 copies, pledge $128 (+$20)
For Australian Backers  
2 copies, pledge $88 (+$35)  
3 copies, pledge $145 (+$35)  
4 copies, pledge $189 (+$35)
For other regions, or more copies, message us and we will do our best to work out a bulk deal for you.
We use ShipNaked.com, which means that the shipping of Planetarium is all customs-friendly. If your country doesn't appear on the shipping list, let us know and we will see if we can arrange for the game to be shipped to you.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Game Salute has delivered dozens and dozens of successful Kickstarter campaigns, and is a publisher of games recognized for their high quality components and production values.

While printing, shipping, and processing delays are always a possibility, we have set a reasonable delivery date that allows time to handle difficulties. That said, there is always a possibility that a project may be delayed for some reason, and of course, vice versa, should the games arrive before the estimated delivery date, we will send them out as soon as we receive them.

We're so confident that you'll enjoy Planetarium that we're backing it up with our Game Salute Guarantee. If you don't enjoy the game when you receive it, just send either back to our headquarters and we'll issue you a full refund, no questions asked.

Also, sometimes people may want to cancel their pledge after the campaign has ended, and that’s fine too. We can handle this for you – all we need is for you to email Support@GameSalute.com with your Kickstarter username and full real name. Please note: when we receive your funds, we only receive around 90% of what you paid thanks to various fees and charges, so we offer a 90% refund if you want to cancel your pledge.

Thanks for supporting Planetarium! You're awesome!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: We Invite You To Farlight Station!
updates.update_content:
Greetings backers,
We are so happy to see that games have been safely arrive and solar systems are already being built! Thank you to everyone who have be tweeting and messaging us pictures of them enjoying Planetarium. You are all stars!
We know that you all love outer space, and how could you not. Well we hope you will join us with our newest journey into the final frontier, !

Greetings Backers,
We are so excited to see that so many of you have already got Planetarium on your tables. For those who haven't received it yet, don't worry it's on its way. We received word today from Ship Naked that all of the shipments have been sent.
If anyone's game arrives damaged or missing pieces just fill out this form here and we will have replacements sent out to you.

Greetings backers!
I'm happy to inform you that we have received word that the packing and shipping process has begun. Here's the message from Ship Naked.
Thanks,
Chris

Greetings Backers,
Short update here. Just wanted to let you all know that Planetarium has shipped from the factory and heading to our distribution center. This means we are well on the path for our March delivery!
Once again we just want to say how grateful we are to all of you for supporting the project. We cannot wait to see these out in your hands.

Greetings Backers,
When we hit $27k, and thank you again for that, we added Planet Maxwell into the Sci-Fi Set. For those of you who don't know Planet Maxwell, it is the central location for one of our biggest games, Alien Frontiers.
Alien Frontiers was one of the first games that proved you could fund and produce good games with Kickstarter. Well now it's back for the 5th edition and we want to share it with you.
